name: Christophermichael James
text:
2020 may have slowed progress, but nothing could stop Blue's Bourbon & Brews from busting out in 2021. This impressive new Bar & Grill in the Pelham/ Hoover area is sure to be a favorite spot for anyone and everyone in Central Alabama.

The vibe is classy, modern, relaxing, and cool. Flat screen TVs line the wall behind the bar, LED lighting throughout, and seating is plentiful. There's a stage for live music, a large projector screen (with more planned) for televised events, and the open layout is inviting for large social crowds and groups of friends. If you fancy yourself more of a wallflower, there's still some dark and cozy corners for first dates or fun conversation.

Outdoor patio seating is just over the horizon, and there's a separate game room area with pool tables, dart lanes, pinball, and other arcade classics. There's two sets of bathrooms and the entire place is extremely clean and neat. The owner clearly put a lot of heart and thought into the design, layout, and decor. He's got style.

There's an ATM just inside the door and multiple points of sale at the bar for quick service. Behind the bar you'll find fully stocked beer coolers with great variety of crafts and classics; there's something for every palate. Soda guns, wines, liquors, and of course, an impressive selection of bourbons and whiskey. The grill menu offers selections of various made-to-order flatbread pizzas, fries, sandwiches, and some thiccc & delicious burgers. 😉 Check out the list of signature cocktails and try something fun, refreshing, and new!

Bring your boyfriend(s), girlfriend(s), wives, husband(s), mister(s) and mistress(es) to Blue's Bourbon & Brews for a great date night, or pull up a barstool and make yourself one of the "regulars". I see big things in this new local spot's future. Come to Blue's, you won't be disappointed.

Check them out on Facebook at BLUES BAR.

name: Jamal Jamal
text: Made an to go order through my Applebee's app and requested curbside service. Paid for the order through the app. Parked in the designated curbside parking spot and was told my orders would be ready by 5:13 pm. I sit there from 5:08 to 5:30. I finally call inside and ask if my order was ready. The lady says it is. I tell her I requested it curbside. She says oh, just pull up next to the door and I will bring it to you. I tell her I'm already outside and have been for the past 20 minutes. She brings out my food. My bag didn't contain any napkins or utensils, but never mind that, it was the least of my worries. I ordered the apple chunk pork chop, or something like that, with a baked potato and pecan sweet potatoes. Baked potato came with no side of butter and sour cream and I was PISSED when I got home to find out that the only reason I ordered the pork chop was for the apple chunk sauce only to find out there was no apple chunk sauce under my pork chop like in the picture and I swear they gave me the smallest pork chop they had in stock. I also ordered the butcher meat and potatoes. It was acceptable. If you order your food to go, make sure you go in and get it because apparently the workers don't even know about their own curbside service and make sure you examine your order before leaving.

resp.text: Jamal Jamal, we are incredibly sorry about your Carside ToGo visit. Our Guest Relations Team would like to follow up with you about your experiences - please call us at 888-592-7753. We’re open from 7am until 7pm central time Monday through Friday or email guest.relations@applebees.com. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback.  ~Susie

name: Cari Milton
text: I met my friend on a one-hour lunch break. We were seated. No one came to take our drink orders for, no exaggeration, literally 30 mins. We stopped someone to ask to be helped, and pressed "call server" on the device on the table, both to no avail. By the time the server finally arrived, we were ready to place both our drink and food orders. Another ten minutes pass before my water arrives; ten more minutes pass before my friend gets his drink. Another thirty minutes later, my friend's food arrives and my bowl of soup. I reminded the waitress that I ordered wings. She said she forgot to put the order in. She went to put the order in. When she came back, she said she gave them to another table and had to put the order in again. Then, on the third attempt, she brought boneless wings. I ordered traditional bone-in wings. By this time, we had been at Applebee's for over two hours... way beyond my allotted one hour for lunch break. I asked how long it would take to bring the correct wings. She said 5 minutes. She took the boneless wings back and  I waited even longer for the correct wings. All this time, I'm watching my friend eat, I'm in a hurry, and my soup was too hot to eat. I had taken a bite and it scalded the roof of my mouth. The waitress then overcharged me for the wings which were that day's "Special". She charged me double. She went to correct my ticket, taking up even more time. All my food ended up in To-Go containers and I didn't eat any lunch after taking 2.5 hours for my lunch break.

resp.text: We are so sorry about this. Our Guest Resolutions Team would like to follow up with you about your visit - please call 402-858-8320 or send an email to GuestResolutions@rmhfranchise.com and share your experience & restaurant visited.  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback.  ~Susie

name: Chris Jay
text: Saturday night the host pulled out a gun on a customer and followed them out to their car and then went back in to hide. A server called the police and told everyone to leave the building while a manager asked her who she was on the phone with, to make sure word didn't get spread. Managers didn't think to check on the employees or the patrons after. Not even the GM, Joe. The director of operations, Carl, immediately told them not to close before the host had even been arrested and before checking to see if everybody was ok. Then said if anybody talks to the media they are fired! Doesn't feel like a great place to go out to eat especially since management has been made aware before this that the host had done the same thing before.

resp.text: Chris Jay, we appreciate and understand your concern about this isolated incident from this past weekend. The safety of our guests and team members is our highest priority. We are in contact with the authorities and are cooperating to thoroughly investigate. As this is an ongoing police investigation, we cannot comment further. Thank you.

name: Jfresh gang
text: Well, where do I begin. Walking into the Applebees on Airport Blvd we asked the hostess about the meals on the 2 for $20 special his reply was, umm I don't know. Moving on to the next issue at hand which was our waiter, she possessed NO customer service skills at all. She took the orders and sent someone else out to the table which had first no idea who the food went to at the table and he left. We waited 15 more minutes with no utensils to eat the food with. I mean who does that? We were given plastic utensils and were told that they were out of silverware. Oh, might add that on the 2 for 20 over half of the meals that were offered they were out of. I thought is this an April fool joke but it wasn't a joke at all they were for real. My mother's other meal from her 2 for 20 we took home with us. Just curious we opened the take home meal to find food that didn't even cover the bottom of the plastic plate. So, the choice was to leave it on the table or take it home to the dog. With all of this being said, you might want to think long and hard about the 2 for 20 special, not just hear but anywhere. The cheapest meal is not always the best meal.

resp.text: We are so sorry about this. Our Guest Resolutions Team would like to follow up with you about your visit - please call 402-858-8320 or send an email to GuestResolutions@rmhfranchise.com and share your experience & restaurant visited.  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback.  ~Susie

Well once we received our food (one at a time) we were ready to go. And guess what.....they didn't even have to go boxes. The server who was really nice had to take our food to the back to wrap in plastic wrap! No manager came out to apologize and when I called this morning he seemed to not even care. I will never go back to the Applebees on Airport Blvd again! Very disappointed!☹

name: Raven Crockett
text: I had a waiter who walked away with my husbands military ID for a discount and she never gave it back. She also took more than 20 minutes away from use with our credit cards. This however wasn't the biggest problem. When I called to tell the restaurant that my husband never received his ID back and that I'd like them to get it back a women answered the phone saying she (my waiter) was never suppose to leave the table with the ID, only look. (But that's not what happened) she sent a male to check on it and came back with 30 seconds saying there was no ID, but that's okay. I thought that if I called back the next day maybe I could get the server and ask her if she accidentally placed it in her pocket or even a worker who was actually willing to look. The hostess who answered told me that she (my former waiter) wasn't there at the moment I said okay that's fine, are you allowed to tell me when she'll be in or no? She says "ummm hold on" (if the answer is no, a simple no is fine) she then puts a very upset male on the phone he begins to talk and says "yea this is Mark!!" (Whom I didn't ask for) I said hi sir, I was calling trying to see if [name] was in today. He says" well  [name] who??!!!!" I said I'm sorry I don't know her lastname she was my server. And he said interrupting "well we don't have a [name] that's works here bye!" The hostess had already confirmed she works there by saying she wasn't in at the time and so did her name tag, so the uneccessary lie was weird to me. Mister Mark is also the same man that said he would look for my husbands ID card and was away from the phone for not even 1 minute. This place has the WORST customer service I have ever wistnessed.

resp.text: Raven, we apologize to hear about this situation.  Please email our Guest Relations Team, feedback@rmhfranchise.com, and provide the details of your visit as well as your contact information so someone can reach out to you to discuss and rectify the situation.  Thank you.

text:
Best wings in mobile hands down!! I personally go every Thursday to get the wing special - 1 basket of Sprite Pepper wings 1 basket of Citrus Chipotle with a side of Loaded Tots.

The rest of the food is decent. Service is slow but this is a family owned and operated restaurant - get use to it!

name: Thomas De Santi
text: menu selection is creative. service speed is beyond slow. over 90 minutes for our meal.

name: Joanne Luterman
text: Gave me wrong burger; got it confused with my friend's . Mine was way too peppery and I ate half maybe; Mike tasted the other half and figured out the problem.  Should have adjusted the bill but that didn't happen and I paid full price for a half burger I hated. Not going back anytime soon.

name: Ben Brenner
text:
I really wanted to like Benjamin's.  The menu and especially the burgers are inventive and intriguing, the location is great for us mid-towners, and the building has a special charm to it.  As stated elsewhere, the service is not professional.  At brunch recently, we waited 20 minutes before we saw a waiter.  We waited another 10 minutes after we were finished eating before we were able to get our check.  The staff are all friendly enough, just don't seem to know how to properly wait on tables.

The Food....    Best thing on the menu I've tried is the burgers... but there are cheaper better burgers elsewhere in midtown.  I suppose it is the only place you can get a burger sandwiched between two donuts, but then again, why would you want a burger sandwiched between two donuts?  The Red Beans and Rice (even though it was recommended) was the worst red beans and rice I've ever had. It completely lacked in flavor.  Recently, at brunch, their complementary beignets, were gooey and and not cooked well.  I tried their fries with shredded chicken wings and cheese... it was ok but am not a fan of their wing sauce.  Then I had their special of the day, a breakfast bowl.  I should have known from the description, it wasn't going to be good. It completely lacked in flavor. My partner in crime ordered the meatloaf cupcakes and was served a grayish brown pile of mushy meatloaf and spuds with gravy.  Kind of disgusting and no flavor.  Also disappointing was the quality of coffee and their bloody marys which didn't have a good flavor or bite.

They have a decent beer selection but their craft beers are $6 and up a pint. Kind of rich for my taste.

All in all, I really hope they are able to get things fixed. I think in trying to find their niche, they've focussed more on an inventive menu than quality food. I'll stick to the restaurants with quality and flavor than wacky combinations.

The steak was cooked to perfection, the Shrimp were battered & cooked to perfection. I ordered onion rings with the steak & they brought me a baked potatoes only bad thing I can say about the whole experience but they brought the onion rings & they were delicious. If your visiting Talladega I strongly recommend this Restaurant! Worth the money for sure!

name: Blayne Newsome
text: I Was in Lincoln for work. I was there for only a couple of nights. I had never been there before so I googled restaurants near me. Myself and my significant other decided to try the Magnolia restaurant. I chose the shrimp scampi from quite an extensive menu. She decided on chicken Parmesan. We absolutely loved it. The prices were moderate but the quantity and quality of the food was outstanding. I felt a little guilty for eating 5-star food for a 3-star price. We made sure to return the next night. We ate early on Monday evening and Tuesday evening about 5:00 pm each evening. Both nights I was somewhat shocked at the sparcity of the restaurant attendance. I know very little about the area and I know it was late January, but come on Lincoln, Talledega, Oxford, Sylacauga and yes even Birmingham, don’t deny yourselves a wonderful culinary experience.

name: Ferman Smith
text:
We intended on visiting a different bar and found they were closed so decided to visit this one.

For some reason it had an intimidating look from all of the bikes parked outside but we were pleasantly surprised. The bartender was extremely friendly even though she knew we were from out of town and was not only prompt but welcoming and very kind.

The drinks were moderately priced and the bar food was pretty good considering the fact it was actually bar food. 😂

The patrons were also friendly and were extremely laid back.

The atmosphere was rock and there was a variety of music playing. It was refreshing to listen to music new and old as well as being able to play the jukebox remotely via the TouchTunes app.

If you're looking for a fun bar off the main grid, give this one a shot. I assure you that you won't be disappointed.

name: luv for evs Benjamin-Dobbins
text: Horrible experience.  Food decent but the service was sub-par! I went there for lunch with 2 work colleagues.  I spoke with the General Manager about finding something (I didn't order/put in my bowl) that wasn't supposed to be in it.  He basically argued with me, never apologized and was very rude. My colleagues and I were shocked (especially since we were all in hospitality/hotel management).  I sent an email to their corp. office and found out it was a franchise. The lady at the corp. office was VERY nice and apologetic for his rude behavior. I asked to be contacted on a Regional or Ownership level and never heard from anyone.  I sent another email to corp. office expressing how discontent I was that no one even contacted me.  So now I'm posting the experience everywhere.  And it could have all been avoided with some very simple, good old fashioned, CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

This is a great stop after a day on the boat.

name: Matt
text: This was my first trip to Lucy's Barge. I immediately asked myself how Ive missed out on  this for all these years?? If you enjoy the beachfront restaurant/bar vibe, you will definitely like Lucy's. The atmosphere is t-shirt, shorts and flipflop friendly. Great food, drinks and cornhole broads. Beachfront atmosphere on the river!

name: Ashley Shepherd
text: It was a nice place to take a break out on the river....easy entrance from a boat. It wasn't to crowded on a sunday...the employees were very friendly and helpful. The bathrooms were very clean and to my surprise it had a/c as I was not expecting because the restrooms are not connected to the restaurant area. The food was good...so all in all I give this spot a 5 out of 5 and will definitely be back!!

Great food and they also have some merchandise up front

name: Kid Kid
text: Horrible food! Fifteen people in our party one of the burger's was spoiled several ordered the nachos that taste like kerosene and they wouldn't even remove the burger from the ticket we spent over 500 dollars but didn't matter I give three stars for atmosphere

name: Emily Miles
text:
Horrible hygiene issues, poor customer service....

Not only myself but several people who were with me witnessed a waitress wash her hands off with the water option on the fountain drink dispenser after she stood at the bar eating fruit from the container that held fruit for drinks. As soon as we seen that happen we told them to cancel our food (which still came and we handed it back) and handed back a drink that wasn’t even touched.  Yet we still had a $45+ ticket to pay and for things we didn’t touch and that clearly had issues. Not only that both the bartender and “manager” stated  it was no BIG deal....Which I beg to differ and I can assure you the health department would aswell.

Sadly this is the only place close to us as we live on the water....I can’t count the times we’ve gotten boat gas here much less the timea we’ve ate or stoped by for a drink. Not to mention sliping a boat here. However, I can say I will NEVER EVER step foot I’m this place again!

text: Went there this afternoon and sat for 2 hours and never received our food. When asked about when it would be there, was told I don’t know. After we were leaving, a waitress got in my face and told me not to say anything about how long it took because her sister was running the kitchen and she was doing it as fast as she could. All while the manager of the Barge stood there and watched. Then I was told I need to leave. After we left,  3 other tables left as well. I don’t know who owns the establishment but I would humbly suggest if you want to continue to make a profit off of this place(which is a great investment). Have a manager that understand the food industry and knows how to handle customers complaints. DO NOT LET WAITRESS GET IN CUSTOMERS FACES THROWING UP HANDS LIKE THEY WANT TO FIGHT.

name: Destini Duren
text: I am usually not one to complain considering I have been in the restaurant buisness for awhile. I have to say that the lady taking care of us was absolutely the nicest lady however, the dirty pearl used to be THE PLACE and I am assuming being under new management has changed that. We went in and had to order at the bar to sit down with our children we paid 2.50 FOR A CAN drink witch I find ridiculous and  that was flat! The seafood gumbo had only sausage in it.  We had two plates come out and waited a good 7/8 minutes for a salad to come out that was supposed to be grilled and was fried then after about 10 minutes our shrimp plate come out so the last person was left eating alone. The food ABSOLUTELY not worth the $60 spent .

name: Troy Walbaum
text:
I've eaten here several times scattered about the time this place has been open.
- Service:
The service has been abysmal every time, and not due to being busy. I went one time when my party and I were the only patrons and it still took 15 minutes to get a drink order, 30 minutes to get a food order, and over an hour to get our food. I got my appetizer less than five minutes before my entree. Another person at my table got his appetizer after he got his entree. We both ordered the same appetizer that could have been prepared all at once (fried pickles).
- Food:
It's not that good. I've tried a variety of things. The oysters are about like any other oyster place. Everything else is either okay or not good. Being too salty seems to be a common thread. Absolutely not worth the wait.
- Price:
A bit on the expensive side for this kind of place.
- Bar:
The only redeeming feature. It's poorly stocked, but has a good atmosphere.
- Overall:
I simply don't come here anymore unless I'm meeting people, and even then I'll try to convince them to go somewhere else. The only exception is the bar. I don't mind the bar. But food-wise? Absolutely not. Luckily, most people have realized the only thing worse than the food is the service, so I don't have to convince people to meet somewhere else much anymore.

name: Thomas Hutchins
text: Food was good and service was good. We had a decent sized group and only one thing got messed up. I have to say, I didn't expect it to be as good as it was.

name: Brian Parsons
text: This is definitely not the Dirty Pearl of old. Change in management has brought the Pearl to a screeching halt. From poorly prepared plates to slow, inattentive service, this restaurant ranks at the bottom of my list. On 12/23/2017 my wife and I got served poor oysters, oil logged fries, and a $71.00 bill to boot. The waitress was doubling as help in the kitchen and was out of communication most of the meal. Dinners beware! You will pay for what you'd wish you'd get, get what you'd never want to eat and made to do all, alone as they will not even hold your hand to make it all the more palatable.

text: Fantastic food. Mac n cheese is phenomenal. Gouda grits are to die for. The staff are courteous and the decor is soulful. Plenty of great beer and a well designed outdoor play area for dogs and kids.

name: Cat Johnston
text: Good mix of food items offered. Burgers are outta this world, especially the fantabulous Tony Burger! Food always hot and fresh. Interesting and cute owl decor.

name: Chelsea Rainey
text: We have eaten dinner here two nights in a row. The Cheesy Crawfish Tater Bake is amazing! Burgers are too! Actually there's not been anything on the menu that we haven't liked. Not crazy about the Mexican cornbread that they bring to the table, but I'm not that in to cornbread anyway. Atmosphere is great with helpful and enthusiastic servers!

name: Arlene Dean
text: Cold & undercooked food. Waitress, Lindsay, as she yelled it to us, never mentioned the cocktail menu even though she paced by our table 9 times to hang with her fellow wait staff at the bar before we ordered. A response of "I don't know. Eat a salad." when I asked if there were any vegetarian plates (many restaurants here prepare them but don't have them on the menu. Clearly not this one.) Didn't advise us of any specials, and only brought half of one of our party's meal out.  The fish was so cold, we were grateful we didn't purchase one of the $23 plates.  The prices do not match the atmosphere, nor the service, nor the lack of cleanliness.  When we located a cocktail menu, there was something sticky all over it.  Luckily another waitress brought out the rest of our party's meal. It was the only properly cooked & warm item we received. After sharing our experience with locals we found out most people only go here for occasional drinks, not the food, but since we weren't even advised of the drink menu I can't even recommend that.  If you have any type of health conditions or are trying to eat healthy, I recommend an avoidance of this establishment.

name: Andrew Hendon
text: A great, locally owned restaurant with excellent food and a cool atmosphere. Cost is on target with a nice chain restaurant, but the food is much better than any chain. Recommend the burgers, shrimp poboy, and shrimp creole.

name: Tara Gardner
text: Love this so cool restraunt!! Everything on the menu is great. Appetizers are off the chain!! 04/30/2018 edit:  This restaurant is now closed.

name: Jake Yde
text: While the food was decent it was also over priced. We really weren't expecting to pay over $75 for a 3 person meal. How is that fair pricing? There was absolutely no alcohol on the ticket either to increase the price. Together we ordered a burger, pasta, and the catch of the day, three soft drinks, two sides, nothing extravagant.  As far as service as soon as the check was brought out my glass remained empty with the server never noticing. It was like once they had their money the service was gone. I personally do not intend on returning.

name: Jennifer Ireland
text: Everything was awesome! We were greeted very pleasant hostesses and our server all about it (as my teenagers said)! Will definitely recommend it to everyone.

name: C K
text: Outstanding beer selection and the menu is great.  However the service has gone down and prices up.

name: Jeremy Thompson
text: Easy going atmosphere and the food was great. Also dog friendly!

name: Albert Becker
text: Great Place. Good but not amazing food, great beer selection, nice seating outside with live music from time to time and the best is that they have a bounce castle outside. If you are with kids they will love it!

name: Holly Younce
text: Went here two weekends ago and the service and food were horrible except for the mac n cheese. We were there for almost 2 and a half hours. 30 minutes waiting on a table, 45 minutes waiting to order and receive our food. 30 minutes to eat and then another 45 minutes to get our check. When I expressed our dissatisfaction with the very unprofessional looking "manager" on duty he just said, "Sorry, we're busy tonight". This is the second terrible experience my family has had there. We were hoping the last visit was just a fluke. We definitely won't be back.

name: Kristin van't Hoff (kvanthoff)
text: Owner, Tony Nicholas has stepped up his game substantially. Went for brunch last Sunday and it was spectacular. Have dined here previously and was less than impressed, but I have to say they have done a great job in improving food quality as well as the quality of service. I ordered the Owl Benedict, their take on eggs benedict with a crawfish and alligator patty, fried green tomato, red tomato, bacon, poached egg and hollandaise sauce. It was divine! Our table also shared the oyster sampler platter, which I highly recommend. The blue cheese and bacon, egg, and cheese oysters were our favorites. Would definitely recommend dining here for brunch to any and everyone. I have noticed major changes in the past month at this restaurant and it is great to see this place restoring itself back to it's glory days.

name: Katie Champion
text: The food was terrible. One piece of sausage on a hard piece of french bread. Claimed to be a bbq sausage poboy, the sauce was in a cup on the side.  The onions were a mystery,  as some were bright purple and raw, while others were black and overcooked. $10 for the strange sandwich with about 3 fries. They were out of the first 4 or 5 things we tried to order. They had an extensive beer menu, but were also out of several lines of beer. It took forever to get our measley food. Would not recommend based on all of these things.

name: Robert Harding
text: Having seen the overflow crowds, I was naturally curious what the restaurant was like. After finally going for lunch today, I can say with certainty that this place is vastly overrated. Based on the menu selections, it's supposed to be a quasi-Cajun/Creole place. Dishes such as crawfish pasta and alligator are represented on the menu, however there are two big problems. First, the food is incredibly bland. Having eaten in New Orleans more times than I can remember, I would say the chef has toned down the food to cater to a broader (i.e., non-New Orleans) audience. The result is less than stellar. Second, the prices are way over the top. $15 for a simple pasta dish with only a couple of crawfish in the sauce is beyond the pale. The place is attractive enough and the service pleasant, but not enough to justify the emptying of my wallet on mediocre food. I'll not be returning so long as I'm paying.

name: Deena Robinson
text: Seriously 2 families in the restaurant. One family was done the other had menus. Had to wait to be seated. Not sure why. We were seated by the cook. As soon as we sat down 2 other families came in. The waiter seated everyone then took everyone's order at the same time. Now I am no expert but I would think you should take a order turn it in and then go to the next person in line. But no, he took all 3 orders and turned them in. Well he later came out and told us that all orders came up at the same time.  REALLY YA THINK? Still no expert but he gave everyone else's order first then we received  ours last sad because the chips were cold and soggy. The poboy was bland. My concern here is not necessarily the food because it was O.K. but the service was disappointing and we were discouraged. We have decided that we will return to the arcade and bowling lanes but will just go to Mc Donalds for lunch.

text: Happy hour was pretty good until the checks came. Apparently not everyone was on the same page. When I called the day before it was all alcohol drinks and apps half price from 330 to 7. They were out of the two beers that we ordered and After reviewing the checks the beers were $1 off. Not a big deal, just frustrating after verifying the day before and when we arrived.

text: LOVE Jesse's!!!  Went there two weeks ago. Chuck cooks the best Delmonico Steak in the universe. And the service was great. Can't wait to go back.

name: Louise Czapala
text: Service was good, but disappointed with the food.  Ordered the cod plate and fish pieces were extremely thin and dry. Only one small piece was actually juicy enough to enjoy.  Truthfully have had better at Captain D's!  6-8 pieces of accompanying asparagus were tasty, but not as big around as a pencil. This visit was on Friday, September 4.  Had much better experience on previous visit. However, due to recent experience & after taking note of some other reviews, it seems management may not take customer complaints too seriously.  Several friends & I will not be returning!

name: abby stiff
text: Went to eat there the other night. It took a few minutes to get out drinks. Service was prompt and food was great. Then desert came out. I ordered a slice of chocolate cheesecake and after taking a bite I noticed something green on the side of it. It was mold. Once I got the servers attention she was way more apologetic than the manager was. Our meal should have been compted in total, but the manager felt taking the desert off was good enough. I do not recommended this place. I will not be going back. The manager stood behind the out server as our server clearly cared more and understood that food was brought out with MOLD on it. If I could give it negative stars I would. So disappointed.

name: J T
text: The best kept secret in Hoover. I really enjoy this place. From the appetisers to the deserts, everything is top notch and they have options for most every palate or dietary preference. My favorites are the nachos, French onion soup, the French dip sandwich, the Jesse's special and the prime rib. They have specials all week like happy hour and ladies night.. They also run a lot of specials during football season. Great proximity to the movie theater, an excellent compliment to a movie for date night. Seriously, give this place a try. It is excellent.

name: Kenneth Wallace
text: Took my sister in law there for a drink and birthday dessert. Absolutely loved it. Very nice restaurant.  Our server Brett made our first experience there a wonderful night. I recommend you try it out and ask for him...BRETT.

name: Holly ballish
text: It was my anniversary and I wish they offered some sort of thing for celebrations. Which is fine that they didn't because we still chose to eat there, but our waiter was very rude. He would ask us if we needed anything but never stopped walking so it was very hard to talk to him. I was upset that he didn't even seem that busy and treated us like we didn't matter. If I went out all the time I guess this wouldn't have been as bad as I am making it but we have a baby and don't get very much time alone and I was really looking forward to this dinner and it wasn't great nor was it even good.

name: Derma Laser Clinic
text: Great steaks and seafood!  The building inside is beautiful and the entrees are really unique to Birmingham.  We loved it!

name: choon heo
text:
Today, we went to this place at 6:00pm.
The bread was cold so, another one was served by our request. Then we ordered a nacho chilli as an appetizer, I was more disappointed on this than on bread because it was wet and tastes like it was reheated from left over. We always had a good experience here and order almost same one every time along with steak. But today after I lost my appetite from my cold bread and messy nacho, I ordered a sandwich and took home. I miss that crispy nacho with cheesy one.

resp.text:
Hi Choon,

I'm sorry you had a bad experience recently.  We try our best to give all of our customers a great experience, though we know we do make mistakes occasionally.  If you're open to it, we'd love to take care of you on your next visit.  If you will reply privately we can arrange something for you.  Email 360businessreviews@gmail.com with contact information or a name and we'll let you know what to do next.  Again, we apologize for the problems you experienced and we'll do our best to make it up to you.  Take care

text: This place was awful and I will never visit again and will tell my friends and family as well service was terrible and the food sucks and extremely over priced... TWO THUMBS DOWN!!!!!!

text: My wife and I had dinner (if you could call it that) at Jesse's in Hoover last evening.  I ordered the mahimahi fish.  First the salad was brought out that look and tasted like it was made the day before, then the fish which was served, ordered Greek style, it tasted like frozen white fish with seasoning sprinkled over it.  What a disappointment!

name: Will Mauz
text: 5 of my friends and I went to eat here October 17th. It was 35 minutes before we got our orders placed, several drunks were arguing at the bar LOUDLY, and that, sadly was not nearly the worst of it. After waiting for our food, now into an hour and a half, (We arrived at 8 :30 pm, our food hit our table after 10:30) we come to find our food had been dropped and was being "remade" When it hit our table, my friends Chip and Sara noticed their steaks were wrong, my shrimp was cold, and my buddy Seamus's burger was prepared incorrectly. After a few minutes, the meal went further south. Chip's steak had a distinct chemical taste to it, like it had been sprayed with oven cleaner. Sarah's had so much grit it was like they just picked it off the floor. Think that could be it? Nope. We began readying to leave at 11:30, only for Sarah and Chip to start puking, and me to have severe bowel discomfort. (I had one bite of her steak to test it, and I'm grateful for only that one.) They were sick until Sunday, vomiting and diarrhea. THIS was a $40 per plate place? THAT'S not even the end. Chip actually CALLED them to talk to the DM, and you know what the Manager told him? We shouldn't have complained about the time they were taking. REALLY GUY? NEVER EAT HERE. Go to Longhorn or somthing, because THESE morons might kill you.

I have tried to get them to fix this but NO response. It’s really sad I hate writing reviews but people have to know.

The dj has quite a selection from nsync to I don't know what...pretty packed when I went so it would seem they are doing good for themselves...but I would not recommend it.

text: Hate It! They act like they have  a dress code but they don't it a skin color code and only allow red necks. its so sad but true. hate this place and will never go back

name: Dee Hem
text: This bar (not a club) is bias on its patrons. They, just like most of the establishments in the Huntsville Downtown district, are catered to a "certain" crowd. Weekly, the dress-code for access changes without any prior notification, mainly because this establishment has no clear guidelines of dress and make the judgements clearly on how they feel that morning. If you are in a group and you do not fit into their certain demographic regardless of dress in accordance, they will refuse service. Groups of certain people of a party over ten have to walk up to the doors in two people teams just to be allowed admittance, only to be followed the entire night. The barkeep would only allow one drink at a time (shot) versus other groups were allowed over several at one time.  It is unfair and it becomes an issue when this business is using business arbitrary rights to hide behind a discriminatory agenda. I will be reporting this business to the BBB.

name: LISA GRADY

name: Dallas Reese
text: I was able to play here last Saturday with some family. What an awesome place. We came with a group of 11. The owner is super friendly and was extremely accommodating to a large, unruly group. (Hey! I have to give my In-laws a hard time.) The owner actually came out and played against us and soundly beat us. This is the real deal. Real lasers and not RF (radio frequency). The "battleground" is well laid out and has a ton of room to maneuver. There are some "tricky" twists in the form of "bases," but you need to go play to find out about that. I highly recommend this as a great group, individual, or family outing. There were kids and adults playing with us. The game is monitored by security cameras, so that is an added safety feature. We have needed a place like this in Prattville for a long time. I would give this place more stars if that was an option. Thanks to the owner for giving us such a wonderful time. Please go try it out for your self! Not overly expensive, fun, entertaining, and an awesome time almost guaranteed. Support Local!

resp.text: Thank you. I hope to see all of you again!!!

text: The place has improved quite a bit recently. Before the boneless wings would be too crispy now they are much better and the sauce tastes a lot more fresh. Still a bit pricey but all in all improvements have been made

name: Cam Mackenzie
text: Terrible. Ordered appetizers that never came, but were delivered as sides instead. The order took forever to actually come out, and two people were missing orders. Drinks were never refilled, and at some point, we resulted to refilling our own, all while some five servers watched us do it. And still didn't refill our waters later until we asked. The food tasted bad. So bad. The chicken was cold and tasted not much unlike what I would imagine to be sweaty playground rubber chips. We normally go to the one in Jones Valley, which is great, but this one was far from it. I'm trying to put it into words, but all I can do is say it's the restaurant equivalent of a very warm and a very soggy salad. We were charged for food we didn't order. Meanwhile, the stool had maybe three tables of people and that's it. All the while, the wait staff stood at the front and talked.

name: S Lee
text: We traveled over an hour to shop in Huntsville only to end up waiting for food we never received for an hour. Out of all the food options in Huntsville we chose BWW and for that we blame ourself. NEVER again. This restaurant is representative of the deserted mall it is housed in. There were tons of servers doing nothing but waiting on the next patron to dart the door and none ever noticed we were not being served. We were two tables away from the host desk and the restaurant was not busy. After the extensive wait and seeing the cooks(I assume) look out the kitchen window, we hit the door. So frustrated we did not even shop. I guess everyone needs to experience the worst service ever and for us this was it! Unbelievable! How are they still in business?

name: ray ray whitty
text: Oh man. What a **Itty place. HORRIBLE SERVICE! I am not a complainer,  but this place had me pissed off. I watched 3 different tables of people leave before they even got their drinks. 30 mins later we get our drinks, and 45 minutes after that we get our room temp wings, with hardly any sauce on them. The waitresses looked greasy and disgusting. The manager was incompetent and full of excuses. I WILL NEVER GO BACK. EVER.

name: Tara McDonald
text: Took forever to get our food even though it wasn't busy. Service was unfriendly. And worst of all, they served my 2 yr old bad oranges. She described them as too spicy and they were! Nasty!Nas

name: Travis Specht
text: Ignored the othr reviews, bad idea.  Ordered by phone, get there and the order is wrong (surprise considering the girl on the phone was super short and hungup right away when I was done ordering without repeating).  Waited an extra 10 minutes to get it fixed. I get home and they didn't include any of the sauces that were supposed to come with my sampler ap and there was no sauce on my sandwich.  Not like there was very little sauce, there was almost no sacue at all (the bun was even clean and dry).  Called back and the girl said she was back there when they made the sandwich and there was sauce on it but it must have come off while it was under the heat lamp.  She offered to put me down for a food credit but I'm not from huntsville so that's useless and even if I were why would I want credit for more crappy quality food? There were some solid employees (the femal assistant manager was really nice) but the bad quality control and the lazy employees make this the worst bww I've been to.  Waste of $30.

name: Jermel Carr
text: This is a franchise..so wings on Tuesday are more expensive than the company owned chain... $0.75 (is that a deal?). Asked for Tito's or Absolute and they did not have either (basic vodka?..took wings over 30 minutes to come out and asked for a beer at 11:30 when they close at 12..and they said the bar was shut off. 2 stars is being kind...this is the worst!!!!

text: One of the best places to shoot some pool and hang out with friends. The staff is awesome and will take great care of you. They have a great drink selection and they also have a small kitchen that pumps out one of the best club sandwiches in Pelham.

name: Robert Chambers
text: I went to papa g’s tonight to shoot a few games and check the place out. They have a great atmosphere and really good tables. There’s no smoking inside which was even better. Very clean, everything neat and in place. Plenty of room around the tables to shoot and good lighting over the table. The pro shop really does good work, had him install a new tip for me, he took his time and made sure it was right(sorry can’t remember his name). They also have a nice selection of cues in house competitively priced. I will definitely be going back.

text: Huge pool hall. Prices are great, for the regular tables. Wasn't properly informed on prices for 9 foot tables. Overall, a great place to play. Staff was very friendly.

You will love it and I... promise u will come back for the 2nd, and 3rd and so on..  God bless

name: Carloss fu
text: website said 6$ a table, rude lady said 6$ per person, and why do you have to be 21 to play pool????

resp.text: Hey Carloss,  sorry to hear about this.  As you can see our official website @ https://poppagsbilliards.com doesn't show any pricing.   You don't have to be 21 to play pool but you do have to be 21 to be in a bar in Pelham, AL.  We'd love to chat with you in regards to any of our staff being rude so that we can fix any issues necessary.  As you can see by all our other reviews that are 5 stars, customer service is priority and something we take great pride in.  Feel free to give us a call or come by during business hours and we'll be happy to do whatever possible to make sure your next Poppa G's visit is nothing shy of a 5-star experience.

I recommend this place for a date or a fun family event!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your positive experience bowling with us. We’re so glad you had a great time and look forward to seeing you back on the lanes soon!

name: Sara Mosier
text:
I've been here twice with my roommates, both times for their children's birthday parties.

The first time was around Aug 2020, and it was pretty dead in the bowling alley.  We were the only customers in there for at least the first hour.  We purchased the 2 hour package, which you get to choose your food from a list, you get several arcade play cards with tokens and a laminated bowling pin for the birthday child.   Any food you don't finish, they allow you to box up and take with you!

Surprisingly,  the food is actually really good.  We had chicken tenders, pizza, and mac n cheese balls the first time, and cheesy bread, chicken tenders and buffalo cauliflower this last time.

The second time we went, which was this month, they were a LOT busier but the experience was still pretty amazing.  Bottom line, both children loved their birthday parties and we would do this for either of them again!

resp.text: Sara thank you for the five-star review about our Bowlero! Looks like you had a great time on the lanes and we appreciate the feedback. Hope you’ll come back to bowl with us again soon!

name: Heather Haskell
text: While they were happy to accommodate our special Olympian bowler on this visit who has been vaccinated,  the mask requirement was not being enforced for others.

resp.text: Heather the health and safety of our guests and staff members is our top priority and we thank you for reaching out. At Bowlero, we are following local and state protocols regarding usage of masks and PPE and have passed your comments along to management. Please reach us at guestservice@bowlerocorp.com if you’d like to discuss further.

name: Rosalea Cody Williams
text: Be prepared to have a tab on your lane .... it will add up quickly

resp.text: Rosalea thanks for leaving us a 4 star review! We’re so grateful you chose to bowl with us and we hope you’ll come back and visit us in the near future!

name: Darrin Jones
text: Great place for bowling,  but when you're running a tournament need to have more employees working snack bar over 1hr for food in unacceptable

resp.text: Darrin we’re sorry you experienced a long wait time. We’re constantly looking for ways to improve our efficiency and your feedback is very much appreciated.  We have sent this along to our operations team and we thank you for taking the time to reach out to us. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Lovely One
text: First trying this place. And the customer service is unbelieveable (in a wonderful). The bar tender was such a delight. We'll be back this weekend

You can sign up by visiting bowlero.com/mvb-rewards. Thank you again for your feedback.

text: The facility was fairly clean.  They were prepared for the covid-19 required social distancing. The bar was closed.  The kitchen and snack bar was restricted to staff only.  The bowling was a little pricey.  Service was slow but friendly.   The patrons were limited to a single lane.  All in all I had fun. Enjoy your evening but expect to pay 9 dollars a game on Friday night.

The music was outlandish playing 1980's. No matter how many times we requested songs his reply was he was only allowed to play what was in rotation. The worst will surely be going to stars and stripes

text:
There is only two things that really bother me about this place.

1) is the Pro Shop ever open because I went by there today and it was closed when it was supposed to be open.

2) it doesn't seem like there's enough people working in the back for ball returns and Pen setup.

text: Idk if it was just the amount of ppl there today or the amount of workers, but our food took a long time

text: We really enjoyed our selves. The service was tremendously excellent.

name: William Propst
text: Great atmosphere. Place stays packed on the weekends and they do events all the time. Bar and food service is seriously slow, though. Usually takes around 20-25 minutes to get a drink or some food. The bar gets backed up really easily on weekend nights so there ends up being a huge line. Still a great place to come bowl

name: Raina Brown
text: My friend and I went there on Christmas  night  to play  pool. We had fun!!! I love the updates  that you all have done. The only things I wish you could change is more pool tables in the bar area not just that lonely one  that's on the floor. And making sure that the servers  sees when there is people  playing  pool that's  by the laser  tag.

name: Sabrina Kassam
text: Jarred was awesome at having the party run smoothly and enjoyable. The staff ensured we had enough napkins & drink refills & gave us the plates for the cake. I celebrated my daughter's 10th birthday here. They let her do two song requests. They had the bumpers up etc. They even added our guest's names for us in the system as they all arrived. We had our own private area. The pizza was filling & delicious. They had set up Happy Birthday with my daughter's name. I have zero complaints. 100% fully satisfied customer. Booking was easy. The staff answered all questions & accommodated our needs perfectly to our desires. I look forward to coming again. Each child in the party also had a $3 complimentary arcade card which was very much enjoyed after bowling. We are very grateful for our positive experience. Honestly, my expectations were exceeded. Way to go Bowlero. Thank you!  I would definitely recommend this bowling alley for any age or event.

name: Bossy Bitch
text: We had fun my best friend my a1 tony and with some family and yes i remember that u cheated bryan lol

resp.text: Frances there’s nothing like seeing five stars! Thanks for bowling with us and we look forward to the next time you and your son join us on the lanes 🎳

name: arlevia anderson
text: Fun but needs better seletion of music

name: Radon Vex
text: Terrible service. The lane broke after almost every frame. 4 dollars for a soda? No blue moon beer on a Saturday night at 9 ? Don’t waste your money here.

name: Christopher Oswald
text: The tables are lousy and interrupt your ability to move around. Not much free space if you have a few people and the stand with the keyboard blocks access to the balls and blower. The shoes have a big lip around the edge of them and it is the most expensive bowling alley I've ever been to. The decor is nice and the place looks very well taken care of.

name: Nikki Sheffield
text: Nice family atmosphere

resp.text: Nikki we love hearing this about our Columbus team! Thanks for bowling with us and we look forward to the next time you join us on the lanes 🎳

text: My first time, had a good time, food and drinks was excellent.

name: Tarren Bruce
text: It was a little pricey but I enjoyed my vist.

name: Brittany Kendall
text: We had a small get-together today at the bowling alley for my daughter's birthday, we didn't do any of the packages they have for birthdays because we already had a party the night before- we just simply brought a few of her friends and went bowling. I ordered a few kids meals and drinks and we had an amazing time, that was all because of the guy that runs the front named Nick. Nick did an amazing job helping me get the kids shoes and lane ready and he went above and beyond to help me with refills on drinks and getting their food out. He made our experience there amazing, we will definitely be returning in the near future and will be telling all of our friends about are outstanding experience. Thanks again Nick, you helped make my daughter's birthday party amazing

name: Quilla Brown
text: Fun,fast service nice staff

name: Chris Benton
text: A nice bowling alley but, they charge a little more than $7 per person per game. It's not just a charge for the lane and the show rental. Was not clarified beforehand when we asked. It cost my wife and I $50+ for 3 games not including the price of our drinks. I even had my own ball and shoes. Won't be coming back.

name: Karen
text: This was a great time with my youngest boy for family day. The staff was helpful, knew what they were doing and the place was clean.

name: Tonya Ford Dale
text: Bowlero was great! Sunday evening is my time to come! The place was will let, service was fantastic, and food was delicious. I still can't bowl worth a flip, but I had a good time! 💜

name: XzoticPinky
text: Fun place to take ur family.

name: Simon Strothers
text: A little on the expense side for a lane that had trouble picking the pins up.

name: Kathy Perez
text: First, I came here with my family because of the good reviews. However, it was very disappointing. We waited in line to check in over 15 min and it was not busy at all. Maybe 3 lanes in use. Second, we tried ordering pizza and wings and drinks, over $100 so we passed'. 4 drinks were $18. The arcade is a joke. $5 only gives for one game. Service was awful. Overall, if more looking to spend $200 bowling, this place is for you included with bad service. Never again.

name: Vicky Hatchett
text: I had a blast our church family went for a night of bowling and I tell you we had a really great time  they gave us a great group discount we had booked in advance the even had our section decorated I thought that was so nice this is a great place to go and just have great fun 5 stars ratings

name: Erika Schmidt
text:
I am a recreational bowler who bowls a good amount and there is nothing worse than mistreated lanes, this Bowlero has good lanes. They are well greased. Really my only issue is most of the finger-holes on the bowling balls are chipped. It has a great layout and is kept very neat and tidy.

They also give a great military discount, which I appreciated it!

name: Teresa Berg
text: Good place to have a kids party but food limited and overpriced.

name: Karin B
text: This was an awful experience. It took the cashier 20 minutes to ring up the person in front of me. We finally get to order our lanes, and she said they have socks. So, I buy a pair to find out there are no socks. Then, she can't refund me while I am up there because she needs her manager that will not come up there. Next, we cannot start the game because the bumpers are not electronic. I was able to run to Target and back before they got the bumpers up. Of course, everyone has to use bumpers, which is lame. Do not come here. What a waste.

name: Melena Hendley
text: A bit expensive. Hopefully they will become fully functional soon.

name: Pamela
text: Very comfortable atmosphere. I came for a work get together. I always enjoy this place.

name: XxMythical LegendYTxX

text: We came in to only get one lane.  We were told 39 minute wait to clean a lane & possibly longer? I am a league bowler at different lanes.  This is ridiculous! There were at least 10 lanes open at this time! Poor lane management and customer service.. will go somewhere else the next time we want to bowl!

name: AngelA Sellars
text: Love stuff!!

resp.text: AngelA we love hearing this about our Columbus team! Thanks for bowling with us and we look forward to the next time you join us on the lanes 🎳

text: Fun place to visit. Prices are fair. Drinks are cheap. Equipment doesn't always work as it is supposed to.

name: brittany wesolko
text: It was really nice and big. They are really friendly and when we were on our last bowl our time was almost up and Jered extended our time a little so we could finish. I would definitely come back and bowl here again.

name: Quincy. MOV
text:
The waitress at the bar was really rude... it was like an hour wait for the food and and 2 hour wait just to bowl.. you would be better of going to stars and strikes.

P.S it was dirty also.

name: Charles Butler
text: Absolutely terrible customer service. Due to a family emergency we had to cancel our reservations for a bowling party. They wouldn't even consider giving us a refund they just kept our money and offered us a useless credit. The staff then contacted us the next day after we had cancelled demanding to know where we were. They were incredibly rude and unprofessional. We had to ask several times who we were talking g to and they just kept demanding to speak with my wife by name. I can safely say I will not be using this company again and I advise other to stay away and book your party with a different company.

name: Miriam Ortiz
text: Love the people the place it's fun.

name: shari baldwin
text: Great Atmosphere, it's a little pricey to bowl on a saturday after 7pm. If you go before 7pm the price to bowl is not bad. Even though it was crowded, we was able to get a lane.

name: Cocchiara Bell
text: It was unsafe. The sign outside said that masks were required, however nobody else besides me, my son and daughter in law were wearing them. If there is a sign stating required then it should be enforced to wear masks.

name: Jessica Nichols
text: Jared and Cameron were awesome! The customer service they provided was the best that I’ve received in a long time. It was definitely a diamond quality experience.

name: Rana Darvesh
text: Nice place to go with your family and they have good discounts almost daily. The manager and staff were really friendly and honest. Forget my CC and DL and they kept then safe until I came back for them! Thanks!

name: Meshea Payne
text: Me and my friends went on a Saturday and they did not have any like group deals matter fact they didn't have any deals at all so everyone had to pay individually I didn't think that was cool at all I think you should always have some type of little group coupons or or something like that no I would not recommend this place to anyone

Then I overheard the other attendant tell another group it's $7/game. I will not be back to this location I did not feel welcomed. And being given information in hopes I would not stay is a fefdefin deal breaker for me. Thanks but no thanks.

text: Nice place. The food was good! A little pricey for everything but we had fun! The bathrooms were clean and they had a lot to do beside bowl. Very nice facility!

name: shannon pittman
text: Had a great time with friends and the facility was great, but the service was lacking. Our waitress was super nice and helpful, but there wasn't enough help for a Saturday night. She did all she could, just needed additional staff support. 30 minutes for a drink is TOO long to wait.

text: We went here with family after the holidays and were pleasantly surprised. The new updates are beautiful and inviting. I love the flooring. The bartender was very sweet, too. We always enjoyed the arcade after bowling a few games and loved the selection. It's got a good mix of classics like ski ball and air hockey with newer electronic games like flappy bird and candy crush.

name: G. Crawford
text:
I was a guest attending a Mary Kay event on Saturday noon in a private room. There was good music playing & I must say kudos to the cook.
We had 2 lunch samplers dine in.
Our🍳 food was delicious!

text: I enjoy the time I've recently spent with good company here at Bowlero. Had issues with a few of the lanes but the staff took care of those issues promptly after being notified.

text: Excellent service but rails kept falling

name: Carole Brown
text: It was freezing cold in there. As I appreciate it not being 75°+ where my ball sticks to my hand, below 60° where I cant even hold on to my ball is not cool.

name: Matthew Prugh
text: Wow - bowling is just the beginning.  Laser tag, beat arcade, pool tables, air hockey, and foosball.  Serve excellent drinks at reasonable prices with terrific specials at certain days and times - usually after 8pm.   The staff was wonderfully accommodating, responsive, and friendly.

name: Jason Harris
text: Amazing employees! The check in counter people seemed happy to get us on a lane and our server name was Hailey. She was very polite and respectful and got our orders as soon as possible and got it to us quickly. They did seem a little under staffed with the servers with there being a party going on and a good bit of lanes takin and only her there. Its a very clean facility and they have easy to find balls. The food is a bit expensive but well worth it.

name: Timothy Buckner
text: I enjoy the time I've recently spent with good company here at Bowlero. Had issues with a few of the lanes but the staff took care of those issues promptly after being notified.

text: Amazing employees! The check in counter people seemed happy to get us on a lane and our server name was Hailey. They did seem a little under staffed with the servers with there being a party going on and a good bit of lanes takin and only her there. Its a very clean facility and they have easy to find balls. The food is a bit expensive but well worth it.

name: p Martinez
text: Lanes are good but they are way understaff, you have to wait a long time for a drink and food. The bartender many times is not at the bar so you have to wait for her to come to the bar ( I dont know where she hides). The waitress is really nice but is just one girl most of the times.

name: Eydan Mayorga
text: The bowling was good but waited an hour for some nachos. Didnt even get any compensation or anything for the inconvenience of waiting an hour for nachos. Will not recommend this place

name: Darryl Grewe
text: Love it

resp.text: Darryl thank you for the five-star review! Looks like you had a great time on the lanes and we appreciate the feedback. Hope you’ll come back to bowl with us again soon!

name: Brit P
text: Tons of fun, quick at addressing issues, good food. Very sweet cook. Good value!

name: Barbara Davis

name: Jason “J.R.” Medlock
text: Not a fan of the music, but outstanding fun otherwise ☺️

name: Jack Kasparek
text: Great place, idk why it wasnt busy, definitely will be back

name: Erin Powell
text: Terrible place.  The prices are outrageous and the service was horrible! We should have gone to stars and strikes for 1/2 the price!

name: Emily Heim
text: Great bowling center. The food and drinks are high priced so be prepared. The bathrooms are clean. The arcade is really good. Definitely enjoy coming every year for Pepsi Qualifying.

name: Marbelous_g35
text: I went here for the first time yesterday and had a great time! The place is very clean and friendly. There's so many lanes and the environment was nice and inviting

name: Rebecca Williams
text: If you love bowling this is the place, on Friday morning 7/26 special Olympic tournament join us.

name: Nestor Roman
text: Good old fashion fun for the family 🌟

name: Erin Powell
text: Terrible place.  The prices are outrageous and the service was horrible! We should have gone to stars and strikes for 1/2 the price!

name: Woodly Bonhomme
text: It was really fun, I went over with some friends to bowl and we ended up trying every single arcade game.

name: rebecca williams
text: Well maintained, friendly staff, special Olympics tournament on Friday check it out.

name: Alice Halsey
text: It"s a nice place but, last week I paid 23.49 for three people to bowl 3 games and rented a pair of shoes. This week we went and was told the exact same games and people would cost me 60.52. I asked why the difference and was told, the prices had been raised, really? Can't afford to go there again.

name: McElmurray Stephanie
text: Fun atmosphere and the staff are really nice!

name: Spen Ever
text: My girls and I had a great time

name: Derek
text: This place is 10 times better now after they remodeled it. Very nice and tons of room now, the arcade was enjoyed by the kids and we all had a blast at laser tag. However, for a family of four it gets ridiculously expensive to bowl, get snacks or almost anything else. About the only time we go now is when Groupon has sales. If it was more affordable it would have been 5 stars.

name: Emily Heim
text: Great bowling center. The food and drinks are high priced so be prepared. The bathrooms are clean. The arcade is really good. Definitely enjoy coming every year for Pepsi Qualifying.

name: Christina Stanbro
text: DO NOT ORDER THE BUFFALO WINGS. They come straight from the fiery pits of hell and will only haunt you while you bowl. Had fun

name: Dan Taylor
text:
My wife and I went along with another couple for a couple of games of late night bowling on a Saturday night.

I have bowled for many years and I've been to many different bowling alleys.

I was impressed with the size and amount of lanes this location had and definitely the house ball selection for those who don't have their own ball. We hadn't planned on visiting the bowling alley while we were in town so I used a house ball this particular evening. The balls are arranged by weight and not just thrown in random spots.

There are large screens with graphics for each lane to keep you entertained.  The location has a bar, arcade, and pool table. The staff was friendly. We'll be going back soon.

name: Mel R.
text: Nice. Clean. Game area was cool. Wait time was a bit much, especially since there were over 10 lanes unoccupied. Supposed tournament, but there wasn't any tournament happening. 😕

name: Chris Nesbit
text: Very good lanes. Service was great.

name: ronald massey
text: My wife and I, our daughter and our grandson, 5 years old, spent the evening. And had a great time. It is family oriented people will very helpful and got to talk with others and meet others.

name: Cody Tillery
text:
We went on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm. We ordered a hotdog,hamburger, and a shrimp popper meal which took a whole hour to get to us.
It seems like there were only 4 people working with many of the lanes full. I don't know if people called out but management should have found fill ins instead of running their employees ragged.
We had a much better experience coming here on a Saturday night than a less busy Sunday afternoon.

name: CARLOS ANDERSON
text: Customer service is lacking here. The lane I was on kept having issues and it took forever for the STAFF to respond and address the matter.

name: Ed Higdon
text: The place was fine but we had a set time frame in which to bowl. Not a big deal to get a couple games in before the time ran out, except for the fact that the lane quit working a number of times. Changing lanes didn't seem to matter for the people who started next to us because they moved from a lane that kept messing up to a lane that was messing up worse. That said, we decided to take our chances. Several times it took the staff as much as 10-12 minutes to get it working again because more than once I watched them hanging out chatting with other employees at the desk for more than 5 minutes after being told it had quit again. We didn't have any issues with the lanes at the other place in town so we went there a couple times more recently. It cost less with a groupon anyway I believe.

name: Selena Manning
text: The food was good! A little pricey for everything but we had fun! The bathrooms were clean and they had a lot to do beside bowl. Very nice facility!

name: Ethan Winters
text: Very fun and entertaining place. Music on projectors in back of bowling alleys is a plus. Lazertag course is top of the line and they even have tourneys! First time we went the lazer tag was unoperational but the manager gave us free passes to lazer tag and a gift card with 10 free credits to the arcade! The college student special for bowling was an extreme help considering me and my friends were on a budget. Extremely friendly staff and lots of cool stuff to do. Cheap prices make this a very enjoyable outing and i will definitely be visiting again. 100/10 would reccomend.

name: Matt Malecki
text: You get, what you expecting and more.

name: jess horton
text:
Pros: front desk staff was super nice, place was clean, and had well kept bathrooms. Lanes and decor were nice. Price was decent for three games and shoes about $15.

Cons: Waitress was a hot mess. Food was weird - got the garlic parmesan wings that tasted like they were buffalo wings fist then someone threw bit of extra seasoning on them. Also got the sample plate with no cheese bread. Took FORVEVE to get drinks.

name: Clegg V
text: This is where my family goes for good clean fun.

name: John Stanley
text: Awesome time and even better specials!!! A must go!

name: Denise Ruiz
text:
Overall was a good experience! They spaced you out in lanes which was nice til it was busy. We of course went with kids so it was a bit crazy. Ordered food and was quick as it could be as it was getting busy but with just the one waitress she was so overloaded with people she was slow the busier it got but she def did her best.
The bowling was fun. We didn't play arcade games that day but want to go back to play as they looked fun.

name: Baylee F
text: We went around 5 on Saturday. The employee working the front desk was very rude, didnt greet or speak to either my husband or I, only spoke to tell us to put our card in the chip reader. There were maybe only 7 other lanes in use at this point so they were NOT busy by any means. Went to order 2 drinks and an order of fries around 5:40 and the bar wasnt set up yet I guess? So we ended up waiting over 20 minutes for that order. The place is nice and clean but the staff SERIOUSLY needs to be talked to about customer service. We were completely ignored when we tried to check out as well until a girl walked by (despite there being people behind the desk ignoring us) and asked if we needed to be checked out. We wont be returning, definitely going to try out a different alley next time.

name: Jessica no mjk onee
text: Always have a great time . staff is extremely nice and helpful

name: Steve Burns
text: Great bowling alley.  Hosts the Pepsi Tournament annually and does a great job.   Large game area, and laser tag room.  Was given a tour of the facility by a friendly and knowledgeable associate. The only negative was extremely slow lane conditioning machines, but that only occurs before tournaments and leagues and does not affect open bowling.

name: Randall Colwell
text: First of all I haven't been here since it was Peach Bowl Lanes and boy was I in for a treat. This place looks and feels amazing. So to get to my experience we scheduled a King Pin Party Package here if you don't know what that is it's amazing what you get for you buck. We had an wonderful time bowling, great food and someone who actually knows how to make good mix drinks lol thanks bartenders. We want to get a BIG Shout Out to our lane server Michaela. She was on top of our party from start to finish never once did we have to search for her and very friendly A+++ service. Our second BIG Shout Out is to the Manager Lorenzo. We had a couple hiccups throughout the night nothing major but he was on top of it and made sure we had the best experience ever, we appreciate that man. Third an last shout out is to the man that set this all up for me over the phone Mr. John Cole. Without you and all your guidance and emails we would have never had this experience. Thanks again. If your looking for a good time and are over the age of 21 and wanna do a group event totally look into the King Pin Package here. I promise you that you won't regret the decision. Want to Thank the Bowlero of Columbus Ga for a great experience. Thank you all.

name: C Policastro
text:
Very large inside and can hold lots of people, great place for parties and hanging out. Bowling is a little expensive when there aren't any specials, at 2 games for $14 that's more than I'm used to spending. But the lanes and balls are in great shape and had no issues, except the lane we played in the 1 pin would fall down about 40% of the time after a reset, so our scores were a bit messed up.

The laser tag is a good size for maybe 5v5, any more and it's chaos unless you just want to sit still and not move around. The guns are clean and "cool" looking and are easy to use and you know when you aren't holding it right when it beeps so it won't shoot.

The bar area is decent size and staff was super friendly and quick service. There was only 1 dart in the board so we couldn't play darts.

I would visit again and bowl just when the games were cheaper.

name: Charles Callari
text: Today for lunch I had the brisket sandwich. I 100% recommend this sandwich. Get ready because it’s a little messy but really worth the mess. If you like brisket then you should definitely Get this sandwich. I also had fries which were nice and hot. Next to McDonald’s fries, these are my favorite. If you are in the BHAM downtown area then you should stop her for a quick lunch. We were in and out of there within 45 minutes.

resp.text: Hey Charles. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Sasha Elhaiga
text: I've never had a problem coming to this location. Since it is so close to UAB campus, my friends and I come here quite a lot. Hot food fast with lots of sports games to watch. Very good customer service and drink options. All around a good time!

resp.text: Hey Sasha. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Nakisha Cook
text: Waitress Melissa was new BUT SHE IS BEST SERVER EVER!I got sick she helped me out getting me a wet towel for my face and  ginger ale...the combo app was great and pulled brisket was ok dry but need extra bbq sauce.. But they took GREAT CARE OF US..I WILL BE BACK

resp.text: Hey Nakisha. Thanks for the feedback! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Shir Carson
text: Saturday afternoon, 15 -20 min wait, flew by the ambiance in door and outdoor was live. Our server was was great, recommended several items on the menu. We tried the Baked pretzels with queso cheese dip and Honey mustard dip. Ordered the chicken sandwich with french fries and the Brisket and Double burger  with potato wedges. Sprite, water, and Mojito for drinks. the food was served hot, everything was fresh and juicy, seasoned well too! We will be back! Had a great time!

resp.text: Hey Shir. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Danny Neaves
text: This particular location is great, plenty of parking, some free, some are metered. The facility is top notch and very nice. It is a new facility (as of February 2020) but it goes beyond that it is just a well done space and they stay busy. I've been as early as 11:15 and as late as 12:30 and it is usually very busy. The staff is good and the food is good too. This chain has become a little pricey over the last couple of years, but we enjoy it every time we go. I've been to this location with 3 people and with 6 people and both times we were able to sit quickly even though they were busy. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a quick lunch, they can get you in and out.

name: Lemondria Thomas
text: This location us a lot better than the one in hoover. Customer service was much better and the food is good as always.

resp.text: Hey Lemondria. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Joyce Christian
text: Now hiring is real.  The waitress was tired and we could tell it.  This was my first time ordering wings. The plain wings aren't on the menu for a reason they definitely need sauce.  I will stick with their burgers which are very good.

resp.text: Hey Joyce. Thanks for letting us know. Feel free to leave us more feedback on the form at the bottom of BuffaloWildWings.com/FAQ where it says 'Orders & Visits'.
