name: Sherie Marsh
text: Wow!!! This BWW is Definitely Struggling!! The hostess was obviously not happy with having to sit us!! The server said they were short staffed and he was apologizing in advance for his poor service! Never saw him until he delivered the check 1 hr later!! Asked the Manager wearing the orange shirt for another beer after 20 minutes of waiting on the non existent server! He did deliver the check!! And a box after asking twice!! He came back and asked me for the signed copy so he could cash out!! My son never got his refill! Never got our fried pickles!! Good luck!! Only working person who was nice or paid attention was the manager wearing the long sleeves who recognized us from Gardendale location!!

resp.text: Hey Sherie. Thanks for letting us know about this, we are very sorry. Please fill out the form at the bottom of BuffaloWildWings.com/FAQ where it says 'Orders & Visits' if you don’t mind so we can make it right for you.

name: Hannah Fuller
text: I work in food service so I know some days can be tough, but the lady working to-go with the long blue nails was the rudest ever!! I tried to call and place a to go order and I couldn’t even stand to continue speaking with her using that tone. Then I go in to order takeout inside and she acted like it was so irritating that I was even there. I tried to compliment her to maybe brighten her mood but she still spoke with me with an attitude. Then after I paid 3 dollars for a lemonade, she brought me what tasted like water with some drops of lemon juice in it. I want my refund for my drink!!! I went there a year ago and had bugs in my food. I should’ve learned then not to come back!

resp.text: Hey Hannah. We apologize. Please share additional details with us at the link below. A member of our Guest Support Team will reach out to you to make it right. Please fill out the form at the bottom of BuffaloWildWings.com/FAQ where it says 'Orders & Visits' if you don’t mind so we can get some more info.

name: Trey Lykens
text: I go here quite often and get lunch. Awesome service and the food is always amazing. Whether  we go in and sit down to eat or order to-go, food is always phenomenal and always exactly what I order.

resp.text: Hey Trey. Thanks for the feedback! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Hello Terry
text: I ordered my lunch online and went straight to the restaurant about 5 minutes away by car.  The staff was pleasant.  I paid for my food and waited in the van for my co-worker to pay for his food.  As I waited I looked into my bag to inspect my lunch and eat a few fries.  The fries were hard and lukewarm at best.  I go back in and ask for fresher fries which they obliged by taking my entire lunch back and putting the "fresh fries" in my clamshell.  After returning to the office to eat; the parmesan garlic chicken nuggets were obviously not fried to order.  They were dry and barely warm as well.  Every time I've gone to BWW this has been the case whether dining in or carry out.  I think they cook everything in bulk and its never fresh or hot when it reaches the table.  In my dine-in experiences bone-in wings are never cooked to order and always seem like they're been sitting under a heat lamp and brought out to the table.  I will not go to another BWW again; food is just not done right and is never good!!

resp.text: Hey there. We apologize for the food you received…thanks for letting us know. Please fill out the form at the bottom of BuffaloWildWings.com/FAQ where it says 'Orders & Visits' so we can make it right for you.

name: TaNeiqua Jackso
text: The absolute worst chicken I've ever eaten, I ordered ahead and the food had to be brought to the pickup area, the room was ten minutes away from BWW so there shouldn't have been a reason for it to be cold as though it had been sitting out for hours. The chicken had so many feathers, I couldn't even enjoy . I ordered kids meals for my girls both of which were supposed to have a drink that we didn't receive, and also their order was completely wrong,  the whole order was wrong  actually and the taste of the food was mediocre at best, that was the first and last time for me and my family. And when I tried calling no one answered the phone, it was already late and I was upset, we basically ate fries for dinner . if I could rate it a Zero I really would. But I'll just do one better and not give them my money at all.

resp.text: Hey there. Thanks for letting us know about this, we are very sorry. Please fill out the form at the bottom of BuffaloWildWings.com/FAQ where it says 'Orders & Visits' if you don’t mind so we can make it right for you.

text: Going on a promotional day is optimal. Tuesday for example offers bogo wings. Generally customer service is pretty good. General value is poor when it comes to price. Food is good but at regular price can be overly steep.

name: Bernadine Birdsong
text: Our server told us she was training a new girl. She took our order and promptly disappeared. She never came back to check on us. Someone else brought our food. Our fries were cold. That young man took them back and returned later with fresh fries and also refreshed my daughter's drink.  We finished our meal and started stacking the dishes before the trainee arrived to ask if we wanted dessert. We decided to just pay and leave.  We never saw our original server again.  The place is brand new. Very nice sports bar atmosphere. Everyone else seemed friendly. I just think we had the wrong server.  I will go back again to try another server.

Our waitress did not provide any updates until a member of our party asked.   The food for our party did not come out together so again,  some were finished before others were served.   The manager was nice did apologize several times and did provide compensation.   Since this is a relatively new establishment,  hopefully it will get better with time.

name: Greg Hand
text: Food is always top notch. The service today was not top notch. Asked for coffee with dessert and was told that they didn't have any made. When asked about making a pot the server balked and said, "I guess I can." We declined the offer.

name: Kelsey
text: 11 of us went for lunch to celebrate a coworker's birthday. We ordered and waited almost an hour for food. The server started out good refilling drinks but that really only happened once. It took effort to find out why the orders were taking so long considering we arrived before the lunch rush. The food finally arrived and wrong. I ordered a black bean burger. The only correct thing about it was the patty. Instead of the cheddar and ranch advertised on the menu, the burger was slathered with mustard. It also had lettuce, tomato, mayo, and pickles. I'd have requested no pickles had I been aware it's come dressed differently than advertised. The restaurant is nice. The potato wedges were good. The lack of service and an incorrect order when it could've come as advertised is baffling. If you visit, be prepared for a lengthy wait. Beverages will come but everything else may be a battle.

text: My first experience was terrible. I was helped fast and got out fast but my order was wrong (even though the entire restaurant was dead). I went back in a few weeks later and after speaking with a manager to get my credit, they were able to rectify the situation and it was a great experience. I will be back and I'm glad to know they care about fixing their mistakes.

name: Jasmine Daniels
text: Do not eat from this store!!! I had 3 call in orders for wings from here Tuesday night. The wings were not cooked all the way. The wings made my brother, cousin, my boyfriend, and I sick on the stomach. My brother woke me up at 2 a.m. from puking so loud! I called the manager on today and was nice about telling him what all happened. He responded by telling me that they cook their wings all the way and that there is no way possible we got sick from THEIR food! He stated that “If you all were food poisoned you all would still be throwing up today and it usually takes 24 hr to get it”. So they have doctors on site now? My family and I hadn't eaten anything since the morning of before eating there last night around 7:20 p.m. Once your stomach digest your food, if it doesn’t agree with what you’re putting in it it is going to come out one way or the other! It doesn’t take 24 hours for your food to digest! My brother did not eat all day today. The manager was rude and that is not great customer service. They just opened this store and this was my first time eating here last night. I see Why I don’t now. BUFFALO WILD WINGS will never get another PENNY from me, but y’all enjoy!!

resp.text: Hey Jasmine.  We are very sorry about the poor experience you had.  Please give us a call at 866-704-0777.

name: ALBERT THOR HARSTVEDT
text:
Atmosphere and food was great. Restaurant very clean. However, I've had better service at Waffle House. Our food was brought out pretty quickly. I had to get up and go get us both silverware and napkins. Server (Jania) never brought us any till I got up to go find another server to all for them. Jania did bring me a refill on my drink but not my son's water. What really got me was that Jania (our server) never took our dirty plates of the table. She brought the check, came back a few minutes later to process the pmt, brought it back again...but NEVER picked Any of our plates off of our table. Please train your wait staff to serve the guests that they are waiting on. My son paid the tab and still left over 20% gratuity. We hungout for a while after paying the tab to visit, but Jania never came back to remove our dirty plates. Yes, I'm going on about for a bit. Any restaurant establishment is only as good as thepeople that work for them. Be it a mom and pop owned restaurant or a 4-5 star establishment. Will I come back to this location...No, not now. Minimal expectations walking in....less than minimal results except for the quality of the food and atmosphere. Too bad as the cost of the owners investment in this location looks pretty expensive. Have a great day...
Guest

name: Daniel Bolding
text: Great new addition to downtown Birmingham! It is conveniently located by the UAB campus and Regions Field where the Birmingham Barons play. I watched the first Birmingham Irons game there on the projector screen that was above the bar, and it was awesome! Great bartenders that remember your face and even your orders! I love going on Thursdays for the buy one get one free boneless wing days. My favorite sauces are Mango Habanero, Hot BBQ, Hot Buffalo, and Asian Zing. The new Bourbon Honey Mustard is great too, but the former sauces are hotter and better to me since I love spicy foods. Most BWW have been subpar recently, but this one is great!

text: My drink tasted like an icee. No alcohol at all. Both my friends had more alcohol than they wanted. I guess the bar tender gave mine to them.

name: Chuck Wood
text: Great place good food great atmosphere

name: bill cross
text: Great venue, great food,staff and security, all around great experience.

name: Chauntrice Poindexter
text: Very nice place

name: Coy Moring
text: Said Trina was suppose to perform that was a laugh.

name: LaMira Jackson
text: Can't carry your purse in and the power went out

name: Alexandria Heaton
text: Ive been going to pirates cove since I was a kid and its always been such a nice place to enjoy the water and let the kids play. This past time I went (which was about a week ago) I got to enjoy their famous bushwacker. It was good! Its also a dog friendly place!

name: Linda Perry
text: Good place for families to bring their kids for light swimming and watching boats. Popular place to pull up your boat, grab a bite and drink, then head out. Be aware that alcohol is served here, so the atmosphere can be more beach bar vibe than family excursion. Well-behaved dogs are welcome. They serve a mean Bushwhacker and the Burger is great!

name: Hans Hammond
text: Some of our favorite bushwackers in the area. The boat docks were nice and newly rebuilt. They have an Area for kids to play in the water safely away from boat traffic. The food could be better but this place leans more bar than restaurant so you have to give them credit where it's deserved. Lots of people and a party atmosphere every time we went. It's a must stop here kind of place every time we come to FL!

name: Carrie Lovelace
text: Great place to take the family! Adults can enjoy a bushwacker and catch a tan, and the water is shallow enough for the little ones to play without fear of being above their heads. The view of the boats is beautiful and the dock helps block the large waves from cashing on shore or pulling you under. The two issues with this place is dog owners not being required to keep their dogs on a leash and not enough parking. The problem with the dogs is huge! Dogs will get into your food, beach totes, and run all over your beach towels/blankets leaving everything covered in sand! I love seeing animals enjoy time with their families, but I do not agree with letting your pets run free around other families. The parking isn't terrible but it can be difficult to find "legal" parking (not on private property). All in all, a great place to visit on occasion.

name: Rockfox
text: Good food and prices are good also. I love being able to take my dog to the beach. One of the few places you can.

name: Kerry Swalley
text: This was a place my husband and his siblings went to with their grandfather as kid's. It is really quirky and off the pathway. He said it was a local hideaway that had the best burger ever. I have to agree it does have a great burger. The local hounds that walk in to say hi were a neat unexpected addition. If you're looking for a good drink and a burger on a quiet afternoon or maybe a night with a group of friends, definitely try this place out!

name: JonMonFish Imagery
text: Awesome place to spend the day or a lazy afternoon. Come by motorcycle, truck or boat. Big beach with tons of room. Marina as well! Cold beer, cocktails with a great vibe. Don't forget to grab one of there amazing burgers ands fries!!

name: Christina
text: Hole-in-the-wall type place.  Definitely popular with the locals.  Cheeseburgers were the best in the area.  Onion rings were yummy.  Order at counter, give them your name and they'll bring food out and holler your name....then you chase them down. Lol!  Rather confusing for a first time customer.  Restrooms were ok... men's was unusual, per my husband.  Didn't see any tables being cleaned 😒 masks were non-existent, as is the case in the area.  Dogs everywhere, running loose. Saw 2 of them pee on the deck 😒

name: Charles Tallent
text: Love the atmosphere, dog friendly (and there are lots of loose dogs) and the water views, and beach area.  I thought the cheeseburger, fries, and  their famous drink was so so and over priced for what you get. You're paying for the location scenery and repairs after hurricane Sally.

name: dmoster 4
text: Bunch of teenage kids and a wife mad at her husband who was completely wasted.  Yeah they own the bar. They tried to charge us for 14 dip and dot ice creams. Basically made us put them on the counter for proof. We were told this was a local place that was family friendly. I guess so if you like attitude, disrespect and loke to get accused of stealing because the drunk owner and his kid stole dip n dots 🤷 . I belive they were saying hey the camera is on. Family fun. Haha

name: HBIC (Bee)
text: Bushwacker Beach is what I call it. They have a great little bar for food and drinks. Beach is small but great. Dog friendly. Did I mention the bushwackers are the best? 🙂

name: Rob Engle
text: Cool beach hangout, good burgers and fried food. Pull your boat up on the beach hang out and enjoy a drink.

name: Mikey Mike
text: Great food/bar/shop as well as location and friendly staff! Bought myself a nice hat, and my Mother a nice shirt! Boat docking was small and busy yet still easy to dock! 👍👍

name: Jennifer Russell
text: Great family and dog friendly place! Shallow water with no big waves and clean sand. Great food and drinks also!

name: Andrew Blewer
text:
A hidden away Gem, Hard to get to buy land, and hard to find by boat.
At night it would be nice to have search lights up in the Air. Shining so people can follow to it. If everyone  knew where it was at it would no longer be a Gem. Great food and atmosphere.

name: H J
text: DOG BEACH!!!!!!! Cool little locals spot, with a bar & small food menu, & provided you have a behaved dog, they can run loose & enjoy the beach too!! Love this place!!

name: Darlyn Crawford
text: Wonderful place to take your dog! Everyone is so friendly as well!

name: Life with Aaron Arnold
text: Embarrassingly rude, female bartender refused to serve me a drink, because my ID “looked fake” and then preceded to threaten to call the cops on me when I further had proof of identification through a passport. Unbelievably terrible customer service, completely overrated.

name: Brad Burke
text: Great Burgers. Dog friendly. Not too crowded on a Monday.

name: Holly Claypool
text: The best cheeseburgers and bushwhackers! One of our favorite places to go when we go to the beach.

name: Frank Papasavas
text: Fun place. Very popular. Good spot to visit on a boat.

name: 68MustangGal
text: What's not to like... Water, food and fun for all! Great burgers as well!

name: Robert Hayes
text: Excellent place to kick back and relaxed....somehow this place has managed to stop time...like when everyone isn't in a hurry, everyone is friendly AND did I mention that the food is great along with the best bushwhackers on the Gulf... can't get any better right...nope they even allow dogs as long as they are laid back too... What a place... you'll be glad you stopped in that's for sure Great job guys it's easy to see why it's been operating and going strong by the same family for over 70 yrs.

name: Sher Turner
text:
I like this place and have been a few times both by land and water.
It's definitely a go-to spot for local boaters!
There is a long pier, a beach boats can anchor-up on and a beach with no boats allowed for swimmers, though plenty of folks swim off of their boats!
Pirates offers food and drink. They have a basic bar with beer, cocktails & frozen bushwhackers. The menu is small offering burgers, hot dogs, fries, chicken fingers, onion rings, and such. On weekends, pizza is offered. Pizza is definitely the best thing on the menu.
There is covered bench seating and there are a few picnic tables on the beach.
The place feels like a little soap would go a long way and a day of sprucing up would be a worthwhile effort.
The food will do in a pinch.
It is a fun location on the water.
I will return.

name: Robert and Leslie Patterson
text: In our opinion we will not go to Pirate's Cove again.We were there a couple weeks ago and the service was poor the bartender rude, and we complained about not getting food to what appeared to be the person in charge to no avail.This is sad because we had been to this restaurant many times before and it had good food and good service.This needs to change for us to return.

name: Triquetra
text: Great place to stop by and hang out while boating. Beer selection is poorly limited.

name: Bruce Andrews
text: Great place on the water to grab a hamburger and onion rings and wash it down with a beer overlooking the water.

name: Blahnik Vision
text: My son said it really is a cheeseburger in paradise. Bring your canine friends!

name: David Vann
text: This has been a go-to spot for burgers and beers when out boating for decades. Dog friendly - but possibly left to roam dragging their leash with them, so watch your dog.

name: Snapple K
text: It was good.  Need more bartenders. Lines were a lil long.  Need to order more souvenir product.

name: UnderGround Kustomz
text: Very welcoming environment. Food was outstanding!!! Waterfront with beach access 💯

name: Mickey Lyons
text: Off the beaten path, well known for their burgers, rumors of ties to Chi-town.....

name: Sandy Daigle
text: I love pirates cove!! It's my fav beach location great burgers and bushwhackers I love the atmosphere I have been going there since the late 50s my parents would rent a house that they had right on the beach I remember jumping off the wharf fishing and swimming we also learned how to sail there it's a great place for kids water is roped off before you get to the deep water great place to see dolphins and the wharf is long enough to accommodate lots of boats!!

name: Breanna DeCristoforo
text: Get a bushwacker they're great and the t shirts are super soft

name: Ronson Stewart
text: I love the location and atmosphere, food is ok for what it is, however this place has the worst drinks on all of the gulf coast. Maybe I've been spoiled bartending the past twenty years but they don't even try. Hands down the worst bushwalker I've ever had, was closer to iced 1% percent milk. I watched the bartender use sprite in my margaritas... You can do better and your customers deserve better.

name: Jinny Swafford
text: Perfect place to enjoy the bay and bring your dog to the beach!

name: teri border
text: Bushwackers were great , super busy , quick service

name: Jesse Cooke
text: Such a relaxing place off the beaten patch. Fantastic food and drinks while being surrounded by a beautiful beach area and live music going on as well. Will definitely be back. And the cheeseburgers and pizza are phenomenal

name: Kirk Becker
text: Another perfect burger! Love us some Cove!

name: Nick&Alicia Powell
text: Hidden gem with Awesome Burgers and Bushwackers! And on weekends they sometimes have live Music during the summer!

name: Charles Stillwell
text: Awesome Burger great view from poarch

name: Linda Harman
text: They have had storm damage so the restaurant seating is limited. The food was great, and the staff was helpful. This is not the place to go though if you are expecting ambiance and fancy decor.

name: Sandy T Thomas
text: Great food great atmosphere! Dogs had fun. !! Too!

name: Kim Williams
text: We had Pizza and Bushwackers...awesome !!

name: Richard Clift
text: Overpriced hamburgers one of ours was not cooked thoroughly.onion rings were good

name: Daniel Waldrop
text: Love this place nice for family, chill by the water and pet friendly.

name: Jenn Delph
text: I absolutely LOVE coming here! The staff is awesome, the beach is always clean, the food is great, & their souvenir stand always has cute shirts. It’s always a bonus to have a dog-friendly place we can visit!

name: William Hamrick
text: Really cool place very laid back.

name: Blake Tyler
text: The turkey burger here is excellent. I've tried places like Burger Lounge and a few others and nothing is as good as this. The fries are great as well. Staff is friendly and the place is very clean.

name: Marty Stepka
text: A must stop by either sea or land.  It just has very cool vibe and when you leave you tell yourself that you must come back.   Cheers..

name: mary todd
text: Very rude and extremely disrespectful female bartender. Wont be returning.

name: Hope Layne
text: Best spot in town.

name: Kitty Cohen
text: Lucia was great! She made us feel welcome and remembered us the next day when we came back. Great wings, pizza & burgers! We loved that it was dog friendly!

name: Christopher Brigham
text: Phenomenal place to eat bring your dog.

name: Emily White
text: I've always loved this place.

name: Pam Chinik
text: This place is a little crazy, a lot rugged, pretty dang delicious, fantastic people watching, and overflowing with delicious Bushwhackers. I went three times during July 4th week at all times of day and it was always slammed. I had no hope for good pizza here and was blown away; great quality and perfectly cooked. Yummy fries and onion rings. But let's face it, we are pirates and we are here to get sloshed, so pay lots of money and drink those incredibly strong frozen cocktails down. It's not a cheap stop, but you won't regret it (and you'll make a plan to come back).

name: Michael Fitts
text: Not much to say, Scallywags welcome, burger, yum, bushwacker yummer

name: Robert Farley
text: The Cove has reopened and they have cold Bushwhacker's and hot Cheeseburgers again!! Still under construction after Hurricane Sally, but worth the trip everytime!

name: Kellyn Green
text: This is not really a resteraunt. You seat yourself, order at the bar, and get your own drinks. No servers. We drove out here to visit on vacation. Was not empressed at all. Food is pricey for what you get. The food is bar food choices. The lady who took our order at the bar was less than friendly. Tasha I believe her name was. She seemed annoyed we were there and didn't know how the "resteraunt" worked. We walked in and probably stood there for 5 mins before she even acknowledged us. We were disappointed and would not return here.

name: Larry Kennedy
text: Low key. Great hamburger. Make sure you pet the dogs...

name: Maria R
text:
Marina and beach.
Where the locals hang especially tourist seaaon.

name: Cyndi Robel
text: Loved it! Best bushwacker I ever had!! Delicious cheeseburger! Loved seeing all the doggies!

name: Kim Beckham
text: This place is great!! Let the dogs be dogs and kids be kids!! Great food!!!!

name: Mike Lewis
text: Pirates Cove is a must for everyone from the town drunk to the kids who like so swim and play with all the dogs. What a place it is!!

name: deborah jackson
text: One of the best burgers I have ever had!!!!!! Awesome place

name: Faye Warren
text: Great time there

name: Tanya Dews (gypzee)
text: Very peaceful and beautiful.  Burgers and onion rings were ..ok.. great place to bring your pups.

name: Chris Vodola
text: Amazing place, even during COVID times. Boaters and swimmers love to hang all day with many a pooch. Burger is a beautiful grease bomb. When you put your food in they take your cell for texts, but the cell service is rough and you probably won’t get the text. I recommend you check the pickup area in the back if you’re still waiting after 30 minutes. 👍

name: Joseph Lanier
text: Awesome. Bushwacker and dog friendly!

name: Melissa Carver
text: Not the worst place to eat but WAY to OVER PRICED!!!!

name: cheesegrits196
text: Just a cool place. Gets very crowded in summer. You can arrive by boat and pull it right up on the sand. One of the "must go to at least once" places in the area!

name: Coach John
text: Funky! Bringing in the new year with Grayson Capps and band....

name: Elizabeth Fairey

name: Olin Barnes
text:
Always fun great burger you can go by car or boat Dog friendly
I see someone I know almost every time I go excellent memories and live music often but check

name: Tom Traynor
text: Great place on the water for drinks and food.

name: Mike J
text: Great food and drinks, relaxing atmosphere.

name: Christy Davis
text: This little gem is a great place to just hang, enjoy the water, drinks, and the food is the best! They were so nice to come together and cook burgers for the community after hurricane Sally. I love my little community!!

name: Brandon Johnston
text: Nice place food is good but takes a bit to cook. You need to be careful of some here as there are some unsavory characters. This could have just been the day overall it's a nice place and I do recommend it.  Just be aware.

name: Carl Black
text: Great locals place. It will be packed with boats and people on the weekend. They serve the best hamburgers also.

name: Kim Beckham
text: This place is great!! Let the dogs be dogs and kids be kids!! Great food!!!!

name: Tim Harris
text: Pirates cove was awesome. The service there was great. The food was great the atmosphere was awesome!! Very fun place for couples, individuals, and family!

name: Phillip Orsburn
text: Can be a fun place for singles and with their beach,  families too. Not to expensive for a tourist type location. But they do have a souvenir shop on site.

name: Melissa Carver
text: Not the worst place to eat but WAY to OVER PRICED!!!!

name: Tanya Dews (gypzee)
text: Very peaceful and beautiful.  Burgers and onion rings were ..ok.. great place to bring your pups.

name: deborah jackson
text: One of the best burgers I have ever had!!!!!! Awesome place

name: Joseph Lanier

name: Olin Barnes
text:
Always fun great burger you can go by car or boat Dog friendly
I see someone I know almost every time I go excellent memories and live music often but check

name: Mike J
text: Great food and drinks, relaxing atmosphere.

name: brandon hebner
text: Lots of dogs, bikinis, and alcohol. What more do you need. There is a reason you can’t get a spot here most of the day. If you want to come here, get here early or pray for a spot because that’s the only way your stepping on their beach.

name: Paul Hopper
text:
Amazing burger and great bushwackers. Busiest times are from 12-5 on the weekends or really any day. During peak times, expect to wait an hour or more for food. Just relax, grab a drink, and enjoy the people watching.

We love this place for the whole family (bring the pups too!).

name: Cheryl Dunbar
text: Loved going there with a friend on her bday on 6/12/20. Always been a nice place to go. Family friendly and pet friendly. What I didn't like was not everyone had there pet's on a leash. Mostly though it was great! Shallow water for kid's to play in and you can also rent boats...charter and they will take you out. Some boats have two slides on the back and others have none. If you get a chance to go...GO! Oh...most people where self distancing which was great but didn't make me to nervous because your outside! Love PIRATE'S COVE!

name: Ria Fox
text: Adventure awaits! And a really expensive meal or maybe a chunk of cash for a Shirt that said Pirate's Cove on it. Hey but the food is great, the bathrooms are clean and you can take a little swim on their beach.

name: Ariella Laura
text: Has Always had a lovely staff servingn fun atmosphere great tasting food music is very interesting too especially love the library room.

name: Brad Bailey
text: This is a great place to visit for the view and a little look at the way locals enjoy living in lower Alabama. Not a big selection of beet, but lots of mixed drinks and some pretty decent food items.

name: L A
text: I am not sure where the reviews came from, but I can tell you they are WAY off. If you are looking to park your boat and drink you are better off to byob , then you will be happy. The wait on food on a day that was slow with about 15-20 boats was over 1.5 hrs. When I asked the high school kid working the food pick up where my order was he said he did not know anything about it. After talking to the bartender who took my order she had to go back and figure it out. 10 minutes later I got half of my order and it was really soggy. I will NEVER order food or buy a $11 8oz Bushwacker ever again.

name: Tiffany Williams
text: Great lunch spot out on the boat

name: Bill VanSant
text: A local hangout to boat over and grab a burger and a bushwacker. Good people

name: Doug Barnes Barnes
text: It is a nice family place you can come by boat or car the food is great has a private beach for you to use and outdoor space for eating and drinking or watching the sunset

name: Shawn Gentry
text: Great place to swim for kids

name: monica jones
text: fun place, great bushwacker

name: David Keller
text: Had the time of my life good times

name: Scott Young
text: Awesome. Good local place for all to come hang out.  And dogs are welcome  good swimming are for kids  and big kids. And we come buy boat

name: john carter
text: Beachy here , and good food

name: Waazal
text: Loved the atmosphere! Cashier was a character! Sweet pups waiting for you to drop a perfectly fried potato wedge. Pizza is amazing! Highly recommend visiting at least once during your stay! Well hidden gem!

name: Carl Black
text: Great locals place. It will be packed with boats and people on the weekend. They serve the best hamburgers also.

name: J Hyde
text: I haven't been there yet,I'm working on a house across  the bay,but I heard it's a good place to go.

name: Natasha Sickels (tasha)
text: Dog friendly beach.

name: Nyabinghi Djehutti
text: Home of the local favorite frozen drink, the Bushwhacker!!! Nice white sand beachfront location features boat docking for a sea approach. Has live music on two stages with built-in sound system and engineer. The patrons, aka the Riff Raff, are lively, enjoy good music, and come to have a good time. Great burgers and quality beer selection make this a 5 star experience.

name: Aprille Hayes
text: Great dog friendly beach. Cold beer and great burgers!

name: Rick Arnold

name: Robert Harkins
text: I had lunch there...Their famous cheeseburger,  it was delicious the beer was ice cold and service was excellent and the view was breathtaking...

name: VL Thompson
text: Very active, live music.. awesome hangout. Kid and pet friendly.

name: Ashley Mccormick

name: Brian Jordan

name: William Davis

name: Matt Follick
text: This is a fun local bar that you can bring you dogs to the beach, great beverage choices, and they have amazing views.

name: Tiffany Shutt (MissTeeTeeLee)
text: This is just an all-around fun atmosphere. The food prices are fair..... Drink prices a little much but hey who isn't? After all that's where they make their money. But it's a fair trade off for the no fee access to their public beach/Marina. Make sure to go early to get a good parking spot and that perfect spot on the sand for the day, and let them take care of the food and drinks. Quick tip: call in your order while laying out and get a text when it's ready...

name: Kristy Brasher Cromer
text: Best bushwhacker ever

name: Chad kiper
text: Always the best. Dogs, boats, swimming, food, music, sand and fun people. Great staff.

name: Sara Benoit
text: Overall we had a great experience. Our server was very friendly. We had a large party and no problems with the accuracy or speed of our meals. Of the eight of us, only one disliked her meal (fish tacos). The only sorta issue was the state of the women's restroom. Otherwise very clean and inviting.

name: Chris Powell
text: Cheese burger in paradise. Best Bushwackers around

name: Lainey Raynor
text: Fries were awesome. Sausage dog and fries,yummy! Buns were so freaking fresh and soft.

name: Mega Clopton
text: Rude cashiers. Food was blah. But a convenient place to dock the boat and eat

name: Cori Lyn McLean
text: Love! Great place to bring the family, young and old, and fur baby friends! Awesome music, food, gift shop,  and excellent charity events- Autism Awareness is one example

name: Dave Lyon
text: Great place to boat to and enjoy the day

name: Jeffrey Robinson
text: Delicious food and drink with awesome atmosphere. Pet and kid friendly.  Get there early or you will have trouble parking a car or a boat

name: xXHazey DayzXx
text: Fun for the whole family

name: mary phebus
text: The most friendly ( including doggies ) small beach with a FAB bar 🍺🍷! Lots of boats coming ashore to visit with all 😎

name: Mark Tomon
text: Doggie heaven

name: Phillip Orsburn
text: Can be a fun place for singles and with their beach,  families too. Not to expensive for a tourist type location. But they do have a souvenir shop on site.

name: Steve Smith
text: Going in by boat is getting more and more difficult, especially summer. Used to get there 10:45, just before opening, could get in. Always delicious burgers, pizzas, get it to go. Head to the islands to hang out.

name: Brad Snelling
text: I like this place. Especially during the off-season when it’s not so crowded. My buddies and I love to sit out on the deck with drinks and something from the kitchen. When I bring the kids they love to watch the dolphins swim by.

name: Erin Morton
text: Beautiful area... took a dolphin cruise which was a lot of fun!

name: Michael Troxel
text: Busy but quiet

name: Alan Thacker
text: Great rustic spot for a burger in the Perdido Bay area. You can drive up, but it seems that most visits are by boat.

name: Freeda Moore
text: Pirate's Cove is a very low key local hangout. You can anchor your boat right on the beach and get your belly filled before heading back out for a day of fun in the sun. This establishment serves burgers, fries and alcohol but is still very family friendly (pets are also welcome!). Expect to wait. No shirt, no shoes, no problem!

name: Charlene Boncal
text: Loved it the dog swam with us and the water was nice. Didn't have to worry about rip tides

name: Lew Bacchieri
text: Terrible bushwackers.

name: Will Abbott
text: They are almost done with renovation after Sally. They are expecting to open by next weekend. Stop by next weekend for a drink and a burger. Let them know they were missed !

name: Barbara Sutherland
text: Love it not to far to walk to bleach

name: Kelli Lovelace
text: How can you not have a blast at pirates cove!!! Fun for everyone. Kids and dogs included.  Best bushwhackers ever!!!!

name: Kenny Smith
text: Dirty, horrible service, bad food.

name: Brad Morgan
text: A one of a kind, unique and possibly life changing experience. If you are  afraid of southern culture, please do not visit... Wonderful people, wonderful vibe and awesome pizza! The cheeseburgers and bushwhackers are worthy of a visit, but you really need to try the pizza!

name: Jordan Barganier
text: The best place to go....service is excellent n u can not find better people.

name: Christina Hall
text: A Wonderful place to bring your Kids & Dogs

name: Cherry Fowler
text: Only the best place in the whole wide world! Best owner's, family, staff,food,drink's, dog's, my home away from home ♡

name: Sarah Turner
text: Best burger, dog friendly and great staff!

name: Daniel Botts
text: I love this place. Fun and relaxing atmosphere with sand, water, boats, dogs, and of course food and drink.

name: Jim Marszalek
text: Get a Bushwacker. Best way to arrive is by boat. DOG FRIENDLY BRING THE POOCH TO THE BEACH.

name: mark Cleveland
text: One of the Top 5 spots to see & be seen at while out on your boat. Best damn Burger for any Beach Bar I've been to. Love that the place is Dog friendly. Bushwhackers aren't bad either

name: Tim McCullar
text:
A bit nasty ,no fans or air in restrooms.
Beer was not very cold.dogs all under your feet looking for food. Much to crowded .food was nothing but poor to ok. I had sausage on bun wit kuralt  it looked to have been made earlier wrapped and refrigated then heated in microwave when ordered. Really not the place for me. Very hot everywhere no really cool place to get cool.

name: Jay Solivan
text: Crazy fun place. Go by boat, lots more fun that way. No whining zone for sure. Burgers are good, great bushwhackers. Come ready to be entertained. I wish I lived closer, I’d be there once a week at least. They upgraded the bathrooms!

name: Melanie Newton
text: Great atmosphere! Awesome music! Good food! Nice beach.  Everyone very friendly. Cant wait to go back!

name: McKenna Ponder
text: Overall bad experience. Looked in the kitchen the cooks were eating people’s French fries off of the plates. Person at register was rude. Do not recommend.

name: Geoff HockeyDad
text: Great little marina that has been around forever!  The staff is always friendly and helpful!  There is always something going on!  They have TV's for sports games, marine fuel and all the vital supplies for a boat outing!

name: Brandon Powe
text: Great place to hang out and relax on their beach, not only that but they have good food to eat.

name: Susan Peele
text: Great burgers, bushwhackers, and atmosphere. No social distancing was observed though so beware!

name: Allison Barry
text: On boat or by car wonderful eccentric place

name: Katie Kimball
text: This place was AMAZING and quickly became my family's favorite spot when visiting the area. My daughter calls it the "doggy beach" because of all the sweet dogs that visit. Definitely a must visit spot and the bushwackers were delicious!

name: Virginia McCarter
text:
Family owned restaurant and bar. Drive up on the beach in your boat or use the docks. Best
pizza I've ever had(sadly I've had a lot).
Amazing scenery everywhere. Something for everybody! You can even bring your dogs
if you can restrain them.

name: Mike Hipsh
text: To pricey and Un friendly staff.no social distancing

name: Jeffrey DeVries
text: Get the Bushwhacker - it is great

name: Shannon Sumrall
text: Fun out of the way place that is more locals than tourists.

name: Butch Foster
text: Good friendly bar nice people everyone was polite and helpful. Bar tender was fantastic it's a must see place they make you feel like a local

name: Kathy Mcintyre
text: Friends brought us to this great place on the water. Tasty food, friendly staff. Thank-you very much!

name: Matt Follick
text: This is a fun local bar that you can bring you dogs to the beach, great beverage choices, and they have amazing views.

name: Margret Watters
text: Awesome food, great for families and pet friendly!! Love it!

name: Jay Solivan
text: Crazy fun place. Go by boat, lots more fun that way. No whining zone for sure. Burgers are good, great bushwhackers. Come ready to be entertained. I wish I lived closer, I’d be there once a week at least. They upgraded the bathrooms!

name: Sarah Turner
text: Best burger, dog friendly and great staff!

name: Virginia McCarter
text:
Family owned restaurant and bar. Drive up on the beach in your boat or use the docks. Best
pizza I've ever had(sadly I've had a lot).
Amazing scenery everywhere. Something for everybody! You can even bring your dogs
if you can restrain them.

name: McKenna Ponder
text: Overall bad experience. Looked in the kitchen the cooks were eating people’s French fries off of the plates. Person at register was rude. Do not recommend.

name: Mike Hipsh
text: To pricey and Un friendly staff.no social distancing

name: Katie Kimball
text: This place was AMAZING and quickly became my family's favorite spot when visiting the area. My daughter calls it the "doggy beach" because of all the sweet dogs that visit. Definitely a must visit spot and the bushwackers were delicious!

name: Geoff HockeyDad
text: Great little marina that has been around forever!  The staff is always friendly and helpful!  There is always something going on!  They have TV's for sports games, marine fuel and all the vital supplies for a boat outing!

name: Coty Hoyle
text: My First BushWacker!

name: Robin Meredith
text: Always Fun!

name: Richard Lance
text: Awesome place with great people. Family friendly and loved the pizza

name: Art Stanton
text: Dog and kid friendly beach with comfort food and live music.  Beach your boat or use the docks.  Bushwhackers and local brews.

name: Linda Connealy
text: Very busy. Great salads!!! They love dogs!

name: Joseph Berman
text: So awesome.  Just go.  Bring your dog.

name: Dagmar Neves
text: Casual beach side burgers, dog friendly, good place to have lunch.

name: Jason Houk
text: Great spot to beach the boat on a hot summer day! Fantastic drinks!

name: Matt DeBlaey
text: Great place away from the crowds of tourists... Just crowds of locals! I needed a pick me up today, they helped me out with no trouble. Like a huge group of old friends.

name: ETN Gabel
text: Our most favorite place to spend a day. Burgers, onion rings , bushwackers and sunshine

name: Ashley Spann
text: Delicious food and drink with awesome atmosphere. Pet and kid friendly.  Get there early or you will have trouble parking a car or a boat

name: Martin Mccord
text: Great place to tie up boat and have a bushwhacker & burger

name: Tim Caldwell
text: Great burgers and great bushwackers!!!  Great place to hang out and play in the water with the family and fido!!!

name: Debbie Chapman
text: Wonderful the water was nice and clean...always enjoy Pirates Cove...the food was really good today!!!

name: Kay Postles
text: Lines are too long..

name: Kimberly Diane Rouse
text: Great place to hang out & chill.

name: Susan Dees
text: Bushwick with a floater!!!

name: Kay Lancaster
text: Had a blast

name: Mike Hill
text: Killer good time!!! Never Anything bad to say about a staycation.... With good food!!!

name: BJ Foster
text: Nice kid & pet friendly place.

name: ReelDistractionAction
text: Had cheeseburger and onion rings. It was great! Fun atmosphere,  and you can bring your fur babies to play on the beach.

name: Dennis Waldron
text: Great place for boats and families. Great food.

name: debbie maclean
text:
I give the spot a 5 star review on location only. The food we had wasn’t fit for human consumption. In fact we tried to give it to one of the dogs and he wouldn’t eat it either.
My husband and I ordered a hamburger and onion rings, pretty basic food to prepare. Take onion rings from the freezer. Add to fat that is the right temperature. Didn’t happen. They arrived just warm and soggy. Dripping in grease. When cooked properly they are crunchy.
Hamburger meat was the lowest grade you can buy and so greasy that the fat transferred through the outer paper and dripped all over our outdoor table.
I spoke with the cashier about the onion rings and by her response I didn’t bother to mention the burger. I was told that their onion rings are famous, that’s it!!!!!!
We walked away because there are many other beach restaurants in this region that will serve delicious food beachside and want to know if there is a problem and correct it immediately.

name: SeeKay
text: Unique place where people can pull up their boats on the shore/docks, eat and drink. I kind of enjoy that it's dog friendly, as there is always a random dog nearby to pet when you're hanging out on the beach. Obviously watch your food, though. Drink prices are about average. You can get bushwackers for a better price if you buy one of their plastic reusable Pirate's Cove cups. Food is.. okay. Live music, swimming areas,  and 2 or 3 bars to buy drinks from.

name: Phyllis Wallace
text: Good burgers and I loved the atmosphere.  Right on the he river.  Boats can pull right up to the pier and go into the restaurant, order your food and eat the get back on your boat.  Pretty cool.

name: Jerri Pitts
text: Beautiful view good food and great drinks

name: Lloyd Heard
text:
Three dangerous things in life:  1, running into a rattlesnake.  2, eating taco bell only for two weeks.  3, starting a tab at Pirates Cove.

The food is on point, the drinks are perfect on a hot day.
You will get a nice snapshot of the world from your stool facing the water... from the tattoo queens who have no business wearing what they are wearing, to the fancy doctors and lawyers in their nice boats, to the guy with the rebel flag on his pontoon boat powered by a noisy 9 hp motor from the 50s.
Bring the dogs...
Bring the kids...
Take home an insulated cup....  you will wonder where all your money went the day after...
it is worth it.

name: Katherine Arnall
text: A wonderful local hangout! The food is straightforward, but delicious, and they have a great selection of drinks. I loved that we could pull up to their docks on the boat, and they even have a beach area next to the restaurant. The staff was super friendly and made sure we got everything we asked, even though we were a large party of 30 people! If you're in the area, definitely check this place out!

name: Telly Bailey
text: My favorite place to visit! Great atmosphere.

name: LaStella Ellison
text: Had a great time relaxing by the water!

name: Ashleigh Fulmer
text: Good food! Great place to park the boat. And have some fun!

name: Brian Skelton
text: Good daytime atmosphere with great drinks. The service could be a little more friendly when they make a mistake. Ordered 3 meals got 2 and they server said I didn't pay for it so to bad! It appears the cashier didn't enter it right so I had to get back in line wait while fam ate.

name: Joel Graves
text: Great atmosphere, the food and Bushwackers are off the chain, everybody watches out for all kids and dogs here.

name: Nikki Turney
text: Love the vibe.  Laid back and casual, outdoor seating with nice water views.  Cheeseburger and onion rings are delicious.

name: Tim Doran
text: Great stop! Old southern spot on the water.

name: Kevin Kerney
text: Great place for a boat ride to lunch or dinner.

name: Abigail Jones
text: My dad has been bringing me here since I was a toddler and I am now 21. We both love it.

name: Richard Lance
text: Awesome place with great people. Family friendly and loved the pizza

name: Eric Chastain
text: Super good service and friendly staff. Food was great super fun place. Gotta go there.

name: Martin Pippin
text: One of muy favorite spots near gulf shores and orange beach.

name: carol lance
text: I love Pirates  cove. Great way to spend  the day.

name: Janet Mckenzie
text: Great as always. Had the outside all to ourselves. So beautiful at night with the lights.

name: Leila Cruthirds
text: Always amazing!!  The best atmosphere.

name: Keith Williams
text: The funkiest place around!  Good food, good people, and great music in an unbeatable atmosphere.  If you don't know where it is,  find it !

name: Jesse White
text: Very good burgers!

name: Chuck Armstrong
text: Awesome atmosphere, very friendly staff, pizza and burgers amazing!! It’s a must stop every beach trip!!

name: Prince Pretty
text: It's the ultimate hangout spot in Alabama specially if you visit by boat!

name: Dave Tastic
text: The food isn't quite like I remembered it. Not that it wasn't good, just not the same. I really love this out of the way spot & it brings back happy memories

name: Michael Daniels
text:
Pirates Cove is the ultimate place to relax. Great view, good, and drinks. We love taking our out of town guests there. Never disappointed!

By the way, our dog loves it too. Truly a pet friendly place.

name: isaac hudgins
text: Has fantastic potential. Unfortunately it is adorned by the laziest most uncaring self absorbed phonestruck teenagers ever. If u like a nice spot on the water to get an out of date nasty warm beer for 5.00 and a frozen patty with 11 inch hairs in it hamburger for 10.00 each , then this is your spot. Personally,  I won't be back.. What a total waste of prime OXYGEN and SPACE

name: Shelby Byrd
text: Great food but some salty language from some of the customers.  Don't be surprised if your kids pick up a few new words while eating.  Love the view and the water access.

name: Larry Muckelroy
text: Nice experience,good music, if you have a boat just run up on the sand bar or to the dock when there is room.  If you are uppity it's not for you. It's a small town honky tonk and lots of fun.

name: Regina Swanson
text: Fun place, great view, best people watching.  Good bar food.

name: Susan Berent
text: This salt life bar and restaurant is a delight. Small sandwich and burger menu...well one burger...a cheeseburger...do not ask for it without cheese!  It is so good I wanted to rewind and eat again.  Bushwackers could have a bit more coffee taste...onion rings are really good.

name: Jodi Donald
text: Super fun place with great live music! Saw The CHILLBILLIES last weekend, they were awesome!! Can't wait to see them again in July!

name: FIREBALL PRODUCTIONS
text: No entertainment on holiday weekends and closed at 9pm. But I love the place. Go there often when we're fishing the hamburgers are outrageously good even though greasy they're homemade and so delicious it is a down-home atmosphere lots of animals and dogs running around and people just having a good time. I love it

name: April Ezell
text: Pirates Cove is great! It is family friendly and I do mean family! You are allowed to bring your dogs with you here so they can also enjoy some good food!! Very friendly and helpful staff! Food is really good! And it is clean! I would recommend this to anyone. Especially to someone looking to be able to bring your fur baby along!

name: Ray Minor
text: Always great place to stop in when down in LA (lower Alabama).  Food is always good and drinks are cold.  Usually always have there famous burger but had the wings this trip.

name: Chief Wickware
text: Great place to enjoy with family and friends. Shallow blocked off swimming area.  2 live music areas. Dogs rule!  If you don’t like dogs running free enjoying the water with their owner(s), move on. Bar/Counter staff is the best around. Highly recommend for afternoon fun.

name: Remar P
text:
Was hoping to eat some sort of seafood, but they didn't have any seafood on their menu at all. I think this is more of a "locals" place where they go to get basic bar foods.  Besides that, seating was very limited and mostly outdoor and it was HOT with only one large fan blowing for the entire outdoor area, which was rather large....and the gnats, ugh, don't get me started on how annoying the million gnats were and that was before the food even came out.
On a good note, I can see it being a neat place for the locals. They can drive their boats basically right up to the restaurant and it seemed most knew to call in orders ahead. The "beach" seemed neat and people could swim while they waited, ate, etc.

name: Sutonia Sizemore
text: Good food and great company. They have a great staff and treat you like they have known you forever. Loved it!

name: Ashley Beth Crawford
text: Love this little gem! Perfect for everyone! Restaurant & bathrooms! Food is always awesome! The bartenders are so friendly & really appreciate the business! There is plenty of room for everyone on the beach. Dog friendly. And one can arrive by boat or car!😎

name: Muck Movement
text: Great place to party. Accessible by sea and by land. Excellent staff.  Bushwackers are great. 👍 Food is good with fairly speedy service. A bit pricey for what you get.

name: Elaine Moore
text: Had a blast here! Foods great, and the people are great, if you ever have the thought to go here, DO IT!

name: Zach Rutledge
text: It's not often that I find myself hating an experience at our local restaurants, but this was one of those times.  I waited over an hour for what turned out to be a quite average hamburger, in what barely qualifies as "shelter" from the elements.  Yeah, it's really got a great view of the bay, and yeah you can drive your boat right up and grab a bite... But those are literally the only redeeming qualities of this place.  This might just be the most over-hyped restaurant experience on the entire Alabama gulf coast.

name: Sylvia Darby
text: We love this place !!! I read the few negative reviews and can only imagine these people would not have liked this place regardless. Pirates Cove is unique and stands alone. As my husband describes Pirates Cove " It is a place where dogs bring their owners".  We have always received great service, no matter how busy.  This place crosses all the barriers of the types of people that love it. We hope it never changes...We are local and regulars of Pirates Cove !!

name: James Faulkner
text: I love it when its not packed. It is memorial day weekend and it is extremely packed. still a great place

name: ANTHONY RASA
text: If you like drinking and bad food you will be rt at home. We went by boat to get something to eat. Ordered the cheese burgers they where real spicy. I was told you have to tell them now if you don't want spicy. My guess is spicy make you buy more drinks. Anyway I don't enjoy it. Better places around that are Not as RedNeck

name: Jeannie Woodall
text: As always, an awesome place to just kick back alittle.

name: Alexis Lyle
text: Fun atmosphere, place to swim, dock or beach your boat! Their pizzas on the weekend are amazing!

name: Elizabeth Deneau
text: Burgers were very good. We will go back again.

name: Charles Barton
text: A fun place to go whether driving or boating. Great food and beverages.

name: Susan Harper
text: Great burgers, Bushwhackers and random dogs! Laid back place .

name: Amy Bushon
text: Clean and beautiful place to take your kids wish they had something like this back home I'm from Detroit Michigan

name: Dawn Sunshine
text: Best burger I have had in forever! Great location and atmosphere. Fun beach that the kids could weather the evacuation from hurricane Michael.

name: Chef Plooshay
text: The restaurant was in a nice location and had plenty of dogs and music, but we waited about an hour for 2 cheeseburgers and 1 order of fries. The food was not worth the wait.

name: Bonnie Jacobsen
text: Very nice.  Quiet.  Nice for children.

name: Suzy Fellabaum
text: Best Bushwacker in town and the burgers aren't bad either.  Dock your boat and shimmy up to the shanty to place your order. Plan on a wait as there is usually a crowd. Grab a table on the beach if you don't mind four legged friends. Lots of people watching to be had! It's a great adventure if you love super casual dining.

name: William Monroe
text: Off the beaten path. I'd have it again if I was on a boat. It was a good burger and great onion rings

name: Troy Walbaum
text: This place is really cool, but only if you have pets. The food was okay, the service a little iffy, but the place is super cool. Completely dog friendly with a beach. I was only there during the day, but it looked like they were setting up for some nighttime entertainment. I'll definitely be returning.

name: Cindy Carter
text: Great beach ambiance. Good hamburgers!

name: Deshae Robinson
text: Yummy food, friendly guests and employees plus the best Bushwacker youll find! Always something to view as boaters, swimmers, dolphins,birds,dogs and fish are always taking advantage of natural beauty surrounding the restaurant!

name: Jason Roberts
text: This place is so cool. Everyone here is so chill. Awesome environment

name: Ernie Ashbaugh
text: Great cheeseburgers, and other finger food and interesting location on the water.

name: milt paquette
text: Had a cold beer, overlooking the bay. Heard they have a great burger and fries. Next time.

name: Timothy Hollinghead
text: Good food and good time. Bushwackers are not worth buying. It taste like you are drinking whipped cream.

name: Rollin Rippel
text: Cool little dive. Great cheeseburger! 🐕 Dog friendly. Good place to kick back 👍 Redneck Riviera at it's best!

name: Rose Strotman
text: Friendly service. Great food. Fun place for kids and dogs. Nice beach.

name: bryan r Blume
text: Fun vibe, great burgers.

name: James Wix
text: Great place to have an awesome time,,, bring your wallet.

name: William
text:
Have been here numerous times and the burgers are great. We made the drive here before heading back home just to get a juicy burger. While waiting on friends to finish a cigarette in the parking lot and standing between our vehicle and another vehicle in the parking lot....a female on the deck starts screaming at me saying, "Get off my truck, don't be leaning on my truck!" I kindly replied "I'm not leaning on your truck." The lady continues to holler at me and even cussed me. I assumed that this female was just a customer at the restaurant. As we were about to walk in I asked if the lady works here and the reply was yes. I told them that we will go spend our money somewhere else!
Just a word of advice...you may want to treat your customers a little bit better than this! For your employee to treat a customer like this is very ridiculous and unprofessional! Also, your employee may want to think twice before she screams at someone again because others may not be as nice as we were! You guys just lost a customer who has sent your establishment lots of service! Oh, and by the way....I wouldn't have leaned on your vehicle anyway because it needs to be washed!!!

name: Nicole Broxson
text: Love that they text you when your order is ready so you can continue your fun in the sun!

name: Valeri Waughtel
text: Local, fun, off the beaten path.  The bushwackers, kicked my @@@.  Nice cove, marina,  sand, and a joint for food and drinks.   Loved something different than the beach!

name: Jason Roberts
text: This place is so cool. Everyone here is so chill. Awesome environment

name: Chef Plooshay
text: The restaurant was in a nice location and had plenty of dogs and music, but we waited about an hour for 2 cheeseburgers and 1 order of fries. The food was not worth the wait.

name: Alexis Lyle
text: Fun atmosphere, place to swim, dock or beach your boat! Their pizzas on the weekend are amazing!

name: Cindy Carter
text: Great beach ambiance. Good hamburgers!

name: Ernie Ashbaugh
text: Great cheeseburgers, and other finger food and interesting location on the water.

name: Rose Strotman
text: Friendly service. Great food. Fun place for kids and dogs. Nice beach.

name: milt paquette
text: Had a cold beer, overlooking the bay. Heard they have a great burger and fries. Next time.

name: Jamie Knowles
text: Cheeseburger, fries, beer. It's all you'll need or want. Fancier after rebuild after Hurricane Ivan. They now have very nice dock so don't have to beach boat on sand and climb over tunnels of your boat. Basically everything you could want in a barefoot beach hangout. Eat outside, place kids can swim, bathing suits about as fancy as you need to be.

name: Elizabeth Deneau
text: Burgers were very good. We will go back again.

name: Timothy Hollinghead
text: Good food and good time. Bushwackers are not worth buying. It taste like you are drinking whipped cream.

name: Linda Lester
text: Awesome place family and dog friendly  great place to have fun always enjoy going there

name: Shelley Hayes
text: It's a wonderful family and pet friendly place

name: Jamie Knowles
text: Cheeseburger, fries, beer. It's all you'll need or want. Fancier after rebuild after Hurricane Ivan. They now have very nice dock so don't have to beach boat on sand and climb over tunnels of your boat. Basically everything you could want in a barefoot beach hangout. Eat outside, place kids can swim, bathing suits about as fancy as you need to be.

name: Lulu Belle
text: Had a great time chilling and enjoying the music. I WILL BE BACK! The lady bartender with the short hair was super friendly too! A must for locals.

name: Ellen Thompson
text: Great place to chill out.  Food so so but watchi g the boats come in and out and the children swimming is great!

name: Steve Vrana
text: Love coming to Dog Olympics 🤗🌅🍹🌴🐾🐩🐕

name: Thom Kesson
text: Beautiful layout. Bartenders are all awesome. Swam with dolphins here for the first time in my life. Great energy, great vibes. People here are more than hospitable. Gotta love Pirates Cove. 😎👍

name: Michael Mugan
text: I took the wife and grandkids for supper..  We walked in and walked out. Felt like I was in a filthy tavern and every where I looked was dirty..  I also noticed a bunch of drunks with there dogs sitting out front...  Was the worst experience at a place in the Gulf Shores area!!!

name: Laura Lynne Ellis
text: Simple and a locals joint.  A fun place,  good food.  Nothing fancy.  Come as you are kind of place.

name: Laura Orr
text: Incredible place to enjoy a burger, catch a buzz and watch the sunset!

name: Carolyn Hoskin
text: I have been visiting for many years, the burger is not as good as i remember, they have added pizza to the menu which is pretty good and someone in our party said the wings were good. You will wait awhile for your food and the drink lines can be quite long. The beach access and swimming are great. They top the bushwackers with 151 here but are a little more expensive.

name: DENNIS ELLERBROCK
text:
Ok...I get the idea of barefoot, bathing suits, boats, dogs and bushwhackers .   I am all for it.   But you have  to have some degree of organization/management.  Ordered cheeseburgers...waited 48 minutes.   Go to the counter..."Oh these might be yours" ( cold, wilted lettuce, soggy buns ).  Why didn't someone bring them out?   " Oh, we are not doing that now, it's shift change".
3rd straight trip with this type of thing.
Hot dogs served on hamburger buns " we"re out of hot dog buns".   Pizza order given to other patrons ...." " No, we didn't give them your's ".   Then where are they.    I am done.

name: Michael Thomas
text: Love this place , the atmosphere just can't be beat.  If ya don't like dogs you may not feel the same as I do . My dog Tolly loves this place , he jumps off the boat usually before we pull up. Best hamburger ever

name: R.J. Baker
text: It's where Jimmy Buffet wrote is econ song cheeseburger and Paradise! 3 bars dog friendly live music and I can arrive and leave by my boat! What not to like about an establishment!

name: Kathryn Henderson
text: We always have so much fun here! Laid back atmosphere.

name: Joan Knallay
text: I love this place!  There's a nice beach for swimming and good food. There is access by boat or car. Really nice family spot.

name: Michelle McCrea
text: This place was once a very well kept secret but apparently word has gotten out. Still great people great food and you can bring your dog!

name: Jimmy Smith
text: I liked it but the music out under the hut needs an upgrade

name: Lord Shaxx
text: It's great, and there is always a dog for you to pet walking around, the pizza is amazing and the burgers are as well.

name: Jeff Strohman
text: The web sight said the band would start at 4 we spent 200 bucks eating and drinking as a birthday party  at 533 the band wasn't even close.  Sorry we wasted our time

name: Michelle McCrea
text: This place was once a very well kept secret but apparently word has gotten out. Still great people great food and you can bring your dog!

name: Summer Shiver
text: Great family friendly place fabulous food and if you drink you should absolutely oder a bushwacker

name: Joan Knallay
text: I love this place!  There's a nice beach for swimming and good food. There is access by boat or car. Really nice family spot.

name: Laura Lynne Ellis
text: Simple and a locals joint.  A fun place,  good food.  Nothing fancy.  Come as you are kind of place.

name: Shelley Hayes
text: It's a wonderful family and pet friendly place

name: DENNIS ELLERBROCK
text:
Ok...I get the idea of barefoot, bathing suits, boats, dogs and bushwhackers .   I am all for it.   But you have  to have some degree of organization/management.  Ordered cheeseburgers...waited 48 minutes.   Go to the counter..."Oh these might be yours" ( cold, wilted lettuce, soggy buns ).  Why didn't someone bring them out?   " Oh, we are not doing that now, it's shift change".
3rd straight trip with this type of thing.
Hot dogs served on hamburger buns " we"re out of hot dog buns".   Pizza order given to other patrons ...." " No, we didn't give them your's ".   Then where are they.    I am done.

name: B’s Bees Hargraves
text:
Reviews on this place depend on the person expectations.  I expect a good hamburger, cold drinks,
and a great open minded play space for my family of people and dogs.  There is water access which
completes the package.  I love this place and the environment it has.  Very unique in that sense.
If you are uptight and do not like animals you should avoid going there.

name: Mary Beth Lassitter
text: Love Pirates Cove!! Great place for small kids and big kids to play in the water! Very dog friendly, great food and service!

name: Marlene Pethtel
text: Dog friendly good food fun place whether you're on a boat or drive

name: Feliks Yamnik
text: Very interesting place. We stopped to get a Bushwacker, a frozen adult beverage. It was as good as promised and I would go back just for that again. The place could definitely be described as a whole in the wall. Didn't get any food but everyone around us was getting burgers and they looked good. There were dogs roaming around, not homeless but I think local residents. Mainly going up to tables with people eating begging. Some people enjoyed their company, others not so much. I don't think the dogs were bad but I could see them being a nuisance.

name: Nathan Davis
text: Awesome Food, great service, ok bathrooms, boat and car parking.

name: Richard Long
text: Good place to get a drink if you're on the water running around

name: Megan Scarborough
text: Love their hamburgers and Bushwhackers!

name: Jen Barber
text: Warm welcome from staff and patrons. Family atmosphere and just a nice place to enjoy your time.

name: sarah jessica
text: Best damn cheese burger in paradise! Quick fast friendly service! Highly recommend to check out!

name: Kelli Ball
text: A favorite beach hangout.  Very laid back atmosphere and tasty food and drinks.

name: Alvin Osthoff
text: Great blue cheese dressing, very nice water spot for hot weather .!

name: Gail Colburn
text: Fun place! Dogs are welcome. Wood fired pizza. Good burgers.

name: Lisa Hobbs
text: Great bushwacker! Really fun atmosphere, pull up to dock and have a great time!

name: Garry Gurley
text: Cheeseburgers were the best I've had so far.

name: Roger Pettis
text: This place is a blast! Great burgers and onion rings. Awesome Bushwackers! Great, party atmosphere and live music. Its gonna be crowded during the summer.

name: Gary Stiegler
text: Best hamburger and worth the wait.  Workers are great and very friendly and.efficient, especially JJ.  Good bush wackers too.

name: B’s Bees Hargraves
text:
Reviews on this place depend on the person expectations.  I expect a good hamburger, cold drinks,
and a great open minded play space for my family of people and dogs.  There is water access which
completes the package.  I love this place and the environment it has.  Very unique in that sense.
If you are uptight and do not like animals you should avoid going there.

name: Brenda VanLannen
text: It was awsome! I would sooo come again!

name: Hazel Tillman
text: Oh my gosh the Cheeseburger is freaking delicious!!!! Love that you can bring your pets also.

name: Anne Butler
text: Such a fun place. Awesome burgers!

name: Charles Jones
text: Cheeseburger in Paradise...with all the trimmings of Old South!

name: Tony Mehan
text: Will be back, great atmosphere

name: P “CoachPrep” S
text: Fun, cool, laid back place to hangout for drinks and food.  Right on the beach. Boats pull up. Usually somewhat busy but it's big enough. Live music. Party atmosphere

name: keith grubbs
text: Good for hotdogs and a nice view

name: bjjenkinsand3kids

name: Robert Shafer
text: This place is off the hook awesome. It's split into two buildings. You have the beach bar separated by sand and picnic tables then you have the main building. Inside the main building there's treasures of past visits all over the place from stickers to license plates to you name it it's probably there. It's called the Pirates Cove for a reason if you're on a boat you can pull up to the docks or beach it near the building. The people are friendly, if you order food besure to listen for you name because your servers will be calling (there's no intercom). If you are in the area check it out. This will be a place I will return to and recommend to everyone.

text: Wow! It lives up to its name! Beaching the boat or jetskis is the way to go...or drive on over for some good ole fashioned beach fun! Something for everyone! great music, basic, good pub food, and bring the kids and pups ...they are all welcome!

name: Ellen Courtney
text: Truly one of the highlights of our vacay to Perdido key every year. We make it a point to get in the boat and get to Pirates Cove. It has a run down feel, where people are laid back and dress how they please. There are patrons that bring dogs and just a few random dogs running around the grounds but make no fuss over you unless you call them. It is always busy. You can drive there, pull up to the marina in your boat or just beach it. Kids can play in the water or sand beach area. In my opinion they make the best bushwackers PERIOD. The food is always consistently amazing. Seriously, their pizza is outstanding, as well as the fried pickle spears, fries and burgers. Go, you will not be disappointed!!

I then called the cops and as soon as I started talking to them he decided to give them back to us.  Completely unprofessional restaurant in every aspect.  1 star out of 5 is being generous in my opinion.

Great place to spectate, shoot the breeze, let the kids play in the water and enjoy an early evening sunset.

text:
Luckily the food is good because service and management is horrible. After waiting 1 hour, I asked Sarah (apparently the manager) if we got anything off or some concession for waiting an hour on food. Her response after laughing was, "Uh no, sometimes you'll wait 2 hours." Not a very managerial thing to say to an unhappy customer.

She then tells me to go check with the kitchen. Again, not very service oriented. I would hate to see how it is when they are actually busy.

Would recommend more training on interacting with guests and how orders should be filled.

text: There is the gulf coast, and then there is Pirates Cove. While the sandy white beaches fill with plastic people flaunting tourism and often disregard there is a little hideaway with great food, bushwhackers, music and dogs. If you don't like any of that then there is some fake attraction down the road for you to waste your days on. For the rest of us...there is only Pirates Cove.

name: Ronnie Gamble
text: We had a great meal with personal service from Jessica our bartender.  The restaurant seating was still limited due to covid, so we sat at the bar without having to wait.  Jessica was constantly moving washing glasses, getting her bar mixes prepared, mixing drinks and was always updating us on our orders.  The steaks were cooked to perfection.   We made a wise choice in eating here.  Thanks for a pleasant experience.

resp.text: Ronnie, the pleasure is ours! We're happy to hear Jessica could help you feel right at home. We look forward on your next visit🍻

name: Tomjr z28
text: Great food and a damn good server the folks at the door could use some help

resp.text: Tomjr, thank you for the 5 stars we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. This gives us a better understanding of what we are doing well and what we can improve on. We’ll work on it and see you again soon🍻

name: Daishaun Morgan
text: There are having staffing issues. They need help the poor manager was doing everything just to keep orders moving. The wait time was to long, so we went next door. We will give them another try in a month or so. Usually great food and service.

resp.text: Daishaun, we are very sorry to hear about the wait time. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: Mike Hayes
text:
Me and my dad went here for lunch.
The service is located the African-American bus man that was helping bring stuff to the table was very polite had very very good manners.

But when I tell you the cook overcooked my daddy's fried shrimps until they were and cook my grilled strips until they were tough and burnt on the outside.

And my daddy's steak was tough..

Those are just the facts..

Get the cook away from the stove and maybe let him prepare salads probably won't be going back there

resp.text: Mike, we're so sorry to hear about the issue with the fried shrimps and grilled steak. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and we will be checking in with the Trussville store. If you'd like us to follow up with you, please reach out here: https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Sorry again for the inconvenience.

name: Mary Conner
text: Steak wasn't cooked medium rare the first time. We travel a far to eat here every weekend.  Spoke  to manager  Greg and he had our ribeye steaks cooked. The 2nd time cooked was medium rare.  Thank you Greg for making our trip worth it. Will ask for you.  No wait for my adopted Nither thats in a wheelchair with dementia.

resp.text: Mary, it was a pleasure to serve you. We gladly share feedback like this with our Trussville team so we can make your next visit worthy of 5 stars. See you again soon! 🍻🥜

name: mason Reeves
text: The food was great the server was really really great i loved my visit the place was clean just a wonderful place hi highly recommend

resp.text: Mason, we’re happy to hear that! We're glad you had an awesome visit 🤘

name: Tommy Morris
text: My wife and I decided to stop by after doing some shopping. We go in and the guy tells us it'll be 40 minutes.. well it's 8 p.m. on a Thursday night and they close at 9..We tell him no thanks and as we are walking out  we count 5 tables that just haven't been cleaned off and the bus boy is sitting in a chair playing on his phone. It's already limited seating due to the social distance. You'd think they'd be more focused on getting the tables cleaned faster.. maybe this is one reason why they have low ratings.

resp.text: Tommy, thank you so much for bringing this matter to our attention. Please know we take your feedback seriously and will be following up with the Trussville location. Rest assured that we'll pass your message along to our team.

name: Nesser C

When I got the confirmation email, I called the location that it went to, which was this location, and asked them to add what was left off. The person said she'd get it added. text: Since they have reopened, the food is inferior to before. The steaks were smaller. The new appetizer we tried was tasty, but small. We got the supposed 1/2 pound bacon appetizer. The 22 oz Porterhouse steaks my husband and son got were small looking. None of the steaks were cooked property. My Mom asked for Med Well and got rare. We had to ask for croutons on the salads. The waitress was apparently new because everytime we asked about something she remarked this was her first night serving. Did bring a new potato for my husband when he forgot to order it with no sour cream. Not impressed over all.

text: I always order the baby back ribs, sides, rolls, & a strawberry daiquiri. The ribs are very tender, they just fall off the bone. The rolls are to die for. I always have to get a dozen to take home with me. The daiquiri is mixed just right for my taste. Very frosty, no overpowering taste of alcohol, but very relaxing, before you know it. Sometimes the service could be a little faster, but I always leave wonderfully miserable from stuffing myself.

Had she worked for me, she would have gone to the house immediately.  This is why we're going to end up in a shutdown of this country for 3-4 months and a lot of us will end up losing everything we have worked so hard for all these years.  Grow up little girls and boys working in this place and follow the rules. Think of someone else instead of yourself for one time.
