name: Petit J
text: Incredibly, today around 12:15 pm I experienced the worst dining experience at any Logan's Roadhouse to date.  There were three factors. Baby Back Ribs were not properly cooked......an ongoing problem at all the locations in the Birmingham area.  I have learned to have a picture on my phone showing the proper preparation when I run into this problem.  As I was politely attempting to explain this issue with manager John Prince, Mr. Prince's attitude was hostile, uncooperative and confrontational. When I asked if he knew how they were supposed to be cooked, he replied, why don't you tell me how they are supposed to be cooked.    At this point I knew I needed to document the conversation and started my phone recorder.  Mr. Prince said I am not going to talk with that recorder on.  I asked Mr. Prince's name and he just stared at me.  I then prepared to leave and Mr. Prince said his name and walked off.  My waitress did a splendid job.  The issue with the ribs is they were pre-cooked as usual, but then they were not finished on the grill.  They were warmed up and BBQ sauce smeared on them. It appears that race may have even been an issue.......I am white and Mr. Prince is black. Mr. Prince never acknowledged the ribs were not properly cooked nor did he offer any apologies or consolation for my dining experience. At approximately 5:15 pm, Logan's District Mgr Charlie Eben called me in response to my complaint.  Mr. Eben assured me that employees would be retrained to insure that proper food preparation would result and the John Prince would also be counseled.  Sorry Mr. Eben!  I have heard promises like that too many times.  It is a roll of the dice no matter how many free meal cards you want to send me.  Your sincerity is in doubt.  There are too many good and quality companies out there with whom I will do business.  Just for the record, I am including a photo of your signature Baby Back Ribs when prepared properly.....and this photo was taken at the Trussville location several years ago when they were doing it right!

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave a review. We appreciate your feedback!

As for the food...average at best. Steak was just OK. Vegetable skewer was under cooked.

name: tiffany brown
text: Myself Husband and 4 children came to eat on December 16 around 6:20pm the hostess stated there would be a 15 minute wait, and we agreed to that. 30 minutes went by along with 3 other parties ranging from 3 to 5 people. I asked The hostess how much longer and she said her manager was waiting for a party to finish before she sat us. Another 10 minutes went by and I began to get upset because our placement should not be based on when another family finishes eating. We were about to get up and leave but a server came and got us, told us he was working a big party but he would be more than glad to serve us. Keep in mind the hostess never came by to address us again, nor did any manager. We would probably still be sitting there now if the server who was around the bar area did not offer to wait on us. Now granted I am not an unreasonable person nor am I impatient but the lack of professionalism displayed by the management team was unacceptable. We arrived around 6:20 we were not eating to well over 8:00 pm. I didn't want any discount or free food just the common courtesy to say I'm sorry for your wait and we will get you and your family served as soon as possible, but I guess that was too much to ask for. It will be very unlikely for me to ever Dine at this establishment again.

resp.text: Tiffany, this is not alright with us! We're so sorry that there was a bit of a delay in the food preparation during your last visit.  Can you connect with us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment? We'd like to get a few more details as we definitely want to address this with the Trussville team and make things right.

I will continue to drive straight past Fultondale even though I live less than a mile from there just to eat a well prepared Steak that doesn't remind me of a burnt tire and give me and the other 3 people that managed to choke down what we could food poisoning!!!  Trussville even continuously checked to make sure our food was good and our drinks were full, Fultondale made Houdini jealous when it came to everything except their expectations of a tip...  I also like the idea of prepackaged peanuts in times of viral concerns.  Fultondale needs to absolutely learn a thing or two, well everything from the Trussville store!!!

resp.text: Jonathan, we love hearing our Trussville location took care of you. We hear your feedback about our Fultondale location and will share it with the team. Thank you for the 5 stars and see you again soon 👋

text: Worst dining experience ever and I didn’t even get to eat. I arrived at 9:47 which I know is late however, NOBODY greeted me not the bartender whom was in my view not the waitress at the bar booths there was even a busses whom was walking back and fourth out the door. I started yelling “hello? Can I get some help is there any one here?” Nobody flinched. I sat on top of one of the peanut barrels and waited. Finally the waitress at the bar booths approached me and my friend and asked have we been helped I told her no and we had been waiting for a while and I even had started yelling to get someone’s attention and they never came she then proceeded to take her phone out and look at the time then said “well....what y’all want? I mean I can go get my manager..” so she went to get the manger while I waited on her the busser from before approached us and asked “were you ladies trying to get a table?” I told him the same thing I told the waitress he said “well...that’s because we’re closed” I said no you’re not he laughed and said “oh what is it? 9:59?” I said I didn’t get here at 9:59 though he then told me he didn’t even care because he was off the clock (still in uniform) and walked away...to buss a table. The manager finally approached me and I told her what had been happening and I that I watched her in the kitchen about to walk out look at me and turn around, I informed her that I had managed restaurants including fine dining and this was not how business works she told me she was in the back rolling silverware (even though I saw her) and said she could give me a coupon. I declined and let her know the staff was extremely rude. If I could give this location -5 stars I absolutely would. Horrible.

Was surprised from the situation they get 1 star because I was told before ordering my food but lost 3 for poor planning, whatever the reason may have been I'm not sure, maybe the cooks walked out or got fired, maybe the grill stopped working, maybe they saw a rodent in the kitchen, I'm not sure but they were maybe a little less than at 1/2 capacity.

name: P Kennedy
text: To start, the greater picked up a napkin off the floor and wiped the water off our table with it...like we didnt see it. It took 35 minutes to get a salad, 55 minutes to get our appetizer and well over an hour and a half to get our food which was served cold! The managers first suggestion was to warm it up-I'm assuming in the microwave, then to get us more food, but we couldn't wait another hour...by now it was almost 10:00pm, so she eventually took off the cost of the meals, but we had to pay for our drinks...which was fine. Doubt that I'll ever patronize this place again, nor will I recommend it to others.

name: Angela Whitaker
text: My son and I were the second set of customers to walk in the restaurant today, Sunday, as soon as they opened. We were thinking that one of the first orders of the day when it wasn't busy would surely be one of the BEST orders, not completely true. Although my food was ok, my son's wings were fried really hard. He tried to eat them because he doesn't like to complain but I advised him that you should be satisfied with what you pay for. We sent the wings back and told the server that we would pay for the three wings he ate and ordered something else. The manager came out, not to apologize, but to tell us that we didn't need to pay for the three wings. Oh ok, thanks. Guess that was his solution to the problem but then we receive the replacement meal. The replacement meal that we paid full price for and paid extra to get an upgraded side of macaroni and cheese that came in a container that was less than half full. So what do we do? Pay the bill, tip the server her 20%, take the food and leave to not return any time soon until someone in management encourages the kitchen staff to always work hard at sending out quality food. So when you visit, let me know if it has happened. Happy Sunday!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Angela. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

text: In the beginning we waited for 20 min before someone even came to ask if we needed a table and there was seats open all over the place. The waitress that served us was very slow and overcharged us by 20 dollars. I ordered a Margarita and did not receive it until my meal was already done. I then found out our waitress made my Margarita instead of a licensed bartender, which is why it was way too heavy on the tequila. The waitress also started talking to us about very inappropriate things such as birth control and giving us advice about kids in the future and how we should have never started using money as currency in america. When we found out the check was wrong we told the waitress and she came back and she started complaining about her boss to us, her customers. We stayed there for 2 and a half hours and received very mediocre food. The manager was nice and knew what she was doing, but the staff was very lazy and slow.

name: David Chesser
text:
Decided to try Logans again after the last time that was a complete disaster.

It was better this time but it was still poor. We had to wait over an hour to get seated. Which can be understandable but it wasn't because they were busy. It was because they didn't have enough wait staff there.  Over half of the restaurant was empty. Then they seated four 2 tops before me and my wife and 1 child. Even though we were next in line according to the hostess. I can understand seating 2 tops over 3 because they are busy and that's what's available but they had half of the restaurant empty. There was no reason to adhere to section integrity when tables are open. Then they were out of the steak I ordered and when the steak I chose  was served it was cold.

In the end the food wasn't bad but wasn't worth what I paid or the 2 plus hours we spent there. I have finally learned my lesson and will never ever give them another chance.

We never heard from a manager to explain what was going on. Just a young sweet girl and an overwhelmed waitress.

I've said it before but now it's definitely true. I will never ever eat at any Logan's again anywhere in the country. Pathetic at best. Do not waste your time or money.

name: Amber Burgett
text:
Do not waste your time. Hands down the WORST dining experience I've ever had in my 30 years. The wait wasn't too terribly bad, but after we were seated was terrible.

My roommate, her son, her girlfriend, and I were sat and promptly greeted by our server. We each ordered drinks, and then our food. The salads were pretty good, but then things took a U-turn.

Our food was first brought out to the table next to us. When we brought this to the attention of the server who brought it, he said "Let me go check the ticket." I know from some knowledge shared with me that when that happens, a fresh order is to be made because it touched the table. So the same man finally brings us our food, with the exception of my roommate, which I happen to know is another mistake, as we should have all been served together. I should also note these plates were the same ones as before, which I happen to know because I had a clear line of sight to the kitchen from where we were sitting. This is a health violation.

So after bringing our steaks out, I notice mine is undercooked (I ordered medium and got medium rare). My roommate's girlfriend's steak has been cut into, which is ANOTHER huge no-no. When this was brought to the attention of the man who brought them out (the same man I mentioned before), he claimed that was how it was cooked and acted as if he didn't care when we stuck a knife straight through the pre-existing hole in the middle of the steak.

After the guy walks off, my roommate's girlfriend goes to our server and asks to speak with a manager. Our server points directly at THE GUY WHO HAD BROUGHT US OUR FOOD. You remember him- the rude one. So she asks if there is another manager around. Keep in mind that my roommate still hasn't seen the first morsel of her food. She informs her that the other manager's name is Jennifer and she will be right over. Jennifer was great and went above and beyond to try and turn our visit around. She quickly explains she will check on my roommate's food and bring fresh steaks out to replace the ones we had.

My roommate finally gets her food, and there is cinnamon all over her baked sweet potato- which she specifically ordered without cinnamon. But there is also cinnamon all over her steak- why would the steak have cinnamon on it in the first place? So they bring out a fresh potato, which tastes like it's been sitting out for about 2-3 days before it was brought out to the table.

My roommate's girlfriend and I finally get our fresh steaks, and mine is RARE when I cut into it- worse than before.

We left not having to pay for any of our food, including what my roommate's son ate because his was fine- but I still won't be back. HORRIBLE experience.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your disappointing experience. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with you. Thanks.  Thank you, Timothy. Someone will be in touch.

name: Anissa Ledbetter
text: Took forever to get drinks. Food was ok. One from our party had a hair in there food. One had a loaded baked potato that wasn't loaded! Waitress was okay

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Anissa. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

name: Jenna Leigh
text: I went with my family last Saturday for a birthday celebration, and the service we got was inexcusably terrible. Let me say I've been to this Logan's many times since it opened, in fact it use to be one of my favorite restaurants in Trussville, but that has definitely changed. We got there a little after 2 PM and had to wait for a table until almost 3 PM. Now, I understand it was a Saturday, so even though it was annoying I was willing to look past it. Once we sat down, we sat there for 45 MINUTES without anyone even acknowledging that we were there. My uncle had to get up and go find someone to even get them to come take our drink order. After finally placing our drink order, it took another 45 minutes to get our drinks...and most of us ordered WATER. Our waitress had a terrible attitude,  we didn't even get our food until almost 5 PM, and once we did get it, it was not good. 3 1/2 hours for what should have been a simple lunch, when most of it was due to sitting around waiting on someone to even acknowledge that we were there is ridiculous. If it hadn't been for my grandmother refusing to leave, we would have left. And then, when my uncle asked about getting a discount, because there was no way we were paying full price for the terrible service, the manager had the nerve to ask "Why do you need a discount?" Even the management didn't seem to care. Needless to say, I will never be back.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear we fell short of a great time. We'd like to follow up with you, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

How freaking hard is it for a server to walk by and say "hey I'm really busy but I'll be back in a couple minutes" if we would have been told this then I would not be leaving this review. The manager (who I will say was extremely busy and did do all she can to handle the situation) then told us "Taylor" will be our server and she should be by any second. Thanks Taylor for never showing up. Probably for the best, we waited another 15 minutes and then decided it was time to leave. We will not be returning to this restaurant or any Logans anytime soon. Save your money and go to Red Robin next door or Rock n Roll Sushi across the street. Or drive to the other side of Birmingham and you may still get your food faster than anyone at this Logans will get their drinks.

name: K Russell
text:
It really saddens me to have to change my review of this place. However, after this pass weekend, they left me no choice. My fiance' and I go to Logan's faithfully, so needless to say, we have spent too much money in this place to be treated the way we were. The service and food quality has really gone down hill. Quite frankly, I can see why they're having to close so many locations now because the competition is better. Granted, all of the other Logan's in this city ARE indeed horrible, but this one was still the best in my book. That is no longer that case!

First of all, we ordered a basket of fried pickles, and we received a half of half basket of fried pickles. I would rather they just told us they were out rather than bring us what they did. We ate those because we were hungry, it was getting late, and we expected a much better dinner than appetizer. It got no better! We waited over 30 minutes for food, and when we got it, most of it was cold as hell. I guess our waitress forgot about it and left it on the counter. My fiance' had meatloaf that was not thoroughly cooked in certain areas, he never got the fries he ordered, so he practically left everything on his plate, he never touched the mashed potatoes and gravy. Our waitress took up our concerns with the manager about our 30-minute wait and the missing items, and as a courtesy she removed 3 whole dollars from our ticket. That was the cost of a side! Gee thanks! You took off what exactly? Our taxes off one of our sides! Then she goes on to explain that they had a party of 35 people come in that they had no idea was coming. That's great, but what the hell does that have to do with us? That's not our problem!! If your business can't serve large parties while maintaining the quality and integrity of your food to all other visitors then you SHOULDN'T be in business... PERIOD!

Basically, we paid full price for horrible food and horrible service. It's sad because we WERE faithful customers, and Logan's just lost us. On top of that, we were not the only people complaining about them when we left. They had people in the waiting area and parking lot who were also not very happy with them.

resp.text: We appreciate your positive feedback! Thanks for reviewing us!

name: Chris Brown
text: Decent steak for a chain restaurant, though my past experience wasnt exactly stellar it wasnt bad. Mixed drinks were great, rolls were fantastic, and the service was great. For a regular night out for dinner it doesn't disappoint but keep expectations in check.

name: Kayla Gunn
text: Horrible experience. We walked in and the hostess had a look on her face as though she didn’t want to be there and when asked how long it’s like it kills her to give an estimate. She is like that every time we go. So she tells us 15-20 minutes for 2 people when the place is not even close to half full. So we wait instead of leaving....that was wrong on our end. We get sat and the manager comes by to get our drink order gives us rolls and at the time we think everything is good. Some odd time later a woman comes by saying she will be our server as Danny is the manager and she will take our order. We both ordered the 6 oz filet med rare and sides. At least 40 minutes later our meals come out not medium rare and the look and cut of the steak is that of a sirloin. Now we have ate at this location plenty of times and have ordered filets from Logan’s plenty of times. When the server came back we were just ready to go and had wasted a good portion of our day now having to go find lunch elsewhere. I offered to pay for our drinks and my boyfriends salad but the server said not to worry about it. We won’t be returning to this location! Thanks for ruining our Sunday lunch!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Kayla. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

name: Tammie Bettis
text: When arriving we had to wait to be seated even though the restaurant was not that busy/occupied. the hostesses could not decide where to seat us and seemed to have a problem among themselves about the seating. After being seated we waited  10-15 minutes on a server who kept passing by our table stating that he would be back to get our drink orders. When he did come back he was apologetic but this kept going on all night. It took at least an hour or more for us to receive our food order and when we did the food was cold and some sides were missing from our plates.  After stating our concerns the staff/manager acted as if it was no big deal that our food was not hot. I will never patronize this restaurant again when visiting from out of town. By the way my family and I visited another Logan’s in a different city and the staff was totally different and recognized that we had to wait a little longer than we should have without us mentioning it and offered to discount our meal. Customer service goes a long way!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Tammie. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and we will be checking in with the store. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

text: Not so good this time, it was like no one wanted to wait on us or help us , we stood in the front entrance as people pass by, then we were finally seated! After finally receiving our food  it was not hot! not a good experience this time.

name: ira lucas
text: Totally disappointed in my visit, Sunday December 16, 2018. I have eaten here several times and the service has been average, but yesterday was awful. The hostess said it was a 30minute wait to get a table and their were people ahead of me waiting. However she said that if I would sit at the bar that there would be no wait and I would get immediate service. What a misstatement. As I proceeded to the bar, I couldn't help but notice 6 tables empty and wondered why no one had been seated there. Anyway, I sat at the bar and spoke to the gentleman who was seated to the right of me. He said that it had taken 20 minutes for them to take his to go order and that he had been waiting an additional 40 minutes for his prime rib order to come. After about 20 minutes of waiting myself, the bartender/waiter finally brought me a menu. I told him I wasn't expecting to wait an hour for my  food like the gentleman next to me. He said food was coming out in about 30minutes which obviously wasn't happening. Finally the waiter came to take the order of the gentleman on my left side who was with a young boy. He had been waiting over 30 minutes for his order to be taken. He explained to the waiter that he had ordered prime rib on his last visit and was disappointed because there was more fat than meat on his portion.  The waiter told him that the prime rib is usually very fatty and that gives flavor to the meat. I thought to myself that I have eaten prime rib at many places that had little fat and was very meaty, juicy and tender. The bartender/Waiter then suggested that the gentleman order the new York strip. At that moment I changed my mind about ordering the  16 ounce prime rib and decided that I would order the 22 ounce porterhouse,if I could ever get my order taken. By then the poor guy on my right was getting antsy because he had been there over an hour and said that if he had not already paid for his to go order that he would leave. Finally someone else came and asked him what he had ordered since he had been sitting there forever. That  person went to the kitchen and the bartender finally came out about 5 minutes later with the man's order. I thought to myself I hope he has his order right in his bag after that awfully long wait. So now I've been waiting over 35 minutes and still have not had my order taken. So now the bartender waiter guy goes to take someone else's order, bless their soul who was there before me. At that point, I could not take anymore,so I politely got up and told the people around me to have a nice evening and left. I would think that a major franchise as Logan's Roadhouse would provide extra help on busy days like Sunday. I left went to the grocery store and bought a large tbone steak and took it home and cooked it. Oh, also one lady ordered only potato skins to go and said she has been there over 30 minutes. I give yesterday at Logan's a negative -10.

resp.text: Hi, Ira. We're sorry to hear that your experience wasn't the best, and we will be looking into this for you. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

name: LaTreda Johnson
text: Horrible! First, we waited 35 mins to be seated bc they did they didnt have any open tables, but there were plenty available. Then the hostess called us to be seated. When we got to the table, it had alot of water on it. So the hostess picked up a used napkin off the floor and cleaned the table off. After getting the table wiped off again, we placed our order. We even put in an appetizer of spinach dip. An hr goes by and still no food or appetizer. Finally, and hr and 10 mins later, the appetizer comes out, and it was salted and tasted old. We had them take it back. An hr and 30 mins later, or food comes out.... I ordered shrimp and rice with a sweet potato... yeah no sweet potato and the food visibility looked old, but was cold. Finally the manager comes out and says I'll take it to the back and put it in the microwave... really? We waited 2 hrs for food and now you want to microwave it? Uugghhh no.. I wont be going back. Wasnt worth the time and if they are that nasty to pick up a used napkin off the floor to clean a table, just imagine what else they do when you arent looking!

name: pamela byars
text:
THE FOOD
The food was ok nothing to brag about. We ordered the filet med/rare it was more rare than med/rare but I was ok with that mine had hardly any flavor at all to it. Our potatoes was not quiet done and my salad was ordered with 1000 island dressing which I usually love at Logan's but the dressing here looked like 1000 island but tasted like French.

THE SERVICE
Our waitress was nice and friendly enough. A little hard to catch her attention when I was not real sure if ahe had brought me unsweat tea instead of sweet tea but once we finally got het attention she did everything she could to make it better. So no complaints there.
APPEARANCE
Clean the restrooms needed some attention but once it was relayed to the staff they were made aware of the fact that they needed attention and so I assume that was taken care of.

OVER ALL EXPERIENCE
It wasnt so bad that I wouldn't go back but will make sure to be more specific in my ordering as well as asking questions to make sure my idea of sweet tea and theirs is the same.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to review your experience, Pamela. If you'd like us to follow up with your concerns, please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS. Thank you.

name: Patrick Haggerty
text:
This was one of the worst experiences ever. Yesterday June 11th my family and I went there for my daughter's birthday dinner. We got seated right away. But then it took 10 minutes before the waitress came to take our drink orders. This was shocking since the restaurant was fairly empty. Also The waitress tried to bring my daughter Coca-Cola  twice when she had sweet tea that was empty . But that is not a big deal. Upon receiving our steaks That's when we were told that what my youngest daughter ordered they did not have. They asked her to re-order while the rest of us had our food in front of us.
I am not the type of parent that will eat in front of my child that has nothing. At that point I asked to speak to the manager. I watched as the waitress went over to the manager and told her I would like to see her. But she did not come right over. It took at least five minutes before she came to see what was going on. I explained what had happened and she did not even apologize. I asked her what we can do at this point. She said she would take our food back and make sure that we all got them served at the same time. It just did not sit right with me that she did not apologize and I had to ask what we can do to fix the situation. At that point I asked her for a check because we were leaving. It was then she just pointed towards the door. Again not apologizing or saying you don't owe anything. Just pointing towards the door. So we walked out and left the food on the table To say I am disappointed is an understatement. I especially felt bad for my daughter who just wanted to eat there on her birthday. Judging by the other reviews and my experience. This location has a serious problem from the management down.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your poor experience. We would like to follow up with you regarding your feedback, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

text: Worst experience ever tonight. Food was aweful and the service was even worse. My salad came out with my dinner, my son had to ask 3 times to get water and more bread. When I asked the waitress if she could get my to go side salad as fast as she could (seeing that I already paid for it and I over paid on my bill) there was literally about 3-4 bites of lettuce. My son had practice at 6:00 and it was close to 5:50. Mind you we we got there at 4:45 and ordered right away with our drink order. We were done eating before 5:30. This is a real shame since my son is obsessed with your dinner rolls and we frequently dine there. I will never go back again. I paid for things I didn't get. I don't know if the cook was new but my steak had so much seasoning on it it was barely edible. I scraped as much off as possible. If our waitress would have been more attentive I would have said something. We spent too much of our time seated with no one taking care of us. Even when I said I have to go please give me my receipt to sign, she dropped it off with no pen. Leaving me to have to chase down another waitress to borrow her pen. As horrible as it was our waitress was kind when at our table (twice). We will eat at Logan's again but never again at the Trussville location.

name: Terra Janel
text:
I simply can't believe how poor the service was on Saturday, June 3, 2017!  But now my friend and I look back (2-3 days later) because we're still distraught over our experience, there were several red flags, which started from the moment we walked in to be seated.

1.  When we walked in to be seated there was a customer complaining about there service and how they never received items that they ordered.

2.  The first thing we noticed once seated (which was promptly considering they weren't busy at all) was the table across from us hadn't been cleaned.

3.We sat for about 15 minutes before a server (black male). finally came to our table.  He stands there with his arms crossed speaking abruptly says, "have y'all decided what you you want to order". Without a greeting or introducing himself, we were caught off guard because it felt like he was a drill Sargent commanding us to order our food! We ordered and noticed his arms were still crossed AND noticed he wasn't writing down our order!  It felt as if someone made him come to serve our table.

4.  While we were enjoying our appetizer, which a nice, cheerful young lady brought to us, he returns once to let us know since it was 2:44 p.m., it was too early to put our order into the system because  it's a certain time to order the 2 for $15.99 special, which we understood.

As a result of not writing down our order initially he came back to ask what our orders were again!  Then shortly after that, the initial young lady comes back to ask my friend what his entree was.

5.  Also, while we initially started eating our appetizer, we noticed there were no napkins.  My friend had to get up (while on crutches and wearing a boot) had to go find us napkins!

6.  The entrees were served and the first thing I noticed was my salmon seemed very dry and I thought it was because the oil topping was missing.  I also noticed I received a mushroom skewer, which I'm allergic to mushrooms.  I was supposed to receive the veggie skewer.

7.  The table across from us still hasn't been cleaned, this has been after sitting there over an hour (2:30 - 3:30 at least) looking at it.

8.  After talking to the sweet manager and explaining to her that this could be a training moment for our server(at this point we hadn't started eating to notice the actual condition of our food), by this time,  we're frustrated and ready to leave.

9.  While the female manager was adjusting our ticket to remove the appetizer, I noticed my food wasn't cooked properly.  The sweet potato wasn't cooked all the way through!

My friend has to get up once again, now to request carry out containers because we haven't seen our server lately except from across the room while he was just standing there talking to someone.

The server comes to ask if we need carry out containers.  I explain that my friend just left to go find containers. At this point he realizes hat we can use a refill on our water, which was the best 2nd thing we've had after the appetizer.

10.  The next day (Sunday).my friend takes his dinner to work and realizes his chicken isn't done in the middle!  This is when he and I start to reflect on our overall dining  experience at this location!,

I do not recommend this location, please consider the Fultondale or Crestwood locations, l've only had good service and food from these locations.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your experience. We would like to follow up with you regarding your feedback, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

name: A McKinney
text: Run from Dusty the waiter!!!! My family came to this restaurant 8-27-16. I ordered the Roadhouse salad because it had avocado on it and i also ordered a frozen margarita and potato soup. My husband ordered the bone in rib eye and my daughter ordered the brisket nachos. We waited 30 min to get our drinks and bread and 45 min for our wing appetizer. When we asked why he told us the kitchen was backed up. When my salad came it had no avocados and he said they were out. They brought my husband steak without his side of ceasar salads that came 20 min later. The steak was not seasoned had to use steak sauce. Slow service. Took 15 minutes to take our order and a half an hour to get our drinks. Our appetizer took 35 minutes.  According to our server, they can’t read minds... I ordered a margarita and it arrived virgin and frozen. The server had to taste it because he couldn’t believe they had left out the tequila. I wanted a regular on ice margarita with tequila, but I did not specify properly
Next I order blackened tuna sandwich. It arrived cold and raw. Blackened it was not. When I asked why is this not properly cooked, I was told 30 seconds per side and then placed in a bun was how they serve this dish. Again they are not mind readers and I did not specify I wanted my tuna cooked and rare. Stupid me.

text: The exhibits always appeal to my inner child. Whether it be something I can play with or just an interesting educational display, it's always fun walking around and seeing what appeals to me. I especially liked the Illuminated fog, Geysers, Giant mirror, Colored shadows, Slinky trampoline and Scott Weaver's Toothpick sculpture. The giant mirror kept us entertained for quite some time as it was super trippy walking around in front of it. Bobby L showed his skills with the slinky trampoline. When none of us could do it for longer than 5-10 seconds, Bobby made it go on forever. The toothpick sculpture is impressive as well. It took the artist 40 years to make it, but he recently added his face to the sculpture. It was frustrating for some to find, but I found the whole process amusing. You should drop by to see if you can find it.

Some of the staff had a very offputting attitude. We will go back next time, but if we still feel like that again twice, most likely wont go back. name: Barrett Lee
text:
It's the weekend and we've landed @ one of our fav places with one of fav local groups Al & Kathy. My honey is having rum & cokes & I'm slammin' my usual ice waters with triple lemons :-) It's good music chips, salsa & queso with a breeze of the bay baby!!

I'm ashamed to see that I've failed to write an appropriate review before now but it may be because we were enjoying ourselves so much that I just dropped a quick note and forgot to come back and correct it but whatever the reason let's fix this now.

First of all this is a real-life locals place and I found it way before I was a bonafide local and loved it. It's not on the proverbial beaten path and you had to be looking for it to find it to begin with. It's not out of the way, mind you, but it's a straight shot out canal road a couple miles past Doc's at the big intersection and right on the water across the bay from Zeke's, Cobalt's & Perdido Pass. There's a long and spacious parking area right out front that will accommodate enough cars to pack the place to the rafters and there's a couple long transient piers by the docks so access by water is easy and free.

It's a huge palapa bar that looks like what you'll find on any given Caribbean island with big surround bar with tables all around plus a series of tables around a wrap around deck that all looks out onto the long series of boat docks just past their nice patch of sand (about 25' wide with cornhole games) and of course  the water. The view is excellent from almost everywhere you are except in the sand pit. Oh yes, the sand pit is another bar about 15' lower that has more tables, a big circular lounging palapa, some adult swings and even high chairs for youngsters. I do se thst's where some folks bring their kids but they're okay anywhere. It is more than just a bar, indeed they serve some pretty good food here too. Before the food & drinks you can sit inside under the massive thatch roof that's "decorated" with a lot of random stuff from pirate paraphernalia to neon signs & enjoy the open air beach bar vibe with some live music or pick any spot down in the pit, by the docks, in the sand or on the deck to just relax & chill.
side note: they have 2 gender neutral bathrooms that have the only air conditioners on the property :-)

On to the food, my personal favorites are the fish tacos and the crab cakes but there's a good selection of other stuff as well. For apps there's nachos, seafood gumbo, homemade pork skins, wings & other bar food finger foods. Tjey've got some salads, and their sandwiches include my fav the pork tenderloin plus burgers, Buffalo chicken & pulled pork & a club. For entrees there's Gulf fresh shrimp & fish baskets, fish tacos & wraps. But wait there's more ... they have some pretty darn good pizza with a big selection that rival a pizzeria. For sweets there's two offerings for dessert, the hot fudge brownie with chocolate sauce & 2 scoops of vaniĺla ice cream, that's okay but the key lime pie is way better.  All that plus they do have a kids menu.

I haven't tried their bushwackers but I've heard they're good and they serve a variety of frozen & island drinks and importantly the beer is good & cold.

Bottom line: It can get pretty full after quttin' time (remember I said locals) but you can probably get a seat at the bar until a table opens up. The food is pretty good, the service is friendly and good and if you're local or not and looking for a great view with a beachy island feel then this is the place you were looking for

name: Christina Maltese
text: Terrible service, and an extremely rude wait staff coupled with average drinks and food. This was my third time here and I’ve had similar experiences every time so we will not be back again. I think I’ve seen enough. The staff cannot handle the busy summer season nor can they handle the slow season either as we’ve had terrible service and long waits no matter if it’s busy or slow. On this most recent visit, our waitress was very rude, refused to give us a cup of ice water unless we were sitting at a table and assigned a waitress so we patiently waited for a table and got a round of drinks while we waited and then when we got seated and the same waitress that denied us a cup of water while we were waiting, told us we had to leave the table unless we were getting a round of drinks and food with her right then. We planned on getting drinks and apps but wanted to finish our initial round first as we’d just gotten them. Consistently I’ve had a disappointing experience and this just was it for me. Anchor Bar, Playa, Flipper’s are all within minutes of this place and have much better attitudes, food and drinks! Highly recommend trying those before you waste your time on this place.

name: Jesse Ryals
text: Last night I was invited to meet 3 friends at the Tiki Bar. The food was great, and the other customers were very nice. The drinks prices were average. Where the one star comes in is the bartenders. They were not very attentive or customer friendly. Then she brought the tab over and I put in half with cash and closed the tab holder. A few minutes later it was opened again and the cash was gone.  I asked the bartender where the cash was and she said she took it and put it by register. It was not enough to pay the tab, so why take it and place by the register?  So, she placed the cash back in tab holder And refused to deduct the $38 cash from the tab so we could then pay the balance with our debit card, so we paid with the debit card. We had drank quite a bit and thought we had put the cash back on our possession, but after we got home, we realized they had kept the cash and we paid the entire $72 tab. I feel they took advantage and won’t return.

text: Great locals hangout. Great drinks and great views of the water.

text: Reasonable prices, friendly, fast service and good typical light fare. I had the chicken strip basket, they were nicely done crisp, but not too crunchy. Seasoned crinkle cut fries were so-so.  My son had the corn dog and said it was great, big jumbo hot dog inside and delicious breading.

name: Phil Kaplan
text: I Got Bushwacked!

name: Amber Dion
text: Popped in on an random afternoon and Jill was the perfect bartender to run into. She knows how to cater to her individual guests seamlessly. Thank you.

name: sarah jessica
text: Perfect place to go on the boat to. Doesn't matter where you sit there's always a good spot to watch the sunset. The service is fast and Friendly 😊 the food is exquisite! I highly recommend to stop and try!

name: Christopher Yoke
text: Great place to stop and have a drink and dinner. Awesome atmosphere with great entertainment. Have been here several occasions and plan to go back again. A must visit place, the staff is very courteous and friendly. Highly recommended!!!

name: Jesse Hoffman
text: The tiki burger was excellent. Liked the atmosphere, we enjoy fishing and I liked the marina location.

name: Ricky Louis
text: Cool place for a drink

name: Da Man
text: Local hangout. Good drink, mediocore food but it's on the water and has volleyball and Cornhole

name: Rebecca Carl
text: Great little place to get good food and have beautiful views of water.  The wings are great.  We will be back.  It is probably fun place at night to hang out for drinks, we went for lunch.

name: Chris Olson
text: Great view of the marina and big view of the bay! Nice atmosphere. Were there for a cruise.

name: Martin Mccord
text: Great place for fish taco's and a Bushwhacker.

name: Ryan Austin
text: We were here because we had done a dolphin cruise, got back around lunch and it was open. We were very pleased with the food and the service. Prices were so much more reasonable than all the tourist stops down there that we usually go to.  If we're in this area again come I will definitely stop by.  Cant go wrong with the blackened grouper tacos.

name: Jeff Hamilton
text: Awsome bar, awsome food, awsome service from Randi the bar tender...and the pit bar has swings for seats! Could be a trip to Urgent care but sure would be a good story!!!.😁😁😁

name: Tamie & Steve Spaulding
text:
Excellent food & service
We had pork tenderloin with fries, & chicken tacos

name: Morgan Robichaud
text: We were playing disc golf near by this place and saw it and decided to go. We ended up paying 10$ per drink almost and they weren't very good. I highly recommend flora bama instead. The music is better, the drinks are amazing and cheaper, and the view is practically the same with a better beach. It's not an awful place, everyone is nice so maybe our one time going wasn't the best, but I'd recommend giving it a try if you have a few days to try different places.

name: Kenny Powell
text: Friendly service! Good food! Good music!!!

name: Doug Thompson
text:
Horrible service from bartender (female). We ask several times for different items and didn’t get much response. The last time we ask, she got very rude and acted like it was an inconvenience to serve the customers request. I close out my bill and she snatched the money out of my hand. Needless to say we had a few words. Never will be back to this hut!!

Flippers is better anyway!!!

name: Greg Flasck
text: A great place in Orange Beach to enjoy a drink and watch the evening set in on the cove.  Prices are in line with everywhere else in the area.  The service can be pretty casual, but the view from the deck area makes up for that.

name: Brad Utley
text: Always a Great time at the Tiki Bar. Great music,food and service.

name: Danielle Richards
text: Love this place! 2nd time here in 3 years, love the food and the atmosphere. Great live music!!!

name: Jenn Gai
text: Great service from Lisa. Had the Seared Tuna with Tiki Sauce an I would order again. The view is wonderful an relaxing.

name: Tom Jennings
text: Great food, great service, and live music! We had a enjoyable evening there tonight!

name: CooLittle Panda
text: Its a really cool set up and a fun hangout spot, but the food is ok(not bad, but not great)

name: Sean Feely
text: Always great food and service!  We go in the boat regularly and sit at the bar.  Everyone is friendly and most of the time there is live music.

name: Clara Hayes
text: Great environment. Beautiful views. Fast service. Good music.

name: Sherry Murray
text: After a long sunset walk to the AT&T park and back, he says he doesn't want to cook dinner and wants some tacos instead. I was not hungry at all, but since I have wanted to check out Pleasure Island Tiki Bar at Sportsman Marina in like... forever, we just kept walking towards it, laughing and talking our butts off because that's what we do.

name: Steve Hann
text: First time we went, not good and did not rate it. This time had Fish Tacos w/ fries. Very good, waitress good. If it stays this good next time I will raise the rating.

name: J.C. Study
text: Great views of the bay! Were waiting for our dolphin cruise, so grabbed a couple drinks and relaxed. Awesome looking place. Fast and friendly staff. I liked the Bushwhacker here, but NOT the best of our vacation. I liked the one at Cosmos the best.

name: Tom Traynor
text: The bartenders were great. This is one of the best local bars on the coast b

name: Craig Boggs
text: Great place will definitely return again

name: Jennifer key
text: Ughhhhh!!! Food is so delicious!  So fresh! I had fish tacos and a salad!  It was one of the best meals ive ever had! Delicious

name: Carlos Aguilera
text: Worst customer service I have ever experienced! Never coming back again. I highly recommend going somewhere else or you will waste your money and time here. You should try: flipper’s, anchor bar, the undertow.

text: Love this restaurant and bar. Food is amazing, so good went 2 nights in row!

name: Wanda Sicard
text: it was delicious lisa our server was wonderful food was best so far since we been here in Alabama

name: Flippy RC
text:
Stopped here for a late dinner after our Dolphin cruise (shout out to Cruise OB!) and we were not disappointed. The Tiki Burger was delicious! Their sample platter was huge!
Great drinks, great food, and a great view as well! Did I mention the prices though? Also great!
Go here, go here, go here!

name: Ron Quilhot
text: Favorite of hours excellent sandwiches and cold beer.   Pet friendly.   Outdoor seating.   Live music Thus-Sunday

name: Megan Paulowicz
text: The BEST place in Perdido to go to. Always great service and the BEST prices in Town!!!!

name: Kevin Perry
text: This is a fantastic little spot. The decorations are great, the staff is friendly and the views are excellent. An upper floor and lower floor levels are available with a lower bar area that includes swings for seats at the bar. Live music is a plenty and so are games.

name: Susan Dove

name: Robert Flick

name: Derek Dyer

name: Tim McCullar
text:
View was great.food just average. I would only get burgers and fries from now on.
Seafood was lacking.

name: Darryl Lewis
text: This is a great setting being under the huge Tiki Hut... Especially being on the marina.... Waitresses were super.... Menu good for a quick bite...I definitely would recommend to anyone.... Forgot, they do have entertainment...

name: Adam Pizani
text: Cool atmosphere. Visited during off season. Nice outdoor space. Didn't get to experience the lower bar and sandy area down below the actual building. Indoor music was provided. Giving 4 stars because they didn't have an actual tiki cocktail menu.

Cute little  bar tucked away behind boat storage.  Drinks were GREAT view was AWESOME
nice and relaxing atmosphere

name: allison pineda
text: Three stars because the food was good but waitress was terrible!

name: Jim Stewart
text:
Dogs have ruined a number of our experiences with outdoor restaurants in the Orange Beach area.  Here again, uncontrolled barking at the table next to us was the problem.  When asked if they could control the dog the solution to the owner of the dog, a local, was that we should stop visiting the area.  Something we will probably do regarding this restaurant.

At least this restaurant didn't allow dogs inside (as at Pirates Cove), only on the outdoor deck.  Still, who wants to sit inside at a tiki bar restaurant on a nice day.

name: Taj Zaman (Dowagiac1990)
text: Nice bar atmosphere on the water. The staff was very friendly and quick even though we arrived near a peak time. The pizza was good and thin.

name: andy cutting

name: Jason Smith

name: Michael G Heath

name: Tom Taylor
text: Fun.  Awesome view.  Good drinks.  Maybe a little pricey but definitely worth it!

name: Jimmy Johnson
text: Terrible experience. The waitress took our food order and one hour later we asked where our food was and she said she would check on it. When she came back to the table she told us that we were third down on the prep list and it would be probably another 15 or 20 minutes at that point we told her that we would not wait any longer and that we will be leaving. She came back to the table real quick and said our meal would be ready in 2 minutes. At this point she seems to have that attitude of she didn't care whether we got our food or not. we asked to speak to a manager. The manager came out and she made the excuse that she only had a 3 foot griddle and was trying to prepare all the food for everybody and just could not keep up. She gave me attitude that she didn't care either. So we told her we were leaving and she said okay.

name: Sherry Rolett-Boone
text: Great margarita! Super friendly staff!

name: Douglas Stewart
text: Hamburgers are very good. Need something other than fries. Some fried shrimp, flounder, crab cakes added. Whole family from to kids to adults can't wait for the next time.

name: Sharon Brown

text: I would like to start by saying that we have been going here for 3 yrs. it's normally a great place to go after being on Robinson Island all day but two weekends in a row it has been Horrible service we messed up and took 2 other families with us and bragged about how wonderful this place was and it took 2 1/2 hours to get our food.  Stopped by this past Sunday and our waitress was nonexistent.  Ordered drinks and they can out pretty quick and an hour after she brought the drinks she finally stopped by again  at 9:02 to then tell us the kitchen closed at 9:00 and we were unable to order food.  Not sure what's going on with the wait staff.  They must make an hourly wage instead of working for tips.  Not sure if we will be going back.

name: psmith7612
text: The bushwhackers are as good as any place in OB/GS and we've tried many! This place is really cool looking and clean. The waitress was very friendly and efficient. The best part of our visit was listening to a duo named Al & Cathy...they play late 60's and early 70's music like Jethro Tull (with the Flute!), Jefferson Airplane, Doobie Bros., CCR, Allman Bros., Marshall Tucker, etc. The crowd was an older one that night (later 40's to early 60's) probably because of Al & Cathy, but also because it's on the bay and not on the beach. That also meant that it wasn't so crowded.   Since we are in that age group and don't love tight crowded bars, WE LOVED IT! We were there in mid-March by the way.

text: This place is neat!  Nice place for the entire family.  Food and atmosphere was great!

We decided to leave and spend our money elsewhere. Too bad, it looked like the place had potential.

name: Ashley Barron
text:
First timers, we Went in for a quick lunch, service was great, food was tasty, we both had the appetizer sampler (yum) and the bread and butter was good. The server Kristi was busy but stayed on top of everything and the Manager was super sweet and confirmed that we were okay. Glad we stopped by. Will be back for free pie Wednesday.

Clean and covid procedures taken seriously from what I saw. Masked and distancing

resp.text: Wow! Wonderful news, Ashley. See you soon!

name: Esther Henning
text: Prime Rib was not on the menu, but a friend recommended it, so we had to ask. My hubby Ordered it Medium Rare and some parts were very tender, but others chewy. Still enjoyed the flavor. The best side was the Mac n Cheese. One of the best I've had. Didn't really care for the Whiskey Chicken dish, but will say the service here was spot on.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback, Esther.

name: k.l. bryant
text: We don't have an O'Charley's in my town anymore. So, imagine mines and my family excitement. The waitress gave excellent service, her attitude and attention was charismatic and detailed. Food was hot and delicious, especially the rolls. I'd admit it's the real reason we wanted to eat here. Really, we had no complaints. A great lunch experience to add to our beautiful Saturday shopping trip.

name: Jeff Perkins
text: We had a large group come in one hour before closing on a Monday night. The food was great. The service provided by Orion was exceptional. Thanks for helping our party of 16 have a great meal after a long day.

resp.text: Hi, Jeff. Thank you for sharing your experience with us!

name: Adam H
text: Waitress was very polite and friendly. Some of the best sweet tea I've had. Pictured are the fried cheese wedges and the New Orleans Cajun chicken pasta.

text: Awesome location. Great service. David is an Awesome Gentleman and and fine Manager. Mike at the Bar was outstanding as well. They make my every Visit a worth while and makes me come again and again. I love California Chicken Salad. Out of this world.

resp.text: Thanks, Salim! We love hearing comments like this!

text: Tim at the bar took my Togo order with the most absolute top notch customer service I have seen locally in a long time.  He was very knowledgeable of the menu and accommodating to the requests of the order.  Definitely will be back!  If you are looking for good eats and great service this is the place. Thank you for your hospitality, Tim.

resp.text: Wow! Wonderful news. See you soon!

text: Tim is Columbus is absolutely wonderful.   We met as Ref Hats for the first time since COVID and the loss of our Queen Mom. He made is more bearable and it couldn’t been better.  He is a keeper

text: My overall experience at this restaurant is a 6/5 stars. And it has everything to do with my waitress. Her name is Racheal. She was VERY nice and respectful. resp.text: Awesome news, Jasmine! Thank you!

text: Tim really knows how to deliver excellent service. He is always attentive and welcoming. He’s knowledgeable about the menu and ensures all my special requests are accommodated. The food is always delicious!  Thanks Tim. You have made me a repeat customer.

resp.text: Wow! Wonderful news, Joy. See you soon!

text: I got the chicken finger plate/platter. The chicken was sooo good.. my son tried the salmon. His first time. Was not impressed but loved the mac-n-cheese. I had salad and mashed sweet potatoes..yummy

name: LaShonda Brown
text: Today the O’ Charley’s app was not working for me so I called to place a curbside order. I was greeted promptly by Heather, who was taking to-go orders. I had so many questions because I could not see the online menu. Heather was very patient with me and she made suggestions that I really appreciated and did not mind the costs of the upgrades she recommended. She was very thorough. She made ordering a breeze! I will definitely continue ordering curbside!

resp.text: Hi, LaShonda. Great to hear! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Brittany Hunter
text: I'm currently here at the restaurant. Upon arriving the young lady at the door was nice and very cheerful but I quickly realized that is not the O'Charley's I remember loved. Our waitress is quiet and standoffish. I ordered mac and cheese for the kids, it was dry and the kids were not eating at all. I ordered a cajun pasta that only had Tony's sprinkled on top. My God daughter ordered a burger that was extremely  bland. I did ask for an exchange for the kids for Alfredo but honestly it wasn't any better. We're just getting our check and leaving.  This by far was a horrible experience and my live for O'Charley's has gone out of the window.  This meal was something that could have been made at home.  We will not be experiencing this anymore.

resp.text: Hello, Brittany! This is absolutely not our standard! We are so sorry you were disappointed.  We know you have choices when dining out, and we have to earn the opportunity to be your first choice!  With that in mind, we are committed to fixing this situation and making it right for you.   Please write to us at ocguestrelations@restgrowthservices.com with your phone number and the location you're speaking of. Again, we are sorry about your recent experience and hope to hear from you soon.

Our goal is always to exceed our guests' expectations, and clearly we didn't.   We can do better and committed to doing so.  If you would, please reach out to us at ocguestrelations@ocharleys.com with your phone number and the location you're speaking of and we will make this right.  Again, so sorry about your experience, we look forward to another chance to serve you.

name: Charlene “Hope” Sanchez
text: So I am in Columbus on assignment.  I went into this restaurant for a sit down meal before work. First of all let me say that my server was wonderful.  She was very attentive. The menu and food however were not so great. The menu is s little outdated and not really many choices. I ordered the chopped steak with mashed potatoes. The bread was a little tough. The chopped steak was burnt so that the meat was crunchy. I ate what I wanted an then ordered French silk pie. For a place that is proud of their pies, I expected a lot more. The pie tasted stale. name: Tyffany Davis
text:
Just the worst!! Had a hard day at work and wanted sit down and have a nice lunch with a friend. Our first choice was Cracker Barrel but the wait was an hour. So we went O'Charleys which is one of my favorite restaurants so I didn't mind at all.
It was chilly outside and it was super cold inside so we asked for hot teas and were informed that they were out of tea and coffee. Really?! Well, I never. So I had to go to my car and get my OWN HOT TEA to drink.
Then the signature rolls arrived. They we're not even the size of a playing card and just as flat and hard.
When my potato soup arrived it looked so good, I was excited to dig in. I dipped my spoon in and pulled it back up and not one piece of potato came up. I stirred my spoon around frantically and only found one piece in the entire bowl. Mind you, my friend had the same experience.
Once the entrees came out, the food did get a little better but by then I was so disappointed and I was so cold it was no way to make it better. I felt bad for the server because he was excellent but he kept apologizing for things that were out of his control. Almost at the end of the meal, the manager comes by and asks us about our meal. We ask her about the tea and bread and soup and she quickly excuses them away. And closes the conversation with free pie coupon.
Well alrighty then!!
I didn't need a coupon, one apology from her would have been worth twenty from the server. It needs to be understood that when customers voice concerns, they are not 1. Always complaining and 2. Always trying to get something free.
If you take the time to listen you may actually get better CUSTOMER CARE, SERVICE, AND SATISFACTION.

text: 10:45 Sunday morning. Poor experience from the moment we hit the parking lot. As we exited our car and walking in there was a beer can on the patio at the front door. We ordered a grilled salad, fried chicken salad, an appetizer, and a kids fried chicken fingers. After waiting 45 min at a less than crowded restaurant our food showed up. We opened our silverware and it was nasty. The fried chicken on my salad was luke warm at best and my wife’s grilled chicken was ice cold and they never brought an our appetizer. The waitress was a rookie at Best, she struggled to keep drinks filled, she didn’t add ice to our drinks which is terrible when your drinking ICED TEA. Poor experience and we won’t be going back

This is the second time I’ve order from O charley’s and still the same BS. The first time I didn’t even bother to call, but this time I’m leaving this review. I took them for granted and assumed everything would be there. I even left a tip even tho it was just an order and pick up, and all my food I paid for isn’t in the bag. I called back to express how far I traveled and why simple attention to detail isn’t practice there. It’s on my receipt but not in my bag. I told the person that I possibly won’t be able to pick up today. The person didn’t seem to care to even write my name down or give me instructions on whom to go to when ever i come back.
It’s an inconvenience (money, gas, etc) to travel back after reaching your destination for sides.

text: I went for the 1st time although I had a great energetic server who made a drastic mistake that could of ended badly with my 16yr restuarant experience I simply gave her info and it appeared she was shaken once realizing severity had it been wrong person. I wanted her to relax encouraging her letting her know not her fault she needs appropriate training to help build her confidence , drinks came out fine, appetizer,  then my meal I was highly disappointed my medium steak was on wrong plate, of course his medium steak was well done an lord you could see the grain of steak it was so dry. My medium steak on his plate was beautifully cooked although more medium well it was still flavorful. My Salmon was biggest disappointment it was also over cooked dry no flavor , macaroni obviously had been microwaved it was not consistent texture nor entirely warm. Ms. Britni did everything in her power to resolve any issue I felt I had I was very pleased with my service and although disappointed with my food i think it bothered me more staff needs training, cooks need to relearn cook times on the meat's nobody likes to pay 18 plus dollars on a meal they wouldn't brag on or suggest to anyone. Nice environment great potential made me want to put in an application and show them how it's done, but I simply just left a tip for Ms Britni for her energetic effort and truly may Go back for that application or to try food again one day. Be blessed

text: I placed a to go order tonight for a family dinner this is the second time the first time was wonderful this time I decided to get the honey drizzle chicken and two family size well I added an extra side I have all of my chicken however my sides  it looks like they scooped four spoonfuls into a big pan It doesn’t even look like a family size. name: Billy Adams
text: January 31, 2020.... Me, my wife and kids sat for exactly an hour before calling a manager over. I told him that we had been sitting for an hour and our food had not arrived. He went back to check on it and said it was coming right out. When it came out it, it was obvious that it had been sitting a while- my top hamburger bun was so hard I couldn’t eat it, my daughter’s fried shrimp was hard and her Mac & cheese had skinned over, the cheese on my son’s hamburger looked like plastic... the manager was very apologetic and kept saying that he would “do something for us”. However, after the food came out we never saw him again. I asked for the check, paid the bill, and am chalking this up. I’ve wasted $50 in the past, and will probably waste $50 in the future... but never will I waste a dime at O’Charleys again.

resp.text: Hi, Billy.  My name is Chad Coghlan.  I'm so sorry about the issues with the disappointing food and service. Please allow us to follow up with you about this. name: Shenita Carter
text: I give 3 stars to this restaurant! I LITERALLY come here daily for lunch and I must say that last Wednesday, my order was not fixed to my liking, but more than anything, I noticed management will not speak to customers... O yea, twice I have walked up to the to-go entrance(after 11am), and the doors are locked...smh...one time a manager did open the door, but she never apologized for the discrepancy and her excuse was that her to-go person hadn't made it in yet...lol. Big shout out to Justin and Carlos though for ALWAYS preparing my meal accordingly. But again, Management(Aside from Dennis) needs to be trained on speaking to and acknowledging customers, especially loyal customers like myself. O by the way, a manager told me last week(after I told her that my order was not fixed correctly) that the worker named Justin(whom always get my order right), that he is off on Wednesdays in case I don't want to come on those days... Like who tells a customer this...smh...

resp.text: Hi, shenita. Thank you for sharing your experience with us!  I will personally look into this.

name: Warrior Outreach
text:
I’ve been coming to O’Charleys for four plus years... The reason I come is two-fold service first and foremost is outstanding.  Second they support local charities in the Community everyday... Especially our Veterans.

The Manager Michele Daniels and the server Shana have always been very courteous and helpful...

They give to Warrior Outreach Annually please help there local business to continue to get back to we’re they were before COVID

🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏

#Givingbackmatters

text: If you get the impression that this is an authentic Irish restaurant, please know that it is not. The bartender was very nice but also very inexperienced. He didn't know what s Grand Marnier floater on a margarita was and the mix was also not good. The manager also had to show him how to make the drink. I ordered a pot pie which on the menu included broccoli but didn't get the broccoli. I have had MUCH better pot pies at Boston Market which is fast food. The salad was ok, not great. The bartender again was nice but didn't know how to run a bar or check in and offer refills. I don't see myself returning nor would I recommend to a family member or friend.

Friendly and courteous service. Great food.
We had a party of 3. One ordered steak & chicken.  2nd one had steak & ribs. They were from out of town . I ordered the salmon on a plank. All 3 were delicious. We had an appetizer of chips & cheese. After we all had a different pie. I think it was strawberry lemonade pie. Gooey caramel,  and the other one was a lot of chocolate,  I  can't remember the name .
It all was very delicious. Definitely recommend.!!@

name: Xavier McCaskey
text: Michael is a great host

resp.text: Thanks, Xavier! We love hearing comments like this!

name: B Hudson
text: I just had the best experience ever. Big baby and Amber are hands down the best restaurant customer service I’ve ever had. I am so glad we chose to come here for dinner. If I could give more stars I would. I definitely will be back. Kudos to the team!!!

name: Hailey Jane
text: Food was way to salty, ur waiter seemed very high and all over the place, she got the order wrong twice, we had to ask for refills, waited 20 mins just for the bread, the salmon was under cooked, steaks where over cooked!

resp.text: Hi, Hailey.  We’re so sorry about the disappointing service and food. We'd like to follow up with you about this. If you could email us at ocguestrelations@ocharleys.com with your phone number and the location you're speaking of, we'd really appreciate it.

The cedar plank lemon pepper salmon was out standing. Very clean and give a military discount. Thanks very much for supporting our military personnel!

The food was very delicious !
The service was just as we like it, attentive yet not intrusive.
But, beware if you have allergies. Be adamant about requesting what is in the dish you order.

text: They got my order wrong, but once they brought the correct order, it was delicious. The waitress was very friendly, as well as the manager. They even comped us not one, but two desserts to go for the mistake!

name: Stephanie pinto
text: O'Charleys is consistent good food. Every time I go, I look through the entire menu and end up ordering the same thing. Every time. The pecan crusted chicken tender salad just can't be beat! My "husband", as the greeter referred to him (I can dream), had the Nashville hot chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries and it looked yummy...he loved it. Free pie Wednesday is always nice too!

name: JOANNE HUTTO
text: Excellent service. As always. Great customer service and the food is always great.

resp.text: Hi, JOANNE. Great to hear! We hope to see you again soon!

name: Lisa Summerlin

resp.text: Thank you, Lisa!

name: Samantha Radcliff
text: Picked up a to-go order that I placed online. The woman working the bar was informed that a customer was at the bar to pick up a to-go order (there was no one working to-go). She was at a table having a conversation and looked at me several times before making her way over after several minutes. My food was ready 20 minutes after it was supposed to be, even thought the restaurant was very slow. I wasn’t given to-go silverware, rolls, and was missing sauce that comes with the entree I ordered. I should’ve checked the order before leaving but was anxious to leave with my toddler. My daughter’s Mac n cheese tasted old and just off, and couldn’t be eaten. My husband’s burger was underdone. I do not recommend this o’charley’s location, especially for to-go orders.

name: tamiko holt
text: The curbside attendant was nice but the Prime Rib Pasta was not the same as it was when it was featured on the menu before. Very disappointing.

I highly recommend this restaurant for family outings, romantic dates, treating yourself to lunch etc. The meals are really affordable even for steak.

Don't offer free bread if you can provide it.

The food was great and came out pretty quick shortly after we placed our order. Definitely would recommend this establishment to others. Great job!

name: Spencer Harrell
text:
Went with my wife on a recommendation from a friend. Food was borderline inedible. I ordered a bowl of potato soup, which more closely resembled a bowl of mayonnaise in its consistency and was so salty it was impossible to eat. Natalie, the waitress, apologized and offered to bring out another soup. She brought their tomato basil, which was nothing more than marinara sauce with parmesan cheese on the top. My wifes salmon was decent, but the mashed potatoes also salted beyond belief.
The only saving grace was the waitress, Natalie, who did everything she could to make up for just bad, bad food. We will not return.

name: Tasha A
text: The manager was great. She walked around greeting everyone. Saw her several times. Better than the manager we have back in North Charleston

text: We eat here pretty regularly, once a month or so. I love the food and the prices. Normally service is good too. Big Baby is awesome. Great family place but they keep it cold so bring in your jacket lol

resp.text: Hello ben! This is absolutely not our standard! We are so sorry you were disappointed.  We know you have choices when dining out, and we have to earn the opportunity to be your first choice!  With that in mind, we are committed to fixing this situation and making it right for you.   Please write to us at ocguestrelations@abrholdings.com and include your email, your phone number, and the location you dined. Again, we are sorry about your recent experience and hope to hear from you soon.

text: Service was ok, food was just ok, not really what I'd call good or bad, just ok.

text: It was ok

resp.text: Hello, Crystal! Thank you for your review. We would love to know what we could have done to make this a 5-star experience. We’re listening! Please write to us at ocguestrelations@ocharleys.com with your phone number and include the location at which you dined.

name: Cynthia Wolters
text: Awesome service and wonderful food. Great place for a date or group setting. Prices are very reasonable. Would recommend!!

name: William Money
text: Beyond disappointing.  Take out process needs to be re-engineered.  Delays and mistakes each time I get  take out.  Food could be good, but delays in process leaves the food tepid.  Mistakes include medium cooked orders served with raw meat in the middle.  Fully loaded baked potato order sent out with bare baked potatoes, not even butter.  I want the place to be better than it is due to its convenient location. But I break down and try to give it another chance after a while away, only to subject myself to entrenched mediocrity.  I have even called management to give feedback on their take out process.  They are satisfied with their design, but did offer me free pie,  Do I dare go back?

name: Amanda Mathis
text: We ordered food for a family of 5.  I paid Grub Hub $20 with tip to deliver.  The total bill was right at $100.  We had the new Lion King playing, and we were excited to finally have a family night.  Well, O'Charley's left out one of my kid's meals.  He had the triple dipper sampler platter, and that's his favorite.  Instead of me spending family time, I had to make my kid more food, contact Grub Hub and O'Charley's.  The waitress admitted that she made the error.  Mistakes happen, but the manager tried to blame it on Grub Hub.  I explained what she said, and he offered to make the sampler plate, but I would have to pick it up.  It's well after 8 by then.  They have school and bedtime.  I already made my kid something else to eat, also.  Not to mention, the $20 that I paid for delivery and tip.  I obviously didn't want to drive there, so the manager took the $13 charge off for the one missing plate.  The ribeye meal and my shrimp pasta that the adults ordered didnt get eaten for hours, so it was not good either.  The experience disrupted our family time, and that is a big deal.  I just thought that the meal should have at least be remade for another night, so that we could actually enjoy our dinner and a movie together.

name: David MaLave
text: I love this place. The staff is so friendly and make you feel right at home. Additionally, the food is delicious.

name: brian floyd
text: Service is very slow

resp.text: Hi, Brian.  I'm so sorry about the slow service. We'd like to follow up with you about this. If you could email us at ocguestrelations@ocharleys.com with your phone number and the location you're speaking of, we'd really appreciate it.

name: Pepper Lynch
text: Went in yesterday evening, wait wasn’t long.  Waitress was nice.  My problem is with the loaded potato soup.  Needless to say I’ve been eating this since they put green onions on top, but yesterday I was not happy with the soup at all.  It looked like a condensed cheddar soup from a can, not the creamy cheese soup I have fell in love with.

name: emderslave the YouTuber
text: I stopped here for a bite and had Rebecca. She didn't refill our drinks, heard her talking bad about people. Food came out cold and I saw her playing on her phone instead of being attentive. Sitting against a wall on your phone isn't good service. I won't be back

name: Cyndi Braski
text: Great service.  The server and manager on duty was very kind and friendly.  The prime rib was delicious and the blue cheese wedge salad was perfect.

text: It was classic O'Charley's but the iced tea machine was broke when we went. The rolls were also small and dense because they hadn't risen properly. Other than that our soup was good and our server was nice and pleasant.

resp.text: Hi, Brinlee. Great to hear! We hope to see you again soon!

resp.text: Thanks, Brandy!

name: Laura Ellis
text: I enjoyed my fried pickles, and surprisingly my salmon was cooked very well. I've found that at other chain restaurants, the fish is usually overcooked. But this is not the case this time. The mashed potatoes are also fabulous. My friend got the garlic shrimp linguine, and he really liked it. He just said there weren't enough shrimp. the only thing we wondered about is it seemed like we were seated on the other side the restaurant, away from everyone else. Felt a little like we were being sent to the time-out corner.

name: Maria Evans
text: Wonderful service and great food! The planned salmon is phenomenal. I gave it 4 stars due to the sometimes long wait to be seated.

Awesome restaurant!

The restaurant was very clean

Please come with $50 or better if you are getting steak and dining with 3 or more...

I ordered the suggested strawberry lemonade and the low country shrimp. The lemonade was undrinkable, overly sweet and thick. The low country shrimp looked like a mess on the plate, very unappealing. No flavor and disappointing. Don't think we will return.

The servers have such great personality and the dinner roles they serve you with your meal are amazing and they just keep them coming. Its just a great comforting and friendly feel i get from O'charleys i would recommend it to anyone and everyone to go and try them out you won't be disappointed.

Thanks to our waitress for making it better but the food was just so bad.

It was horrible our waitress forgot to turn our order in then when we got our food the steaks had so much fat you couldn't eat it.
We finally had to ask for a manager cause our waitress never came back.
The manager took 1 steak off so that was something.
We will never go back!!
