Never saw her again 🤔  Our waitress did an outstanding job with our large group!

text: Two bad experiences in the course of 8 days. I will give anyone a second chance if I have had a pleasant experience with them in the past.  But a third chance, forget it.  On our most recent trip, it took 45 minutes to get one order that was cold and another that was just plain wrong all around.    Apologies on top of apologies. Doesnt change the fact you have a serious problem in your restaurant and I wont be back.

resp.text: Oh no! William, thank you for taking the time to let us know about your visit to O’Charley’s. Our goal is always to exceed our guests’ expectations, and clearly we didn’t.   We can do better and committed to doing so.  If you would, please reach out to us at ocguestrelations@ocharleys.com with your email, phone number and location you dined and we will make this right.  Again, so sorry about your experience, we look forward to another chance to serve you.

name: Tobi Steen
text: Moved from Columbus a few years ago and went to visit yesterday. During the visit, I visited O’Charley’s and had a wonderful visit. The visit started with a hostess smiling from ear to ear and eager to get us comfortably sat. As soon as we sat down our waitress, Barbara, greeted us offering a selection of beverages from the bar. I ordered a few Cotton Candy Fizz’s and cheese wedges from them menu. The cheese wedges came out hot and fresh with cheese oozing from every bite. After reviewing the menu, I noticed the new prime rib pasta and decided to try it. When delivered, it was as creamy, hot, and fresh as I  expected! After the meal, my server came and offered some fresh pie, although I was so full off the meal and hot rolls that I declined! The best part about dinner was the manager, Michelle, came to touch the table and personalized the visit. She knew me by name and conversed with me as if we were best friends! KUDOS TO O’CHARLEY’S FOR ESTABLISHING A SAFE PLACE WITH GREAT SERVICE TO HAVE A MEAL!

name: Joshua Browning
text:
READ BEFORE EATING! Hey, if your thinking about eating here tonight STOP! I eat at O'charleys once a year to remind myself why I don't eat at O'charleys and our last experience will be our last.

This is my first review ever and I felt that I could not go on without letting other people know how bad O'charleys is. I have no complaints about the service, our waitress was nice. The food however is a pile of greasy pig slop and should not be consumed by humans.

I hadn't ordered a steak in awhile at a restauraunt so I said let's do it. The steak I ordered was supposed to be  medium rare and it came out half medium half rare, so I guess I got medium rare hahaha. It was like chewing on leather each bite and was absolutely horrible. The appetizer was greasy potato slices with some decent tasting cheese dip. The sides were disgustingly mushy and sour tasting broccoli. Mashed taters were ok and dessert was a frozen pie that was bland. My wife ordered chicken fingers that were not so great and she thinks made her feel nauseous. Overall $50 and bad!!!

text: It was good. They should probably lock some of there many side doors so you don't have to feel big breezes everytime someone opens one. And it took awhile to get our bill. But the BLT and Cobb Salad was delicious.

name: Kyle Gott
text: Originally we weren’t going to go here but the place we wanted to go to was closed. I’m glad though. The food here was fantastic! The soda was crisp and refreshing. I got shrimp and grits for the very first time (the waiter recommended it as his favorite) I was not disappointed. The flavor was incredible. Perfect amount of seasoning and Cajun flavor. Shrimp was perfect and the peppers served with it were delicious too. If you’ve never had shrimp and grits. This is the place to try it. We will definitely be back. My wife got a onion rings with her meal. They are battered and were very good. The horseradish sauce they come with is really good too. The right amount of flavor and kick pairs well with the savory onion rings.

resp.text: Thank you! We really appreciate your generosity. It's always nice to know that we are moving in the right direction.

The chef is also the general manager and frequently walks around to make sure you leave happy. I can’t say enough good things about this place - portions are also great.

Also....try the Bloody Mary bar.

text: I've been here a few times before. Always friendly. Tonight while waiting for a seat to open up at the bar a funny witty server had me in stitches while waited. Then when the bar seat opened I quickly grabbed it up. The craft beer selection is legit. The bartender was great. I watched as he carefully crafted every drink. Once I ordered I never had to ask for a refill because he was Johnny on the spot. Best bartender I've ever had.

text: I had the best time. The server was awesome and attentive. The small hidden area ways awesome.

text: Edit 2021: finally got a perfect burger here! There are lots of reviews about overcooked burgers, and I think they've started to notice. My husband ordered a rare double cheeseburger and it was perfect. The server said it depends on who's cooking, but ask and they will provide.

name: Candice Musgrove
text: Service was slow even though it was dead so that was disappointing. I loved my food but my husband didn’t enjoy his. The bangers and mash were unusual because the potatoes were super tangy (probably made with buttermilk). Their menu is trying really hard to be unique and different which I enjoyed but it doesn’t always hit the mark for everyone’s palette.

resp.text: Thank you for your business! We appreciate your feedback, and hope to see you soon.

text: Below The Radar is very delicious, all of the staff is very attentive and friendly. The brunch is to also very delicious, I recommend the “Cheesy  Hash-Brown Casserole” you can’t go wrong!

text: We had flights, a chai latte, and cheesecake. The lemon cheesecake was among the best I've ever tasted. The beers were solid. I like the Minter but everyone else thought it was too sweet.

text: Looking for a dive bar atmosphere with upscale flare? Head over to Below the Radar. We went there in search of late night food and we found that they offer soooo much more. Definitely make the trip downtown and enjoy. Oh and they serve beer too.

name: Madeline Thompson
text: I am absolutely NEVER coming here again. I have never had such a TERRIBLE experience at a restaurant. Right when we sat down our server was exceptionally rude and kept yelling at us for no reason. She then was rude when taking our orders and was never attentive. She made us want to leave immediately. Then the food was cold, drinks were always empty, and our server constantly ridiculed us. Then at the end she added a 20% tip herself because apparently it is at the “server’s discretion.” I am never coming to Below The Radar again and I will make sure everyone I know doesn’t come to eat at this place either because it was the absolutely worse experience in my life.

name: Donnie Pearson
text: This place is great. Plenty of choices. Good food, good service, and Good beer.

name: Kevin H
text: First time here...enjoyed it! One thing that I always look for when I go to an establishment,  is welcoming the staff is....they passed with flying colors! I only had one bartender, but I probably interacted with like 5 of the members.  Food was good as well. Pictured is the smokehouse burger. I would definitely check this place out the next time I'm in town!

name: Denise Marsh
text: The Dixie burger was absolutely amazing!! It had a fried green tomato on it. Weird, but it worked. GREAT too, I might add. We had cheese bites for an appetizer. The best we have ever had.  The staff was terrific. That was our first visit and most definitely not the last.

name: Green Bean
text: This place is absolutely amazing. Hands down the best pub type food we have had since we have moved back to North Alabama. The chicken wings and the cheesy ball appetizers were incredible. We also had the shrimp and grits and the fish-and-chips. Everything that we had was delicious. It has a nice atmosphere and decent service. For the few dollars more this place costs it's very worth it.

resp.text: Thank you for your business! We're glad we exceeded your expectations.

name: Zachery Lions
text: I've been here a few times before. Always friendly. Tonight while waiting for a seat to open up at the bar a funny witty server had me in stitches while waited. Then when the bar seat opened I quickly grabbed it up. The craft beer selection is legit. The bartender was great. I watched as he carefully crafted every drink. Once I ordered I never had to ask for a refill because he was Johnny on the spot. Best bartender I've ever had.

name: John Lay
text:
"12oz Cajun Ribeye Disaster"
It honestly pains me to leave this review because  I've historically loved eating here; however, this was my first visit back in about three years due to a move. Ordered the Cajun Ribeye dinner anticipating it to be the same exceptional quality it's historically been and it was pathetic. The ribeye was tough and a poor quality cut, it was drowning in the sauce, and the two sides were unusually bland tasting. I had to spoon the watery cajun sauce on the sides to give them a little more zest. Had I not skipped lunch that day in giddy anticipation of eating here, I would've left. I was blown away by the overwhelming sadness of this $34 entree, especially when some generic steakhouses serve better quality cuts for less money. What happened to this place? I used to brag to people about how awesome the food is here and would recommend it in a heartbeat; however, I hesitate to suggest it now... I really hope they get it together and bring the quality of this dish back to its former glory!

name: JDub
text: I was told when I called that the menus available online are all wrong. Update your online menus so when people call you don't have read all the options over the phone. Then please do not put someone on hold indefinitely. Take a picture of your menus and upload: super easy.

text: Went for Father's Day Brunch, and it was excellent! I did order off of the lunch menu and had a BLT... delicious! Laid back friendly service! Busy but kitchen seemed to keep up!

Mushroom, onions and black bean omlette was super-sized, and full of goodness.
Please like this post

name: Helen West
text: One of the absolute best restaurants I've had the pleasure of experiencing here in Huntsville.  Nothing short of the best when it came to food and service.

text: The have good food and good beer selection. They had music trivia in Friday night that was really fun. I would recommend this place for sure.

text: Our server was extremely rude to us. Not attentive at all, and was super annoyed anytime we asked for something. The really frustrating thing is that the server ADDED A 20% TIP TO EACH OF OUR CHECKS. There were only 5 of us, so I don’t understand why that was added. Anyway, lame atmosphere, mediocre food, and terrible service. There’s much better breweries in Huntsville to go to.

I had lamb here once that was ok, but otherwise I've been severely underwhelmed by the flavor profiles and options. Beers ok though 👍Alabama doesn't HAVE to be mediocre. Step it up.

text: Nice place. Good experience, chill atmosphere. If there is every a reuben on the menu, I get the reuben. I loved the way the meat was cut into small pieces. It was very tender. It was good, but not the best one I've ever had. I wish the sauerkraut had more of a punch to it the sauce a little more flavorful. I am not typically one to get onion rings, but these were soo good! Also, I judge restaurants on how good the Coca-Cola is and it was good here!

resp.text: We are truly sorry, hope you come back and give us another chance.

According to the manager it’s up to the server’s discretion whether to add gratuity or not. I find this to be very unprofessional. I am never going back here again.

text: Service was slow even though it was dead so that was disappointing. I loved my food but my husband didn’t enjoy his. Their menu is trying really hard to be unique and different which I enjoyed but it doesn’t always hit the mark for everyone’s palette.

She is very personable and answered any questions we had about the area. Good beer selection and a very comfortable environment. We always come back.

name: Rudy Banes
text:
The menu said to ask the server for details on filling growlers which was great, because we were from out of town, brought growlers to fill and had no other option on new years day. The servers "details" were "um... yeah... well... we don't really do that anymore, and I don't know why they still have that on the menu. Everyone asks about it." Really, dude? Everyone keeps asking about the thing your menu says to ask about? What a world, huh. I wonder if they only do growlers on some of the beers and this kid didn't feel like bothering. Oh well.
Edit: Was since told by whoever responds to their fb messages that they DO still fill growlers, so I'm changing it from 3 stars to 1.

resp.text: Thanks for leaving us a review, Rudy. We will do our best to use this to improve.

text: It was super busy when we went and took a while to get our food but it was worth the wait. All of our meals came out perfectly. Surprisingly good. I don’t drink so I can’t comment on their beer but they had a large selection.

text: Always terrific. Recommend the omelets or cinnamon bun for brunch and the Ruben for lunch/dinner

name: Summer Crook
text: Normally we've had pretty experiences here, but the last visit wasn't as good. There was a hair in my food (salad) that I found about halfway through eating it. It definitely wasn't mine, as it was short and thick (my husband said it looked like a beard hair 😬). I did not eat the remaining half of my salad and we told the server and she didn't say anything about it. Then, we didn't see the server for quite a while and we needed our check because we had somewhere to be...we finally got the check, with no discount or apology for the hair...really nothing. Oh well, it was one bad experience in a few good ones. We may try again...we'll see.

resp.text: Your feedback is important to us and so is your satisfaction. We take your feedback seriously and hope you'll give us another chance to serve you.

name: Kiran Antony
text:
The food was great, I got the trout and my friend had a burger (can't remember which one). The burger was a little charred but seem like he enjoyed it.. but if it were me, I wouldn't have been able to eat. However the trout was great - it seemed like not much, but oh boy it was filling...
We got some extra hot wings as well, and it was average.

The beer all around was good. And service was Great if not exceptional :-).

All around a good place to chill with friends or with ur loved one.. :)

resp.text: Thanks! We appreciate the review and hope to see you soon!

name: Daniel Ray
text: Good place. Members of our party were less than enthused by the beer, but the food is top notch.

resp.text: Thanks for the review and the feedback, Daniel. We're sorry you had a less than stellar experience, and we hope you'll give us another chance to make it right.

name: Kent Manley
text: Nice beer menu, with a couple ciders, one on tap. Almost zero options for vegans and vegetarians. There was a salad I had them hold the bacon and parmesan, and add the roasted pumpkin seeds. Indoor and outdoor seating, including a second small party room which could accommodate 18-24 people.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Manny Rivera
text:
Arrived with a party of 4 with no reservations, after a deep sigh from the hostess she proceeded to walk away  without saying a word and placed menus and silverware at table and said “enjoy” with a bland face and went back to whatever she was doing at her hostess station.

When our server arrived he wasn’t rude, but very lethargic. Either he had no interest of being there or he was inebriated because his eyes were low and so was his standard of service.

6 wings, fish and chips, 1 chicken burrito and 1 rice burrito (chicken burrito with no chicken, vegetarian) were ordered as well as an appetizer of Mac and cheese bites. After an hour and 20 minute wait, the Mac and cheese bites arrived. 10 minutes later 3 of the four dishes arrived.  The wings were luke warm and they forget the blue cheese. Fish was burnt and the ‘chips’ were soggy. Waiting another 10 minutes for the other burrito to arrive, we asked our waiter and he just so happened to forgot to tell us that the other burrito was dropped and  that the kitchen was making another. We cancelled the order, simply because we couldn’t wait any longer. After we told the waiter we couldn’t wait for the other dish he simply disappeared for the evening. We then asked for the manger, paid our bill and left.

We understood that they were busy, but when the larger party ( that was seated AFTER us) at the table next to us was getting their steaks and alcoholic beverages at faster rate and simply receiving better service, we realized that were second rate patrons at this establishment. I chose to dine here and was slightly embarrassed that my family had to go through this.

Never again.

name: Hal McCord
text: Great beer selection. Great service

name: Carmela Clemons
text: The service was great. The wait took about 40 minutes for our food to come out. I ordered the Portobello mushroom burger with fries and I really loved it. The atmosphere was pretty moderate. I would come back during lunch and/or dinner hour.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your great review! Please give us the opportunity to serve you again soon!

name: Alan Cheng
text: Wasn't bad, but didn't blow me away with their lunch menu.  Had a VERY large beer and alcohol selection though, so if you enjoy that, you'll like it.  Food was run of the mill...

resp.text: Your feedback is important to us and so is your satisfaction. We take your feedback seriously and hope you'll give us another chance to serve you.

name: Jamie DeSpain
text: My family and I ate her for Mother's Day brunch a couple of weeks ago and we couldn't have been more pleased with our selection of restaurant. The service was exceptionally quick (thanks to Melissa H!), the food was outstanding and the atmosphere was great. I'm looking forward to going to Below the Radar again on a Friday or Saturday night to enjoy their huge beer selection. If you're looking for an affordable, comfortable atmosphere to have a beer and a bite with your friends then go local and choose Below the Radar in downtown Huntsville.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your great review! Please give us the opportunity to serve you again soon!

name: Henry McElreath
text: A great restaurant and an even better bar. I enjoy the Sunday brunch very much, but the whole menu is good.  The waitstaff is kind and courteous, and it does not take very long for the kitchen to get your meal ready. I love the onion rings there and the Caesar salad.

name: Jody Stovall
text: Looked to be a pretty cool spot. Was near the concert venue we were headed to do we went. Hostess was super nice and friendly. Our waitress was not as friendly but she got everything we ordered. He filled up fast that night and they appeared to be a little under staffed for the crowd. I can't remember what we ate so I guess it wasn't memorable.  I remember the fried cheese something appetizer though it was good. Lots of beer selections! Full bar.

name: Tim Lowe
text: Good Food & Good Service = Great Place for Lunch.

resp.text: Happy to hear it! See you soon.

text: Always a great place to visit. Fantastic food, fantastic service.

resp.text: Thank you! We really appreciate your generosity. It's always nice to know that we are moving in the right direction.

text: There was no close parking, the food was mediocre, their beer was not top notch, and they were out of the first 3 "good" beers I ordered. I haven't been back in 3 years, I need to give them a second chance.

resp.text: Hi Michael - We're sorry you didn't have a great experience but appreciate you taking time to leave us a review. We'd like a chance to make things right!

text:
When I first walked in, the atmosphere was very divey but clean and methodical.  The bartender was quick to greet me and take our order.

They have a great selection of beer, local, and some brewed in house.  They also have a full liquor bar and food menu.

My wife and I only had appetizers (Mac n Cheese Bites) but they were cooked well and tasted excellent.

Overall I consider this an excellent bar worth visiting.

text: My food was very good, and my husbands was alright. However, the service was absolutely terrible. Our waiter had a bad attitude and was very rude. We will probably not be returning because of this.

resp.text: Carly - Thank you for taking the time to leave a rating. Please contact us to tell us how we can improve upon our service.

text: Good food, friendly bartenders, and a nice selection of craft beer. Great location to include on your HSV pub crawl!

I'm normally a dark beer drinker but have a soft spot in my heart for sours so I got the bartender to set me up with a flight of sours. I've never been anywhere else that had so many sours on tap. Its great that the staff is really knowledgeable about each beer.

Super tasty entrées (my group got the trout, steak, and fish and chips), fantastic selection of beer (keep the boss lady on the menu please!), and wonderful waitstaff. We will definitely be returning!

text: Past couple of experiences here have been great (after it seemed they were going downhill the previous few visits). Lunch Bangers and Mash entree was fantastic. Got the filet for dinner last week and it was phenomenal -- perfectly seasoned and cooked. Highly recommended.

text: BtR sits heavily in our rotation of spots in downtown HSV. Service is always spot on! Bloody Mary bar on the weekends is fantastic! The Humble Heart Bites...yes, please! The reuben is always stocked full and a very hearty sandwich, one of the best reuben's in town!

resp.text: Thanks Christopher, we hope to serve you again soon!

name: Marvin Millar
text: Always a great place to visit with great food, great beers, and an awesome staff.  Very accommodating.  I've been there for personal and work functions and they've all been wonderful.

name: Johnnie Thomas
text:
When this place is on it, it's one of our favorite in the Huntsville area. Unfortunately, like others have said, the service sometimes can be downright neglectful.
We have been about six time now and two of the experiences were amazing, both in terms of food and service.  Two were mixed, one with food being great/service being slow, one with great service/overly greasy and over cooked food... the other two? Slow/forgetful/neglectful service with food that was missing the usual seasonings, condiments, or sides.
Seriously,  I want to LOVE this place.  I did the first time I went, and, despite the wait to be seated and the huge crowd that night, food and service were outstanding.  Slower days seem to be a big miss, for some reason, and things are just off the majority of the times we have gone back since.
I DO RECOMMEND GIVING IT A TRY, and hopefully you will have an experience like my first.  It has quickly fallen out of our list of "usual" spots due to inconsistencies in both food and service.

text: NEVER AGAIN!! Took 2 hours to for dinner. 30 minutes just to order. Almost an hour to get food. Food quality was bad. Ordered a rare burger and it came so done that there was no taste left. Not enough servers. Not enough cooks on duty. I have never had a good experience here. I'm sick of giving my money to a place that doesn't give a damn about me.  I'll take my time and money elsewhere.

text: How have we not been going here more? The food is amazing. I had the fish and chips. By the way,  I hate tartar sauce but theirs was pretty good. Fish was cooked perfectly. name: kyle brown
text:
I come here occasionally for breakfast or brunch. They do a wonderful special where you can get $1 mimosas with a purchase of food. I highly recommend the biscuits and gravy. The biscuits are always fluffy and the gravy is the perfect consistency and portion size for biscuits.

The only quarrel I have is that eggs aren't considered a side item for breakfast meals so you have to pay an upcharge for them. Not so bad but mildly inconvenient.

Seating can be tough to find so come early if you can.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We really appreciate it!

name: Linda Satterwhite
text: If I had written this review yesterday, my emotional state would not let me write this in a professional manner. On a bus tour of Huntsville, a recommendation from one of our members was to stop here. She had visited the restaurant before and gave it raving reviews. Our party was 11 although we did not have a reservation, we were seated. Once you made the arrangements and seated us we should have been treated as any paying guests in the establishment! We received our food over a hour after ordering. I asked if I could have warmer fries the young waitress attempted to accommodate us, however, Tabitha (I believe was her name) came over to see what the problem was. When trying to explain that our orders were cold, she basically tells us, it’s OUR fault! We didn’t have a reservation! The problem I have with that statement...Why not tell us that at the door when we initially came in? We would have understood that. But to tell me and our guests it was our fault because our food was cold was not what I was expecting! She went on to turn our tour on Huntsville into a nightmare!   I have never been so disappointed and disrespected! Our friend who recommended this place was equally embarrassed because we had visitors from out of town in the group! I will never visit here again!!! Cold food and disrespectful service!

name: carol gresham
text: The bartender Mary was awesome, delicious drinks!

resp.text: Thank you! We really appreciate your generosity. It's always nice to know that we are moving in the right direction.

name: Jarod Odum
text: Great fish and chips,  awesome beer!

resp.text: Thanks so much! We can't wait to help you again.

name: G Pierce
text: Relaxed atmosphere. Drinks were good. Had a big choice of beers. Many food options. Their ribeye and lamb chops we're delicious.

name: Carrie Grice
text: This is the kind of place that I would try to eat at once a week to be a regular. The atmosphere is fun but relaxing and the food is great. With so many rotating taps, it would be a challenge to try everything.

resp.text: Thank you so much for allowing us to serve you, Carrie Grice. Till next time!

name: Jillian Shackelford
text: We sat out from on the patio for lunch on a Saturday afternoon—I had a pint of their Space Parts Bud (NE IPA) and was very pleased. The fish and chips left a lot to be desired.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave this review!

name: Rachel Miller
text: Food was good but not good enough to make up for the lack of service. I found this place while working out of town via Google... reviews said "great service". I was seriously disappointed with our waitress. She was on her phone a lot and took about 20 minutes just to tell us 2 separate times that the drinks we ordered were out of stock. Not impressed.

name: Aaron Briggs
text: I had a couple of good beers there. The Dixie burger was very tasty too. Solid place, friendly service.

name: Lacy Berry
text: Their service has improved tenfold over my last experience. Glad I gave it another try! I've always loved their food, so no complaints there either.

name: Amanda Stoltz
text: The food was so good!!!

name: Kevin Syler
text: Good food, great service and nice downtown atmosphere.

name: Bart Roegner
text: My hard to please Mother in Law gives a thumbs up to the bangers and mash. My wife thoroughly enjoyed her Burger. I loved my fish and chips. Beer was great too. Service was prompt and friendly. After a string of Huntsville disappointments, Below The Radar rocked it both times we've been here. We will be back!

name: Eric Muller
text: Good bar food and good selection of craft beers. They also have a selection of beers they brew themselves. The beer I had that was brewed in-house was good but not great. Staff is friendly and the vibe mellow.

resp.text: Thanks so much! We can't wait to help you again.

name: paseuth phonthibsvads
text:
I understand that sometimes a place gets busy and that you might not get the same kind of customer service you would normally get during non-holiday hours but I felt like we were the, "Oh yeah! The table in the back.."

We were a party of 7 (4 adults and 3 children) who got seated with minimal wait (about 15 minutes) and waited on within 5 minutes of being seated. All was going well until our waitress was visibly annoyed with the time we were talking looking at the menu to finalize orders, the horrible tasting water arrived, then the hour wait for food that was mostly meat on bread with no sauce or toppings, no silverware or napkins until we asked for them, and a non attentive waitress.

All wasn't bad though cause the table, silverware, and facility was clean. The meats were cooked well and the beers were good. All positive marks for making a great eatery.

To put it simply, this could be a great place cause the beers are good and the grill person knows what they're doing but it needs big improvements on customer service and knowing how to finish a dish.

Oh yeah, and filter the water please.

name: David Wagner
text:
It doesn't matter what is the best thing you have ever tasted, in that moment is it the best possible flavor you can imagine.... The Strawberry Cider is that

WAS doesn't matter, WILL BE will be, but we have IS

resp.text: Thank you so much for allowing us to serve you, David. Till next time!

name: Joseph Martin
text: Friendly staff, good food, great beer selection. Make your own bloody Mary station

resp.text: Thank you! We really appreciate your generosity. It's always nice to know that we are moving in the right direction.

name: Joseph Martin
text: Friendly staff, good food, great beer selection. Make your own bloody Mary station

resp.text: Thank you! We really appreciate your generosity. It's always nice to know that we are moving in the right direction.

name: Jillian Shackelford
text: We sat out from on the patio for lunch on a Saturday afternoon—I had a pint of their Space Parts Bud (NE IPA) and was very pleased. The fish and chips left a lot to be desired.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave this review!

name: Lacy Berry
text: Their service has improved tenfold over my last experience. Glad I gave it another try! I've always loved their food, so no complaints there either.

name: Rachael M
text: The food and service is always top notch! My boyfriend and I have eaten here many times and have never had a bad experience! We love the wings and onion rings! Highly recommended :)

name: Denny Hoefle
text: Service was ridiculous slow. A group of 5 people served one at with meals coming 10 to 15 minutes apart. Never again

name: Robert Ferguson
text: I am so glad I was able to try this place! The fish and chips was amazing! The beer was wonderful. This is one place that I would gladly make a road trip just to go back to. If you are in the area do yourself a solid and go by and have a great craft beer and some delicious grub!!!!

name: Delaney Jones
text: I went here last night with a group of friends as we were encouraged to try it out. We arrived at 8:00pm and there was a wait but most places seemed like there were wait times so we didn’t mind waiting and having a quick drink at the bar. We were sat at 8:30 outside, which we were thankful about because it was so loud inside. After waiting 20 minutes for a server to come by our table, and watching others get sat and greeted immediately, I went and spoke to the hostess and let her know the situation. I went back to my table and watched inside as it seemed no one knew who was supposed to be taking care of our table. At 9:00 someone finally came by and apologized and said he’d tell the manager what happened and see what he could do for the mess up. No manager ever came by and nothing was done. I was very upset as I’ve worked in a restaurant before and these things happen but you take care of the guests when they do happen. We asked our server for multiple things that he just forgot we asked for. One of my friends finally had to go find some salt on some random table. I am a firm believer of 20% tips but this is one instance 15% didn’t even cut it for me. As far as the food goes, it was delicious! The chef made wonderful burgers and a perfect burrito. Unfortunately, his/her food is accompanied by horrible service and management which made for an unpleasant experience.

name: Nicholas Phillips
text: The beer is really the best part about this place, obviously. Lots of choices and good prices during happy hour. Don't bother ordering the shrimp plate there. It was a ripoff!!! Not nearly enough food for the price and I heard they charge extra for cheese on a burger?? Anyway, I'd recommend just trying the house beers!

name: Aaron Briggs
text: I had a couple of good beers there. The Dixie burger was very tasty too. Solid place, friendly service.

name: Brandon Pepper
text: I had almost given up on Below the Radar. What once was an establishment full of heart and fresh ideas was now apathetic and just going through the motions, until they hired Joshua "Chance" Brown as the manager....if anyone can bring this place back to it's former glory it's Chance. I honestly need to write a separate review just for Chance, but he doesn't have a Google page. I'm excited to see the heights he will take this place. A complete turn around from the last time I visited. We'll done guys

name: Ryan Felty
text: Our first day in Huntsville was delightful topped off with a visit to the local eatery and brew pub, Below the Radar Brewhouse.  I don't know how "below the radar" it is, as the place was packed on a Tuesday night in July. As people who travel quite frequently for work we often visit the local breweries to try local craft beer and food.  Boy, did this place deliver.  They had wonderful selection of 32 draft taps with craft beers from from Alabama to Germany. They even had 5 house made crafts that would delight any lover of craft beer.  The food albeit  bar food in nature, had an upscale feel. The coffee crusted strip was delicious and the fish and chips was on the money.  You will not regret visiting this hidden gem in Huntsville. And I doubt it will remain  "Below the Radar".

name: Sherri House
text: Food is good, drinks are fabulous. Servers are good. Greeting host not so much. He needs to go home! Bit I'll still go back for Sunday brunch.

name: paseuth phonthibsvads
text:
I understand that sometimes a place gets busy and that you might not get the same kind of customer service you would normally get during non-holiday hours but I felt like we were the, "Oh yeah! The table in the back.."

We were a party of 7 (4 adults and 3 children) who got seated with minimal wait (about 15 minutes) and waited on within 5 minutes of being seated. All wasn't bad though cause the table, silverware, and facility was clean. The meats were cooked well and the beers were good. All positive marks for making a great eatery.

To put it simply, this could be a great place cause the beers are good and the grill person knows what they're doing but it needs big improvements on customer service and knowing how to finish a dish.

Oh yeah, and filter the water please.

name: Mike Laws
text: Came in for the first time and it was amazing. The manager Chico went way of his to help us. The staff was awesome and friendly as well. Talk about an awesome beer selection; including their own brewed beers, great local selection and others (over 40 beers on tap), and the food was outstanding. The menu looks great, but i went with the dailey lunch special. A steak gyro (beat gyro I've had in long time) served with a nice side salad. Kudos to the kitchen. I murdered that thing. Definitely will be back.

name: Jace Moo
text: The beer selection and food options are unique for the downtown neighborhood.   The trivia contest is very popular with the customers.

resp.text: Thanks a lot! We appreciate your business and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Hazel Riordan-Veteto
text: Very slow service but good food.

resp.text: Thanks for the review! We're looking forward to making your next experience a great one.

name: Jarred Jackson
text: Best wings ever, great beer, excellent service.

resp.text: Happy to hear it! See you soon.

name: igor malyshev
text: The wings were large although the extra hot is not hot at all. Beer was good and prices not bad, only issue is the staff

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you had a less than stellar experience! Your feedback is important to us, and so is your satisfaction.

name: Alex Springer
text: Went for 50 cent mimosas, which were fantastic. Had to order food to get the deal which makes sense. Food took forever to come to the table and was slightly sub-par. All in all a good experience but I feel like quality and speed of service have dropped over time.

name: David Wagner
text:
It doesn't matter what is the best thing you have ever tasted, in that moment is it the best possible flavor you can imagine.... The Strawberry Cider is that

WAS doesn't matter, WILL BE will be, but we have IS

resp.text: Thank you so much for allowing us to serve you, David. Till next time!

name: Jonathan Lawson
text: Great food and great drink selection

resp.text: Happy to hear it! See you soon.

name: DAN From the SOUTH
text: Awesome environment and friendly staff!!! And of course some of the best beer and steak in downtown Huntsville!!! Also if you don't feel like getting out, they use GrubSouth!!!

name: Jeff Aldredge
text: Outstanding menu....food was well priced for the quality! Happy hour too!

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Jeff, and look forward to serving you again!

name: Delaney Jones
text: I went here last night with a group of friends as we were encouraged to try it out.
