text: I am so glad I was able to try this place! The fish and chips was amazing! The beer was wonderful. This is one place that I would gladly make a road trip just to go back to. If you are in the area do yourself a solid and go by and have a great craft beer and some delicious grub!!!!

name: Brandon Pepper
text: I had almost given up on Below the Radar. What once was an establishment full of heart and fresh ideas was now apathetic and just going through the motions, until they hired Joshua "Chance" Brown as the manager....if anyone can bring this place back to it's former glory it's Chance. I honestly need to write a separate review just for Chance, but he doesn't have a Google page. I'm excited to see the heights he will take this place. A complete turn around from the last time I visited. We'll done guys

name: Chuck Black
text: The grilled trout and filet entrees were excellent tonight. We've eaten there dozens of times and are never disappointed.

resp.text: Happy to hear it! See you soon.

name: Phillip Perry
text: We always host our socials here for work. Great food, great beer, and great service.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We really appreciate it!

name: Joy Porter
text: We love BTR! They have a huge selection of beer, so you get more options than at any of the local breweries, and on top of that you get amazing food choices too. I love their rainbow trout with cheese grits and a fried green tomato on top. They also have great burgers and other lighter fare too. With live music and trivia nights it's a great spot for good beer (or wine!), food, and entertainment all in one.

name: Roy Parker
text: The beer selection is great. The steak and mushroom wrap was delicious. I would highly recommend this place. Its downtown so parking is one thing to consider.

name: Hope Seeley
text: One of my favorite places to hang out. The staff is always friendly and get to know you my name. The burgers are delicious and the beer menu is extensive.

name: Alex Springer
text: Went for 50 cent mimosas, which were fantastic. Had to order food to get the deal which makes sense. Food took forever to come to the table and was slightly sub-par. All in all a good experience but I feel like quality and speed of service have dropped over time.

name: GA Deplorable
text: Fabulous menu. Had trout for the first time. Excellent! The burgers are amazing. The brewpub atmosphere makes this restaurant one of a kind. Always visit when I'm in Huntsville.

name: Justin Clark
text: Great food and great beer. Good selection of cocktails. Service always seems to be a little slow though. And it's hard to leave without spending a pretty penny. Highly recommend though.

name: Christopher Niebylski
text:
Deep beer list of Below the Radar offerings and other rotating taps.

Big portion bar food with standard fare.

Friendly staff.
Avoid the small secondary dining room if you can, it feels pretty isolated.

name: Blair Gulledge
text: This bar was amazing. We came to Huntsville for the March for Truth march and hiked at Monte Sano after. Once we were done hiking, we found this place and were very pleased. Great service. Great food. Vegetarian friendly. And the Humble Cheese Bites were the best thing I've eaten in a long time. AND they had the soccer match on so we could watch while we ate. We don't get to go to many bars in Alabama and watch our favorite sport. Thank you, we can't wait to come back!

name: Taylor Allen
text: Great food.. Try the mac and cheese bites! Extensive Bourbon and American whiskey collection, great beers on tap and in bottle, and good entree choices. Service and speed of food coming from kitchen was impeccable.

name: Sha-Meika Smith
text: I have so many great things to say about this place! The food, the beer, the company, all great! And who cares that I'm a little biased because I work there too! If anything that should tell you that it's pretty great cuz how many people actually like where they work?? An ever growing number of people. So if you don't like your job and you need a drink and some good company, stop by! ☘️

name: AU Link
text: They have truly improve their customer experience, had wonderful appetizers, the wings were amazing, rib eye was excellent and the cheesecakes are the best I've ever had.

resp.text: Thank you for your business! We're glad we exceeded your expectations.

name: Jennifer Baizel
text: Music trivia night was disruptive to my experience personally. The beer selection was fantastic and I enjoyed trying their brews. Normally not a slaw person but I enjoyed the poblano slaw on the Dixie burger.

name: Stephanie Vasse
text: Honestly not as good as I hoped it would be. I had the burger with a fried green tomato, slaw, and spicy goat cheese. My burger was overcooked and didn't have much flavor, and the toppings didn't do much for the burger itself. Half of the fries were overcooked too. The other folks at my table had varying degrees of success - fish and chips were good but expensive, Cuban sandwich was so-so. Bread pudding for dessert was too sweet in my opinion but others at the table enjoyed it. Overall, not a bad food experience but not amazing.

name: Jonathan Lawson
text: Great food and great drink selection

resp.text: Happy to hear it! See you soon.

name: Jeff Aldredge
text: Outstanding menu....food was well priced for the quality! Happy hour too!

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Jeff, and look forward to serving you again!

name: Nathan Bellows
text:
Meh, the service was lacking. Our server seemed upset with us which is never a good trait to have...he probably should just be back in the kitchen if he's going to act like he's got a chip on his shoulder.
Food was mediocre, nothing that stood out. The icing on the cake was that we ordered a kids cheeseburger but got a $1 upcharge for the cheese...and my wife got the portobello with cheese, and got a $1 upcharge for the cheese. I mean what the heck dude?

Finally, the beer prices are too high...they charged $6.50 for a 10oz pour.

Made no sense to us and we won't be back.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback Nathan! We hope you'll give us another try to make your next experience a fantastic one.

name: Chuck Black
text: The grilled trout and filet entrees were excellent tonight. We've eaten there dozens of times and are never disappointed.

resp.text: Happy to hear it! See you soon.

name: DeeAnn Kizziah
text: We met friends there for brunch .  At first, I thought the service was bad.  The place was slammed.  Every table was full.  The two waiters that I saw were moving like trains.  One of the owners was I'm house also.  Food was great but service was amazing considering the patron to server ratio!  Those two guys need a raise.  Hopefully the owners will look at this and realize they need to hire more like them.

name: Bruce Woody
text: Brunch here is awesome here, I would recomend it to anyone!

resp.text: Thanks Bruce, we hope to serve you again soon!

name: Phillip Perry
text: We always host our socials here for work. Great food, great beer, and great service.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We really appreciate it!

name: Dean Adams
text: Had an amazing experience. I am not a beer drinker but I didn't have much choice of where to eat. My expectations where middle of the road at best. Boy was I wrong! Food was off the Charts Amazing. The Service was amazing. If you are lucky enough as i was to have Amelia be your server, it will make your experience that much better. Can't Wait to go back!!!!

name: Greg Cook
text: Great micro brewery. Good food and great service.

resp.text: Thank you for your business, Greg! We're glad we exceeded your expectations.

name: Stephanie Vasse
text: Honestly not as good as I hoped it would be. I had the burger with a fried green tomato, slaw, and spicy goat cheese. My burger was overcooked and didn't have much flavor, and the toppings didn't do much for the burger itself. Half of the fries were overcooked too. The other folks at my table had varying degrees of success - fish and chips were good but expensive, Cuban sandwich was so-so. Bread pudding for dessert was too sweet in my opinion but others at the table enjoyed it. Overall, not a bad food experience but not amazing.

name: Connor Anderson
text: Great friendly staff with good food and beer!

resp.text: Thanks Connor, we hope to serve you again soon!

name: nicole williams
text: Service was great from our server. He was very attentive to our needs. The food was decent and the bread pudding was awesome!

name: bev bauer
text: Food was delicious beer was tasty servers top-notch.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your great review! Please give us the opportunity to serve you again soon!

name: Nikki McKenzie
text: Absolutely amazing brunch and mimosas!!! Leslie is a spectacular server and the new manager is stellar! To be a manager and go buss tables was in my opinion what a manager should be. Nothing beneath him! We will be back!

name: AJ Werner
text: This place has a great selection of beers on tap and in bottle from all over Alabama and abroad. Their food is very good too and has a southern flair for comfort.  Stop by frequently as their beer selection rotates and don't forget to check out the live music scene!

name: Richard Powell
text: Best wings in town and best service

resp.text: Thank you for your business! We're glad we exceeded your expectations.

name: johnna Lemelle
text: Good food at reasonable prices.

resp.text: Hi Johnna, we really appreciate your feedback and such kind words! We're looking forward to serving you again.

name: Patrick Moffatt
text:
First beer (a sour), was good and would bite like it should every drink. Asked for another and it wasn't the same beer. My girlfriend was drinking the same and agreed it was different. So I was either served a different beer or their quality control needs some work. Server said it was probably from a different part of the keg....never heard of such a thing.
Food was good, service was good until after the food was served. Never saw the server again after that. Had to go find someone else to get the check. Was told he was busy on the other side, but the place was nearly empty when we walked out.

name: Fred Wiles
text: Decent and diverse enough selection of beers, with good bar food. If they're going to limit Groupons to their beers, they need to really step up their game, and improve the quality and types of their beers. I'd go again.

name: Fredrick Gransee
text: A friend and I went for Sunday Brunch. We sat at the bar, and friends trickled in joining us...we ended up with a party of 8 at one point...the whole staff were great, We had the trout and cheezy grits which was perfect, my friend loved the Mimosa special...all and all it was a perfect experience and would recommend their bar and restaurant to anyone from a person new to the area to a family brunch with kids and Grandma after church!

name: Victoria Greer
text: Love the brunch menu!

resp.text: Thank you so much for allowing us to serve you, Victoria. Till next time!

name: Shawn Hoban
text: Food was great, service was a bit slow. It was a busy Sunday afternoon and they appeared to be under staffed

resp.text: Thank you so much for your great review! Please give us the opportunity to serve you again soon!

name: Heath Williams
text: Good food , lunch menu is very limited.   Nice atmosphere

resp.text: Thanks so much! We can't wait to help you again.

name: Ashley Phillips
text: Great food and atmosphere!

name: Roby Dorsett
text: This food is great!  Beer selection is phenomenal.  One of the best burgers in town.  This place has a fantastic chef and the lunch prices are very reasonable.  They even have homemade ketchup!!!

name: Quartina Trafford
text: The manager Tabitha was very unprofessional. We came in as a large group without a reservation.  We told the server we were on a time crunch so we will only order items that could be prepared quickly.  The food took over an hour for fish and chips. The fries were cold. The manager came and instead of being apologetic she put the blame on us for showing up without a reservation.  Her tone with us was unacceptable. I've visited this restaurant before but never again unless she is no longer employed here.

name: Mike Young
text: Staff is friendly and the food tastes good, but is super overpriced. Arrive about 7pm and it was seat yourself, so we did but it took quite a while for a server to come to the table. When we finally got a server and ordered it took over 10 minutes to just get our drinks and the restaurant was maybe 1/4 full at best. Beer brewed in house is alright, not the best and not the worst. We all got flights and were told they were a flat $5 that day, but when the check came all the flights had a $1 up-charge that we weren't told about when we ordered. $1 isn't much but the principal of the server not telling us there was an up-charge before we order is a very poor business practice. We didn't ask or fight it because we just wanted to leave. The cheese balls are so-so tasting, they were actually pretty bland, Craft Mac & Cheese tastes better and at over $1 per item they definitely aren't worth it. The wings are ok but again, at over $1 per super tiny wing they aren't worth it either (6 for $6.99). Got the onion rings too, and you guessed it - over $1 per item (actually $1.40/item). The onion rings are $7 for 5 rings and they tasted the best of what we order but are just too expensive.

name: Aaron Nguyen
text: Subpar service, forgets items ordered.

resp.text: Hello Aaron, we appreciate you taking the time to write this review, and would appreciate the opportunity to earn your business back in the future.

name: Joey Rogers
text: I really like the brunch/breakfast food.  Dinner is pretty good.  Their onion rings are the best.  Great selection of beer.

name: Teresa Zimmerman
text: I went here for lunch for the first time and had such great service! The pesto dressing on my salad was amazing, and it was enough for two meals!

name: Sarah Oglesby
text: It was a really great experience. Just enough service and not over bearing.

resp.text: Thank you Sarah! We really appreciate your generosity. It's always nice to know that we are moving in the right direction.

name: Casy Kovach
text: A great place to grab a beer with some friends. The food is good, but nothing mind-blowing. Same with the service. But the beer list makes this place well worth a visit!

name: Matthew Methe
text: Food was pretty good but service was a bit slow

resp.text: Happy to hear it! See you soon.

name: Sean Tobin
text: Good drinks, fast service. Food was sub par. Ordered cheesy potato casserole and it was very mushy.

resp.text: Hello Sean, we're sorry to hear about your experience, but we appreciate you taking time to give us feedback. We hope you'll consider giving us another chance to serve you.

name: Bridget Brooke
text: Favorite spot to bring out-of-towners

resp.text: Thank you! We really appreciate your generosity. It's always nice to know that we are moving in the right direction.

name: Carl Weimer
text: Fun, nice place. Reasonably priced. Parking kinda sucks.

resp.text: I appreciate your feedback, Carl, and look forward to serving you again!

name: Leslie Losier
text: Good food and service, and the beers were tasty! This brewery supports other local brewers by selling their beers in addition to BTR offerings. The 4-star rating is only because the was one loud group making the noise level become uncomfortable. Otherwise a good experience and I will revisit next time I'm in Huntsville

name: Ruby Winkles
text:
Great food n service.  First time going there n had a lot of fun
Room was a little chilly

name: Thomas Overall
text: Good food , beer and mixed drinks.  Nice place to meet up with friends. Employee's are very polite and respectful. Had a lot of fun.

name: Billy Stanfill
text: They have the best onion rings!!! All the food is amazing !!! Everything I've tried has been wonderful!!! Endless beer selections!!! Great desserts too!!!  I absolutely love this place! The service is amazing! Devron always takes care of me!

name: Evan
text: I enjoyed their brews and the fish and chips was really good. Over all this place had good service and an enjoyable atmosphere.

name: Drew Winstel
text: I've been to BTR a lot over the years (100+ check-ins on Untappd). The food definitely seems to have taken a step down. The fish and chips were unevenly seasoned (one bite pure paprika and then 5 bites that are bland as can be). The Cajun rub wings were unseasoned on one side, and one of my 12 was undercooked. The beer (I had the No Accidents grapefruit NEPA) was quite tasty and easily the best part of the meal.

resp.text: We pride ourselves on our hospitality, and it sounds like we failed here. We’re really sorry to hear about your unsatisfactory experience.

name: Julie Blair
text: Had some wine, it was good. They also make mac and cheese bites

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We really appreciate it!

name: S T
text: Great brunch! Probably one of the best in town. Fast service even on Father's Day. Good beer selection for a Sunday meal. Would eat here again

name: Megan Appleby
text: Great food! Tons of seating room! Craft beer list a mile long.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Dean Adams
text: Had an amazing experience. I am not a beer drinker but I didn't have much choice of where to eat. My expectations where middle of the road at best. Boy was I wrong! Food was off the Charts Amazing. The Service was amazing. If you are lucky enough as i was to have Amelia be your server, it will make your experience that much better. Can't Wait to go back!!!!

name: Andy Lenell
text: Good service and food.  Very nice staff

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We really appreciate it!

name: Dan Williams
text: Such a cool place for brews and brunch!

resp.text: I appreciate your feedback, Dan, and look forward to serving you again!

name: Jonathan Glennon
text: Had the fish and chips with the New England Pale Ale. Very nice.

name: Tom Chapman
text: Grateful selection of beer and wonderful food. This was my first time and when one of the servers found that out, he took the time to walk me thru the beer menu. My main server was patient with my questions and made a great food recommendation. Hope to be back in town to try more food and beer here.

name: Benny Parson
text: Love this place. Have to stop in each trip through Huntsville. Highly recommend the chips and queso.

name: Chris Moore
text: Excellent pub atmosphere with a wide variety of beers on draft including a good amount of local craft beers. They also have their own brewery on premises.  The food selection ranges from fantastic bar food with a twist to some of the best steaks in Huntsville.

name: Wendi Gibbs
text: The food is great at this place and it is usually busy!  I have had better food and craft beer at a lower price point, but still a must stop when visiting Huntsville.

name: Fields Ferguson
text: We loved this restaurant! My wife got the burger, which she thought was great, and I️ had the Cuban Panini, which I️ loved! The fries were hand-cut and delicious. I️ don’t know if they have a certain lunch menu for each day, but I️ would say it would be good to add a couple more options to the lunch menu.

name: Eric Patterson
text: I love this place. The sriracha wings are great. The Dixie burger is amazing. Everything I've tried here is very good. Awesome beer list too.

name: Knud Hermansen
text: Their local beers are decent. Prices are typical for where I come from in Denver. Good guest tap menu and friendly staff.

name: Bill Binkley
text: Great atmosphere. The staff is great and the food is very good.

name: Nathan White
text:
Great place with great food! A little diss
Appointed to not have all beers listed in stock, but good beers at great places tend to have that occurence. Food was served hot and the staff was friendly and very knowledgable about pairings of drink and food and beer substitutions. Found a new beer that I like now!

name: rakan huneidi
text: I came for bunch on Sunday. 8$ for a large mimosa. It was great I had the southern style Benedict. It was perfect. Not many options in this city but this one makes up for it.

name: Japheth Jones
text: Great spot. Great service and really good food and beer selection.

resp.text: Thanks! We appreciate the review and hope to see you soon!

name: Matthew Gonzalez
text: Really nice comfortable place downtown, lots of different beer selections and tasty food

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We really appreciate it!

name: Lyann Goncalves
text:
We went there as the last stop on the brewery trail and they didnt have the bottle openers that we should have gotten as a prize. Instead the bartender made us order drinks and kept putting off giving us the stamp and opener. First he said we needed to pay our bill and when we did he still wouldn't give it to us because he was "busy" serving the 4 other people at the bar.

Found out as we are about to leave that he doesn't have any, KNEW he didnt have any and was sassy about it. Just not nice.

resp.text: Hi Lyann, thank you for your feedback. We appreciate you taking the time to leave a review, and hope you'll give us another chance.

name: Marchelle cole-staley
text: Very good food, and excellent service.

resp.text: Hi Marchelle, we really appreciate your feedback and such kind words! We're looking forward to serving you again.

name: David Klein
text: Great food...great staff...yummy!

resp.text: Thanks! We appreciate the review and hope to see you soon!

name: Travis
text: Brew house and tap house with tasty bistro food.  A good place to grab a beer and have dinner, with good service.  Does get a little busy at times but they seem to handle it well.

name: Chris Pucci
text: Food was good. Great beer selection.  Had a new waiter, didn't know all the food or beer very well,  but it was fine.

name: Andy Bryce
text:
Ordered the Cajun Ribeye Steak and it was fantastic! I was amazed at how comparable it was to fine steakhouses that charge twice as much!

Thanks to the staff, Marcus and the head chef, Brett for the warm welcome and excellent service!

Cheers, Andy.

name: J Frost
text: Walked in at 6:45, out after 8. Wasn't crazy busy but they were slow getting food out.  Burger was over cooked,  hummus was disappointing,  they don't tell u but their ketchup has jalapenos blended in it. BLT wasnt great.  Strawberry shortcake was very good. Large selection of beers and other liquors.  I won't go back. It was just OK.  3drinks, an app,  2sandwiches and dessert was $60

name: April Clark
text: I was really surprised at the food quality at Below the Radar. It was SO delicious! Order the filet, you will not be disappointed.

name: thagishu tharau
text: This was so yummy! I loved the outside seating.

resp.text: Hi Thagishu, we really appreciate your feedback and such kind words! We're looking forward to serving you again.

name: Cathy Kearney
text: Our party of six was seated at 12:30 and we walked out at around 2:20.  Our server was pretty late getting to the table for drink orders so we ordered drinks and food at the same time. Two of us ordered a beer. Thirty minutes later, we were told they were out of that beer, so we ordered another. Meanwhile, no food. We’re talking six sandwiches, two of them grilled cheese. Drink refills incredibly slow in coming.  Beers finally arrived. In the meantime, we watched two tables seated, served, and turned over right next to us. Also noted there were several empty tables so they weren’t as busy as we’ve seen. So, still no food after another thirty minutes. Asked to speak to a manager who said things get busy on Saturday and it’s St. Patrick’s Day, etc., and seemed rather perturbed as if we had nothing to complain about. Didn’t offer to comp the drinks or anything like that, did not say she was sorry for our wait, and said she’d check on the food. Watched lots of food coming out of the kitchen, unfortunately none of it ours. So, we finally walked out hungry a little shy of 2:30. Very sad as we like BTR very much and have been coming here for years and have never had this kind of experience before. It will be while before we return again.

name: Erica Stewart
text: Food was average. Had a burger. Nothing to rave about, just a decent burger. service was good and attentive.

name: Cassandra Osborne
text: After researching several local menus I picked Below the Radar based on their chicken burrito. It was so bland it was almost inedible. I requested extra queso hoping it would help and that was tasteless also. I ended up salting all my food just to get the taste of salt at least. By far the worst burrito I've had. I'm only ranking the high three stars because I haven't tried any other items here, but I'm not eager to return after first experience. Bartender acted annoyed everytime I spoke to him and was unfriendly entire dinner.

name: john west
text: Went for lunch nice not crowded welcoming service.. Small menu not many choices.

resp.text: I appreciate your feedback, John, and look forward to serving you again!

name: Shamika Curry
text: Great service..very friendly staff

resp.text: Hi Shamika Curry, we really appreciate your feedback and such kind words! We're looking forward to serving you again.

name: John Raynes
text:
Hit up BTR because my usual haunt was unfortunately closed today. Got a burger and had to wait about 25-30 minutes (normally wouldn't mind but I was on my lunch break).

Wait was worth it though, damn good burger with hands-down the best fries in Huntsville. They taste like they cut it the moment I ordered it. Probably why it took so long.

Damn good food. Definitely worth checking out.

name: Chandler Mabry
text:
Best wings.

Still the best wings update 7/13/2019

name: Christian Leach
text: Excellent service from our waiter. The other staff seemed a bit frustrated and people's orders kept getting mixed up around us.

resp.text: Thank you! We really appreciate your generosity. It's always nice to know that we are moving in the right direction.

name: Jim Mii
text: A favorite place whenever in Huntsville. Last three visits progressively worse. Last night, no tap beer...at a brew pub.  Chicken wings were size of quail legs.  Smallest I ever saw in an establishment and 14 bucks for 12.  Also ketchup based wing sauce , horrible.  The Jim  Beam made it tolerable but wont be back.  Too bad.

name: Michael Melman
text: Great beer selection, staff and food.  Just don't get the fish and chips.  There is better stuff on the menue.

name: Izavier Maye
text: When I went to Huntsville to visit, this place was just simply amazing. Service was friendly and quick and beer was great. No problem for me.

name: Debra Shaw
text: Food was alittle blan but excellent service

resp.text: Thanks Debra Shaw, we hope to serve you again soon!

name: Devil Dinosaur
text: Staff was amazing, beer was great and the food was on another level....burger was one of the best I've ever had.

resp.text: Hi Devil, we really appreciate your feedback and such kind words! We're looking forward to serving you again.

name: Marcel Girgis
text: I had a great experience! We had a 5 course meal with paired beverages for 40$ a person. It was very memorable. Good acoustics, nice bar, and several seating benches as well as a variety of IPAs and craft beer.

name: andrew fontes
text: Great vibes!! Good food. A little pricey but definitely worth it!!

resp.text: Thanks! We appreciate the review and hope to see you soon!

name: Jeffrey Miller
text: Great food and staff. They offer a great selection of beers and liquor. I recommend the wings above anything else.

name: Brittanie Coleman
text: Excellent food is the only reason I'm giving stars bc our waiter was so busy cleaning up his section that he forgot our friend's entree sitting in the window.We ended up having to go up to him and ask for it bc he never came back to check on us. By that time his bun was super hard and the rest wasnt fresh. They had to remake it.

name: Latrick Turner
text: Food is great. Drinks are great. Entertainment leaves more to be desired, but overall this is a great little spot. Try the chicken wings. You won't be disappointed

name: Alanna Owenby
text: We went about an hour before closing and stayed until after close. Through the entire drinks and meal our waiter was fun and friendly. Try the Stone Xococoal (probably butchered that.) Was pricey but still worth it.

name: Chris Gorman
text: The x burger was great as was our service

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words, Chris. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Camillia King-Stanley
text: Great food, great service and great fellowship! One of my favorite place for dining in or carryout.

name: Dave Kwit
text: Food was good.  Server seemed distracted for a slow Sunday evening.  I will come back for the food, and hope to find that I just got this server on a bad day.

name: Sarah Eledui
text:
This is a cool place to hang out with friends, and the back room we were seated in was really nice and quiet. We enjoyed being there, but the food just wasn't that great either of the two times I've been there.
This most recent time, I ordered the Diablo Chicken Burrito "nacho style". The tortilla chips were hard and tasted like stale frying oil, and the chicken was very dry. The "Diablo" cheese sauce wasn't that spicy and it just didn't taste very good. A little bit of a letdown.
I ordered the "Keep it Creamy, Huntsville" beer, and it was good.

name: Becka Lang
text: Great food, great service

name: Kyle Graves
text: This is my favorite place to get good craft beer in Huntsville, and the food is terrific as well.  The in-house brews are good in their own right, and many local and not-so-local beers are on draft and/or stocked in bottles.  Great atmosphere, good for a date or grabbing a beer with the guys.

name: John Sullivan
text: Place was OK but it felt pretty weird getting chastized for reaching across the bar for napkins minutes after our food was served. Will go elsewhere from now on.

resp.text: Mr Sullivan, my name is Chance and I am the general manager of Below The Radar. I sincerely apologize for your experience last night and was wondering if I may speak with you directly? If you would give me this opportunity, I am easily reached at the restaurant at 256-469-6617. Thank you.

name: Ajay Kumar
text: Awesome place to dine and have a nice drink. So many options for in house beer options. Must try.

name: David Swager
text: Good food and good beer.  Was disappointed in beer selection.  Lots on the menu but too many very similar beers.  Might have been a fluke that day.

name: Darryl Crabtree
text: Food was ok Craft beer wasn't for me. Good atmosphere need to work on food and mixed drinks.

name: Justin McCarty
text: Come here every time I’m in Huntsville. Love the food, beer, and atmosphere. Their in-house brews are exceptional and staff is amazing.

name: Michael James
text: The interior is small and dark and I’m sure the ceilings are lower than they should be.  This darkness is cut by bright movements of sports on television, giving the place a depressing sports bar vibe.  There is, at least, a small patio out front. They feature 4 of their own beers on tap, as well as 20 more, the focus mostly on American "craft" beer.  I sampled two house beers, a milky white "Pilsner" that smelled like a yeast starter, and an amber-brown "Pale" ale that smelled like wort.

name: Beverly Lang
text: Great atmosphere. Food is awesome. Fantastic list of beverages.

name: Jean P
text: Amazing service and the food is to die for! Actually in town for 2 days, and had dinner at this fabulous place both nights. The chef is amazing and the choices in beer were refreshing. What a great little find in Huntsville, AL!

name: Jeff Olson
text: Great waitress, Lindsey! Always great food.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We really appreciate it!

name: Alex Willoughby
text: Get the Cajun Ribeye and prepare yourself for the best dining experience in Huntsville. Would recommend this steak over anything I've had at Connor's. They also have an EXCELLENT selection of beer.

name: Joe O'Mara
text: The appetizers were amazing! The building layout was a bit confusing though, perhaps signs could help.

resp.text: Thank you for your business! We're glad we exceeded your expectations.

name: Lloyd Christmas
text: We had the daily special, salmon with grits. The salmon was perfectly cooked and the waiter helped me fond a beer to pair with it. Highly recommend this place .

name: Larry Broom
text: One of my favorites to stop by while in huntsville. Always have a good time and great selection of beer and food

name: Felecia Eddins
text: OMG food is amazing. Ask for Thor he is the best server

name: JJ Parsons
text: From the outside looking in, there's not much to see but the food is by far, some of the greatest around the downtown area! Parking is also not ideal, however; there's plenty in nearby areas! Curb appeal is lacking, but the food and adult beverage options are awesome!!!

name: Chuck C
text:
Came here for Father's Day. Waited nearly 60 minutes for brunch food. I ordered the French toast with fresh fruit ans an English muffin all of which were good.
French toast 5/5 fresh fruit 4/5 (raspberries were sour) and English muffin 5/5.
Mimosa refills were prompt enough as was other beverage refills.
When the food came several people from the table complained of it being served cold.

Most of these problems could perhaps be solved by bettee/more staffing.

Beer selection is dope!

name: Don Ebert
text: I've been here a number of times and always enjoyed the visit.  The food and prices are reasonably good and beer selection is fair.  They have their own beers on tap and the IPA is very good. Onion rings are a "go to", but they can keep their goat cheese.  Nothing really stands out on the menu, but the atmosphere is awesome for a casual night out with him, her, or the gang.  There hired help seems to turn over a good bit for whatever reason, but I've always had good service in spite of turnover.  Not "Cheers" for sure, but these kids are working hard for tips.  Joey, the new bar keep from California is very personable and a credit to BTR.  It's a fun layed back place.

name: Cheryl Darby
text: Great beer fantastic food!!! Worse service ever. !!!!

resp.text: We pride ourselves on our hospitality, and it sounds like we failed here. We’re really sorry to hear about your unsatisfactory experience.

name: Stephanie and Dean
text: Everything was good.  Great selection of beer.  Ordered gnocchi and it was not gnocchi,  it was pasta 😣

name: Craig B
text: I am not sure if these high reviews are for the beer or the food?  The beer is great but I have had better food at a football game.  Greasy fish and chips, pre-made hamburger patties(Hardees is way better) and limp fries.  Maybe we ordered wrong, but I am not a fan.

name: Randy Roberts
text: Brunch menu was delicious. And Interesting

resp.text: Thanks Randy, we hope to serve you again soon!

name: Kerry Gould
text: The food was good but I wasn't overwhelmed by the taste.  It might have been just me.  I was with a large party and the the general sense was the same. Overall I would give the place another try.

name: Connie Johnson
text: Good food but small dining area

resp.text: Hi Connie Johnson, thank you for taking time to write a review. We hope you'll give us a chance to make your next experience a 5 star one.

name: zeba iranikhah
text: Great food and prices!!

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave this review!

name: Seth Thompson
text: Just awesome. It's hard not to give a brewpub 5 stars unless they completely suck, and this place is far from suck. The house brews are amazing, and the food is really excellent too.

name: Pamela Kerns
text: Food was great, a little pricey to take the whole family.

name: Tiffany Sevigny
text: Awesome place to eat & grab a beer!! The ambiance was fantastic, food was above par, & they have SO many beer choices. Matt was our waiter, & he was phenomenal!!

name: Jimmy Hillis
text: Nice drink & beer selection. Enjoyed brunch, very good bloody Mary's.

resp.text: Thanks a lot! We appreciate your business and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Deafening Silence
text: 10/10 awesome service and awesome food. Robo makes the best beer in town hands down as well!

name: Paul Everitt
text: A bit noisy but food was good and the service was better than that.

name: Kaylynn G
text: This was our 1st visit to BTR and most definitely not our last! Had the dangerous blonde and the golden god both by BTR and were phenomenal! (We added an orange slice to the dangerous blonde and I personally loved it) The burger was massive and delicious, very well made The wings are the best I've had from panama city all the way to Huntsville. Honestly both of our meals, drinks and our waiter brennon made for an awesome experience! I would highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to splurge on a fantastic meal and great beer.

name: Shanteal Lové
text: Deff below the radar.  Nice place but needs more vegetarian options

name: Paul Spell
text: Great food.  They have a Dixie Burger that's outstanding.  Also a Humble Heart Burger with goat cheese which is really good

name: J.D. Strickland
text: Just attended Father's Day Brunch here and it was my first time here. It was miserable. It took over an hour to get our food when they weren't even particularly busy. We had established a reservation over a week ago, and it still took an unacceptable amount of time for everything to show up. Drinks were refilled twice during the whole ordeal, and even that took a solid 20 minutes to complete (my grandfather had to eat his meal without a drink as they never did bring his water). The food is good (after I sent mine back because it was cold, as it would be if it was under a warmer for 30 minutes or so.), but the wait staff was either undertrained or having some major issues. Unrelated to our experience, but I noticed that other tables were having issues as well. Table behind us received someone else's omelette, table to our right didn't have menus when they sat down, table behind us and to the right had no silverware, and table ahead of us on the right were drinking from Solo cups. All in all, I don't think that this establishment is prepared to serve any sort of rush (place was at 2/3 capacity, maybe), and the wait staff needs some serious training, but the food is good if you ever get it.

name: John H
text: Staff was friendly and very knowledgeable on the beers and menu. Great food, awesome selection. One of my favorite spots in Huntsville.

name: Emily Graham
text: Nice selection of local beers, good food for a bar type place, and surprisingly great deserts! Wonderful place to meet friends for a drink or dinner.

name: Ross Harold
text: The beer was good. Food was greasy. I thought I was getting a healthy tofu stirfry but it seemed to have tons of oil in it. I couldn't even finish it.

name: Michael Vanhook
text: We had brunch so we didn't get to try the regular menu. The food was really good, well cooked, and presented. I also had a flight of the house beers. They were ok but didn't stand out to be a favorite.

name: Tyler Handback
text: The 3 meat breakfast casserole from the brunch menu is amazing.

name: Carol Foster
text: Food is very good.   A little in the high end price wise but super good food!   Excellent place to try local microbrewery beer.

name: Ron Colvard
text: Great food and friendly people. Will visit again when I'm Huntsville!

resp.text: Thanks Ron Colvard, we hope to serve you again soon!

name: Elisabeth Palmer
text: Great food. Great service. Great beer.

name: Luke Kinton
text: Nice place. Great food and the beer selection is awesome.

name: K H
text: Good food, good service and parking can be a challenge. It has a fun environment, however it can be loud when crouded. It's a great place to meet friends for casual dining.

name: Curtis Clemons
text: The beef taco wasn't that great their own hard shell should have been on soft shell but nice atmosphere

name: Faith
text: I've never had a bad experience here. The food is great and so is the staff.

name: Mary Gann
text: This little gem is one not to miss..They stay busy..Nice friendly staff..Lots of different kinds of beer to choose from..Food was really good..Will be back..

name: Hot-headed Trinity
text: Awesome place for food and fun. Great staff.

name: Andrew A.
text: I ordered fries with a steak wrap. The wrap was good, the fries were really old and barely warm.

name: Janice Plasterer
text: Their BLT was awesome and so were the homade chips.  I also had a honey apple hard cider that I really liked.

name: Nath
text: Friendly staff, there's a great pint to be had here !

resp.text: Hi Nath, we really appreciate your feedback and such kind words! We're looking forward to serving you again.

name: Drew Bonham
text: Service was crummy but great food and great beer

name: Robert Newton
text: Great food and awesome beer selection.  This is definitely a gem.

name: christopher van namen
text: Awesome place to grab a beer and hang out with friends.

name: Southern Reclaimed Salvage Barn
text: Great selection of food, brews and drinks! All around great service too!

name: Jamie Simonsen
text: Great staff, great good and awesome beer selection

name: Christine Bolz
text: Service was good. Most of the food was good, but my request for a medium rare  burger was delivered well done.

name: AJ Floied
text: Ordered a few brews and had the filet special. The steak was incredibly flavorful and almost sliceable with a fork.

name: Paul Hudson
text: Great beer selection. Food seems a little pricy at first but the probs you get make up for it. Brunch is also fantastic here

name: Abby Pepper Abernathy
text: Cool atmosphere & great live music! Food menu selection is slim.

name: sharpenedge
text: Cozy little place. Everyone that's served us has had a great attitude. The food is delicious. No complaints.

name: Angela Saint
text: Food was ok. Service was not good.  Waiter acted like we were bothering him by waiting on us.

resp.text: Hi Angela , we're sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations. We hope that you'll consider giving us another chance in the future.

name: Jonathan
text: Great beer selection and the cooks can throw down with the best of them. Pro tip try the Cajun rub rib eye.

name: Matthew “Matt S”
text: The food cost for some items are high. Fish and chips are probably your best price.  Beer is high. I don't like the fact that anything 8% alcohol or more is only served in an 10 ounce cup.

name: Aaron Reeves
text: The atmosphere and food are good but the menu has not changed much over the last couple of years. They do have a good selection of beer.

name: William Moore
text:
Sunday Brunch
Biscuits and gravy were good. The omelet was dry, overdone, and could have used any amount of seasoning. The French toast was soggy from sitting with syrup on it before it got to the table and its aftertaste was entirely absent.

The atmosphere is loud like a bar since all surfaces are hard and reflect the noise. A couple of loud conversations render the person next to you unintelligible.

name: Gail Christian
text: Wonderful surroundings/atmosphere, our server was attentive, and the food was delicious!  My choice of entree was spicy, so that's something to be aware of, if you don't like spicy foods; you might want to ask your server if it is.

name: Mariana
text: Great food, service, and an excellent selection of beers. I always recommend this great place to friends.

name: Yvette Skinner
text: Glad we gave it a try.  I was worried about the negative reviews but we had a great meal. We went early in the evening before the live band started. If the band had been playing we would have walked out the door. This place is way too small for a live band. I tried a beer flight with all local brews and enjoyed it. The lamb chops were delicious but not a generous portion. Service was fast and friendly. Would return as long as no band is playing.

name: Austin Craft
text: Very fantastic beer selection. I had the lamb chops and they were absolutely amazing. I plan on coming back for sure!

name: Taylor Link
text: Very friendly staff, great beer selection!

name: Bill Kemp
text: Very good food, large beer selection. Highly recommend this place

name: Emily Caffrey
text: Had dinner here with large group of out of town guests, and it was a disaster. Management decided to put a brand new waiter on table of 20 with separate checks. Took forever to get food and then billing system went down and we were kept for an hour! Came back for brunch, and food was bad- clearly old meat casserole and a tiny cinnamon roll. Plus they got our beer wrong. I want to like them, but after 2 bad experiences I just can't recommend. Go to Straight to Ale instead!

name: Lee Chadwick
text: They have great sandwiches with goat cheese from Humble Heart  Farm

name: Mark Hammond
text: Service was slow in spite of the small crowd. Food was good. Wait staff was professional.

name: Lauren Hefley
text: Awesome food and great beer choices!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We really appreciate it!

name: Michael Alexander
text: Very nice place and friendly staff. Josh is great

name: Justin Terry
text: Very good hamburgers!

resp.text: I appreciate your feedback, Justin, and look forward to serving you again!

name: Closed Yahoo
text:
Sat for 15 minutes without getting offered even a water, so we left.

Beer and food menu looked great, as far as font and such.  How it tastes I WOULD NOT KNOW.

Looks like a fun place though.

name: Anna Townsend
text: Vegetarians actually have a choice of dishes! Brilliant.

name: Elizabeth Powell
text: Food was great, service was awesome. Nice atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Onion rings, burgers, French dip was all perfectly done.

name: Taylor Von Terror Pinup
text: Great food and beer, laid back environment great service.

name: Bob B
text: Excellent burger and some very good local brews, including some porters and stouts (not a given in today's IPA-mad world). It's worth a visit if you're in town.

name: Bubba
text: This place has a pretty good selection of beer.  I tasted some butter in the Bee-Yatch Blonde - butter taste in beer is not good.  Not a fan. The food here is pretty solid bar fare.  I have had good beer here in the past so I will most likely return.

name: Thomas Ray
text: Food was  very good and the atmosphere was comfortable and relaxed. Nice beer selection ,including local beews.

name: Michael Rice
text: Nice place downtown with good food and good beer selection...

name: Andrea Morris
text: Onion rings are amazing......slow service and just ok food beyond that...definitely not worth the wait

name: Paul Cipollone
text: Good food, great beer selection...what else do you need?

name: Katie Buffington
text: It was pretty good. We went early, I understand it get crowded later.

name: Tony N.
text: We went there for Farther's Day. The food was very good. They have more than traditional bar foods like burgers and sandwiches. I had the glazed pork chop and it was excellent. Also had a weissen bier on draft which was very good. Service was equally awesome. Manager and waiter were super friendly. Prices were reasonable. I would go there again.

name: Kris Kasprzak
text: great pub style restaurant with a good local beer

name: Haley Williams
text: Food is always cold, and I mean ALWAYS. We come strictly for the cheap mimosas because that’s about all you can count on at this place. I left my purse one time and they swore they couldn’t find it until I enlightened them on the police report I had to file due to my social being in there.. got a call 10 minutes later saying that it was found. But the last straw was today, after paying everybody got their cards back but one girl. We tried to get it back and they swore they didn’t have it, until it magically apeared. Not to mention the staff acted like they didn’t see us when we asked them for the card back. Starting to think that the cheap alcohol is with the goal of people forgetting their things. I’m so serious when I say this place is shady.

name: frank baker
text: Stopped by Below the Radar while I was in town for a business trip. On a Saturday afternoon around 3PM the tables were mostly empty but there was a decent crowd at the bar. What I loved most about Below the Radar was that they had live music - in the middle of the afternoon - that was good! The two-man duo was taking requests from the crowd but also playing into the calm but fun vibe happening. The second thing I loved was my burger. It was cooked perfectly and topped with fried green tomatoes and cajun goat cheese - hello heaven. Not sure I'll be back in Huntville anytime soon but I'll be recommending this to anyone I know going!

I especially enjoyed the 'Make Me Wanna Stout' and the Cuban Panini (Slow roasted pork, deli sliced ham, pickles, Swiss cheese and mustard on Gambino bread).

name: Life Is Brewtiful
text: Ok place to visit. Nothing special or exceptional. Their beers felt a bit uninspired and really didn't do much to convince you to not just order a beer from a different distro brewery. However, I can say that I was surprised to see some of their in house brew styles. Not often do you find a bunch of adjunct heavy cream ales, German wheat lagers, and Continental lagers in an American brewery. My only real complaint is something that they cant really do anything about and that's the lack of parking. Unfortunately that's just kinda what you have to deal with in Huntsville. It's an ok place if you need to kill an hour or so but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit. It's aight.

name: Brooke Graham
text: I go to this place often because I love the beer options and atmosphere, but the service is not always the greatest. I've heard this from others as well, which is unfortunate because it really is a cool place.  I called to place a to-go order the day after Christmas and the girl was rude and said, "We are really busy so it may take a while."  When I asked her how long her "a while" was, she put me on hold for 2-3 minutes, comes back and says, "An hour."  It was 2:30 in the afternoon!  I was curious and walked by to see simply because I was in the area, and it honestly wasn't any busier than I had ever seen before.  Should not take an hour for one to-go charcuterie board.  Doesn't even require cooking!  Just frustrating when service is the one thing that makes you hesitant about going to a restaurant/bar.

name: Tod Palm
text: I'm a beer enthusiast, but had a very poor experiece at BTR Brewhouse. They have an extensive selction of beers on tap, but the menu lacks any description on the flavors or character of each beer. I asked for a stout, and the server recommendd an imperial stout from Denver, which was OK, but arrived as a small 10 oz pour. Then I asked for a pint of Porter, and got the Abita Boubon Street Porter from Louisiana. I'm not sure why they call it a Porter, cause it is not - it's super sweet, like syrup mixed with Bourbon. In short - disgusting. After 2 small sips, I knew I could not drink it, and asked if I could trade it in for a normal brown ale or stout, as this was the only Porter on the menu. "No" was the flat answer. So I fessed up "should have ordered a flight" I said, "to sample the options" - even though the fact they had flights was never mentioned. The answer was still "No" to any exchange. So I did something I've never done before, pocketed the tip, and left a full beer on the counter. It would hae been easy to provide courteous service so I'd be writing a good review, but these guys are jerks. Hopefully they follow thier namesake soon - and disappear completely.

name: Jessica Bishop
text:
The only reason for the 3 stars is the food. The service is HORRIBLE!
My husband and I tried this restaurant for the first time today. My husband got the prime rib, bacon, and potatoes. I got the chocolate gravy and biscuit, hasbrown casserole, and chicken sausage. My husband said his prime rib wasn't good but the other two were good. My food was good but the biscuit definitely could have knocked someone out with how hard it was. The food was good but we wont be back, doesn't seem like they care though because a father and son said that service is horrible every time they go.
